analyzed: yam tam rūpam ajjhattikam tam upādā yam tam rūpam bāhiram tam atthi upādā atthi no upādā  yam tam rūpam ajjhattikam tam upādinna yam tam rūpam bāhiram tam atthi upādinna atthi anupādinna
translated: That form which is internal is clung to; that form which is external is either clung to or not clung to.🔽That form which is internal is affected; that form which is external is either affected or not affected.

original: Yaṁ taṁ rūpaṁ ajjhattikaṁ taṁ upādinnupādāniyaṁ, yaṁ taṁ rūpaṁ bāhiraṁ taṁ atthi upādinnupādāniyaṁ, atthi anupādinnupādāniyaṁ …pe…
analyzed: yam tam rūpam ajjhattikam tam upādinnupādāniya yam tam rūpam bāhiram tam atthi upādinnupādāniya atthi anupādinnupādāniyam pe
translated: That form which is internal is a condition for what is clung to; that form which is external is either a condition for what is clung to or a condition for what is not clung to. …

original: yaṁ taṁ rūpaṁ ajjhattikaṁ taṁ na kabaḷīkāro āhāro, yaṁ taṁ rūpaṁ bāhiraṁ taṁ atthi kabaḷīkāro āhāro, atthi na kabaḷīkāro āhāro.
analyzed: yam tam rūpam ajjhattikam tam na kabaḷīkāraḥ āhāraḥ yam tam rūpam bāhiram tam atthi kabaḷīkāraḥ āhāraḥ atthi na kabaḷīkāraḥ āhāraḥ
translated: That form which is internal is not physical nutriment; that form which is external is either physical nutriment or not physical nutriment.
Thus the form aggregate is threefold.

original: Catubbidhena rūpakkhandho—🔽yaṁ taṁ rūpaṁ upādā taṁ atthi upādinnaṁ, atthi anupādinnaṁ;
analyzed: catubbidhena rūpakkhandho  yam tam rūpam tam atthi upādinna atthi anupādinna
translated: The form aggregate is fourfold:🔽That form which is clinging is either clinging-object or not clinging-object.

original: yaṁ taṁ rūpaṁ no upādā taṁ atthi upādinnaṁ, atthi anupādinnaṁ.🔽Yaṁ taṁ rūpaṁ upādā taṁ atthi upādinnupādāniyaṁ, atthi anupādinnupādāniyaṁ;🔽yaṁ taṁ rūpaṁ no upādā taṁ atthi upādinnupādāniyaṁ, atthi anupādinnupādāniyaṁ.
analyzed: yam tam rūpam no tam atthi upādinna atthi anupādinna  yam tam rūpam upādā tam atthi upādinnupādāniya atthi anupādinnupādāniya  yam tam rūpam no upādā tam atthi upādinnupādāniya atthi an upādinnupādāniya
translated: That form which is not clinging is either clinging-object or not clinging-object.🔽That form which is clinging is either clinging-object connected with clinging or clinging-object not connected with clinging.🔽That form which is not clinging is either clinging-object connected with clinging or clinging-object not connected with clinging.

original: Yaṁ taṁ rūpaṁ upādā taṁ atthi sappaṭighaṁ, atthi appaṭighaṁ;
analyzed: yam tam rūpam tam atthi sappaṭigha atthi appaṭigha
translated: That form which is clinging is either impingement or no impingement.

original: yaṁ taṁ rūpaṁ no upādā taṁ atthi sappaṭighaṁ, atthi appaṭighaṁ.
analyzed: yam tam rūpam no tam atthi sappaṭigha atthi appaṭigha
translated: That form which is not clinging is either impingement or no impingement.🔽That form which is clinging is either gross or subtle.

original: Yaṁ taṁ rūpaṁ upādā taṁ atthi oḷārikaṁ, atthi sukhumaṁ;🔽yaṁ taṁ rūpaṁ no upādā taṁ atthi oḷārikaṁ, atthi sukhumaṁ.
analyzed: yam tam rūpam tam atthi oḷārika atthi sukhuma  yam tam rūpam no tam atthi oḷārika atthi sukhuma
translated: That form which is not clinging is either gross or subtle.🔽That form which is clinging is either far or near.

original: Yaṁ taṁ rūpaṁ upādā taṁ atthi dūre, atthi santike;🔽yaṁ taṁ rūpaṁ no upādā taṁ atthi dūre, atthi santike …pe…
analyzed: yam tam rūpam upādā tam atthi dūre atthi santike  yam tam rūpam naḥ upādā tam atthi dūre atthi santike pe
translated: That form which is not clinging is either far or near.
Form is seen, heard, sensed, and cognized.
That is how the form aggregate is fourfold.
The form aggregate is fivefold:

original: pathavīdhātu, āpodhātu, tejodhātu, vāyodhātu, yañca rūpaṁ upādā.
analyzed: pathavī dhātu āpaḥ dhātu tejaḥ dhātu vāyaḥ dhātu yat ca rūpam
translated: the earth element, the water element, the fire element, the air element, and the form that is clung to.
That is how the form aggregate is fivefold.
The form aggregate is sixfold:

original: cakkhuviññeyyaṁ rūpaṁ, sotaviññeyyaṁ rūpaṁ, ghānaviññeyyaṁ rūpaṁ, jivhāviññeyyaṁ rūpaṁ, kāyaviññeyyaṁ rūpaṁ, manoviññeyyaṁ rūpaṁ.
analyzed: cakkhu viññeyyam rūpa sota viññeyyam rūpa ghāna viññeyyam rūpa jivhā viññeyyam rūpa kāya viññeyyam rūpa manaḥ viññeyyam rūpa
translated: visible form that can be cognized by the eye, visible form that can be cognized by the eye, visible form that can be cognized by the eye, visible form that can be cognized by the eye, visible form that can be cognized by the eye, and visible form that can be cognized by the eye.
That is how the form aggregate is sixfold.
The form aggregate is sevenfold:

original: cakkhuviññeyyaṁ rūpaṁ, sotaviññeyyaṁ rūpaṁ, ghānaviññeyyaṁ rūpaṁ, jivhāviññeyyaṁ rūpaṁ, kāyaviññeyyaṁ rūpaṁ, manodhātuviññeyyaṁ rūpaṁ, manoviññāṇadhātuviññeyyaṁ rūpaṁ.
analyzed: cakkhu viññeyyam rūpa sota viññeyyam rūpa ghāna viññeyyam rūpa jivhā viññeyyam rūpa kāya viññeyyam rūpa manaḥ dhātu viññeyyam rūpa manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu viññeyyam rūpa
translated: visible form that can be cognized by the eye, visible form that can be cognized by the eye, visible form that can be cognized by the eye, visible form that can be cognized by the eye, visible form that can be cognized by the eye, the form element that is the mind base, and the form element that is the mind-consciousness element.
That is how the form aggregate is sevenfold.
The form aggregate is eightfold:

original: cakkhuviññeyyaṁ rūpaṁ, sotaviññeyyaṁ rūpaṁ, ghānaviññeyyaṁ rūpaṁ, jivhāviññeyyaṁ
analyzed: cakkhu viññeyyam sota viññeyyam rūpa ghāna viññeyyam rūpa jivhā viññeyya
translated: visible form that can be cognized by the eye, visible form that can be cognized by the eye, visible form that can be cognized by the eye, visible form that can be cognized by the eye,

original: rūpaṁ, kāyaviññeyyaṁ rūpaṁ atthi sukhasamphassaṁ, atthi dukkhasamphassaṁ, manodhātuviññeyyaṁ🔽rūpaṁ, manoviññāṇadhātuviññeyyaṁ rūpaṁ.
analyzed: kāya viññeyyam rūpam atthi sukha samphassa atthi dukkha samphassa manaḥ dhātu viññeyya  manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu viññeyyam
translated: There is visible form that is to be cognized by the body, which is pleasant, and there is visible form that is to be cognized by the body, which is painful. There is visible form that is to be cognized by the mind element,🔽and there is visible form that is to be cognized by the mind-consciousness element.
Thus the form aggregate is of eight kinds.
The form aggregate is of nine kinds:

original: cakkhundriyaṁ, sotindriyaṁ, ghānindriyaṁ, jivhindriyaṁ, kāyindriyaṁ, itthindriyaṁ, purisindriyaṁ, jīvitindriyaṁ, yañca rūpaṁ na indriyaṁ.
analyzed: cakkhundriya sotindriya ghānindriya jivhindriya kāyindriya itthindriya purisindriya jīvitindriya yat ca rūpam naḥ indriya
translated: the eye faculty, the ear faculty, the nose faculty, the tongue faculty, the body faculty, the femininity faculty, the masculinity faculty, the life faculty, and the form that is not a faculty.
Thus the form aggregate is of nine kinds.
The form aggregate is of ten kinds:

original: cakkhundriyaṁ, sotindriyaṁ, ghānindriyaṁ, jivhindriyaṁ, kāyindriyaṁ, itthindriyaṁ, purisindriyaṁ, jīvitindriyaṁ, na indriyaṁ rūpaṁ atthi sappaṭighaṁ, atthi appaṭighaṁ.
analyzed: cakkhundriya sotindriya ghānindriya jivhindriya kāyindriya itthi indriya purisa indriya jīvitindriya na indriyam rūpaṃ atthi sappaṭigha atthi appaṭigha
translated: the eye faculty, the ear faculty, the nose faculty, the tongue faculty, the body faculty, the femininity faculty, the masculinity faculty, the life faculty, the form that is a faculty and is impingeable, and the form that is a faculty and is not impingeable.
Thus the form aggregate is of ten kinds.
The form aggregate is of eleven kinds:

original: cakkhāyatanaṁ, sotāyatanaṁ, ghānāyatanaṁ, jivhāyatanaṁ, kāyāyatanaṁ, rūpāyatanaṁ,
analyzed: cakkhāyatana sotāyatana ghānāyatana jivhāyatana kāyāyatana rūpāyatana
translated: the eye base, the ear base, the nose base, the tongue base, the body base, the visible-form base,

original: saddāyatanaṁ, gandhāyatanaṁ, rasāyatanaṁ, phoṭṭhabbāyatanaṁ, yañca rūpaṁ anidassanaappaṭighaṁ
analyzed: sadda āyatana gandha āyatana rasa āyatana phoṭṭhabba āyatana yat ca rūpam anidassana appaṭigha
translated: the sound-sphere, the smells-sphere, the tastes-sphere, the tangibles-sphere, and that form which is invisible and non-resistant
and is included in the mental-data-sphere.
Thus the form-group is of eleven kinds.

analyzed: ayam vuccati rūpa kkhandho  vedanā khandha
translated: This is said to be the form-group.🔽… The feeling-group
Herein, what is the feeling-group?
In one way the feeling-group is:
associated with contact.
In two ways the feeling-group is:
there is that with a cause, there is that without a cause.
In three ways the feeling-group is:

original: atthi kusalo, atthi akusalo, atthi abyākato.
analyzed: atthi kusalaḥ atthi akusalaḥ atthi abyākataḥ
translated: there is that which is wholesome, there is that which is unwholesome, there is that which is indeterminate.
In four ways the feeling-group is:

original: atthi kāmāvacaro, atthi rūpāvacaro, atthi arūpāvacaro, atthi apariyāpanno.
analyzed: atthi kāmāvacaraḥ atthi rūpāvacaraḥ atthi arūpāvacaraḥ atthi apariyāpanno
translated: there is that which is in the sense-sphere, there is that which is in the fine-material-sphere, there is that which is in the immaterial-sphere, there is that which is unincluded.
In five ways the feeling-group is:

original: atthi sukhindriyaṁ, atthi dukkhindriyaṁ, atthi somanassindriyaṁ, atthi domanassindriyaṁ, atthi upekkhindriyaṁ.
analyzed: atthi sukha indriya atthi dukkha indriya atthi somanassa indriya atthi domanassa indriya atthi upekkhā indriya
translated: there is the pleasure faculty, there is the pain faculty, there is the happiness faculty, there is the distress faculty, there is the equanimity faculty.🔽Thus the feeling-group is of five kinds.
So the feeling aggregate is of five kinds.
The feeling aggregate is sixfold:

original: cakkhusamphassajā vedanā, sotasamphassajā vedanā, ghānasamphassajā vedanā, jivhāsamphassajā vedanā, kāyasamphassajā vedanā, manosamphassajā vedanā.
analyzed: cakkhu samphassa jā vedanā sota samphassa jā vedanā ghāna samphassa jā vedanā jivhā samphassa jā vedanā kāya samphassa jā vedanā manas samphassa jā vedanā
translated: feeling born of eye contact, feeling born of ear contact, feeling born of nose contact, feeling born of tongue contact, feeling born of body contact, feeling born of mind contact.
This is the sixfold feeling aggregate.
The feeling aggregate is sevenfold:

original: cakkhusamphassajā vedanā, sotasamphassajā vedanā, ghānasamphassajā vedanā, jivhāsamphassajā
analyzed: cakkhu samphassa jā vedanā sota samphassa jā vedanā ghāna samphassa jā vedanā jivhā samphassa jā
translated: feeling born of eye contact, feeling born of ear contact, feeling born of nose contact, feeling born of tongue contact,

original: vedanā, kāyasamphassajā vedanā, manodhātusamphassajā vedanā, manoviññāṇadhātusamphassajā vedanā.
analyzed: vedanā kāya samphassa jā vedanā manaḥ dhātu samphassa jā vedanā manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu samphassa jā vedanā
translated: feeling born of body contact, feeling born of mind element contact, feeling born of mind-consciousness element contact.
This is the sevenfold feeling aggregate.
The feeling aggregate is eightfold:

original: cakkhusamphassajā vedanā, sotasamphassajā vedanā, ghānasamphassajā vedanā, jivhāsamphassajā
analyzed: cakkhu samphassa jā vedanā sota samphassa jā vedanā ghāna samphassa jā vedanā jivhā samphassa jā
translated: feeling born of eye contact, feeling born of ear contact, feeling born of nose contact, feeling born of tongue contact,

original: vedanā, kāyasamphassajā vedanā atthi sukhā, atthi dukkhā, manodhātusamphassajā vedanā,
analyzed: vedanā kāya samphassa jā vedanā atthi sukhā atthi dukkhā manaḥ dhātu samphassa jā vedanā
translated: feeling born of body contact, which may be pleasant or painful, feeling born of mind element contact,

analyzed: manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu samphassa jā vedanā
translated: And the feeling born of contact with the mind-consciousness element.
So the feeling aggregate is of eight kinds.
The feeling aggregate is of nine kinds:

original: cakkhusamphassajā vedanā, sotasamphassajā vedanā, ghānasamphassajā vedanā, jivhāsamphassajā
analyzed: cakkhu samphassa jā vedanā sota samphassa jā vedanā ghāna samphassa jā vedanā jivhā samphassa jā
translated: Feeling born of contact with the eye, feeling born of contact with the ear, feeling born of contact with the nose, feeling born of contact with the tongue,

original: vedanā, kāyasamphassajā vedanā, manodhātusamphassajā vedanā, manoviññāṇadhātusamphassajā
analyzed: vedanā kāya samphassa jā vedanā manaḥ dhātu samphassa jā vedanā manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu samphassa jā
translated: feeling born of contact with the body, feeling born of contact with the mind element, and feeling born of contact with the mind-consciousness element.

original: vedanā atthi kusalā, atthi akusalā, atthi abyākatā.
analyzed: vedanā atthi kusalā atthi akusalā atthi abyākatā
translated: This is of three kinds: wholesome, unwholesome, and indeterminate.
So the feeling aggregate is of nine kinds.
The feeling aggregate is of ten kinds:

original: cakkhusamphassajā vedanā, sotasamphassajā vedanā, ghānasamphassajā vedanā, jivhāsamphassajā
analyzed: cakkhu samphassa jā vedanā sota samphassa jā vedanā ghāna samphassa jā vedanā jivhā samphassa jā
translated: Feeling born of contact with the eye, feeling born of contact with the ear, feeling born of contact with the nose, feeling born of contact with the tongue,

original: vedanā, kāyasamphassajā vedanā atthi sukhā, atthi dukkhā, manodhātusamphassajā vedanā,
analyzed: vedanā kāya samphassa jā vedanā atthi sukhā atthi dukkhā manaḥ dhātu samphassa jā vedanā
translated: feeling born of contact with the body is either pleasant or painful. Feeling born of contact with the mind element,

original: manoviññāṇadhātusamphassajā vedanā atthi kusalā, atthi akusalā, atthi abyākatā.
analyzed: manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu samphassa jā vedanā atthi kusalā atthi akusalā atthi abyākatā
translated: and feeling born of contact with the mind-consciousness element is either wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate.
So the feeling aggregate is of ten kinds.
The feeling aggregate is onefold:
it is associated with contact.
The feeling aggregate is twofold:
there is that which has a cause and that which does not have a cause.

original: Tividhena vedanākkhandho—🔽atthi vipāko, atthi vipākadhammadhammo, atthi nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo.
analyzed: tividhena vedanākkhandho  atthi vipākaḥ atthi vipāka dhamma dhammo atthi neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammo
translated: The feeling aggregate is threefold:🔽there is result, there is a state that has result, there is neither result nor a state that has result.

original: Atthi upādinnupādāniyo, atthi anupādinnupādāniyo, atthi anupādinnaanupādāniyo.🔽Atthi saṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko, atthi asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko, atthi asaṅkiliṭṭhaasaṅkilesiko.
analyzed: atthi upādinnupādāniyaḥ atthi anupādinnupādāniyaḥ atthi anupādinna anupādāniyaḥ  atthi saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ atthi a saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ atthi a saṅkiliṭṭha asaṅkilesikaḥ
translated: There is that which is clung to and has a cause, there is that which is not clung to and has a cause, there is that which is not clung to and does not have a cause.🔽There is that which is defiled and has a cause, there is that which is not defiled and has a cause, there is that which is not defiled and does not have a cause.

original: Atthi savitakkasavicāro, atthi avitakkavicāramatto, atthi avitakkaavicāro.🔽Atthi dassanena pahātabbo, atthi bhāvanāya pahātabbo, atthi neva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbo.
analyzed: atthi sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ atthi a vitakka vicāra mattaḥ atthi a vitakka a vicāraḥ  atthi dassanena pahātabbaḥ atthi bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ atthi na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ
translated: There is that which has thinking and reflection, there is that which has thinking but no reflection, there is that which has neither thinking nor reflection.🔽There is that which is to be given up through vision, there is that which is to be given up through cultivation, there is that which is not to be given up.

original: Atthi dassanena pahātabbahetuko, atthi bhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko, atthi neva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko.
analyzed: atthi dassanena pahātabba hetukaḥ atthi bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ atthi na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ
translated: There is that which has a cause that is to be given up through vision, there is that which has a cause that is to be given up through cultivation, there is that which has a cause that is not to be given up.

original: Atthi ācayagāmī, atthi apacayagāmī, atthi nevācayagāmināpacayagāmī.
analyzed: atthi ācaya gāmī atthi apacaya gāmī atthi na iva ācaya gāminā apacaya gāmī
translated: There is what leads to accumulation, what leads to decrease, and what does not lead to either accumulation or decrease.

original: Atthi sekkho, atthi asekkho, atthi nevasekkhanāsekkho.
analyzed: atthi sekkhaḥ atthi asekkhaḥ atthi neva sekkha na asekkhaḥ
translated: There is the trainee, the one beyond training, and the one neither in training nor beyond training.

original: Atthi paritto, atthi mahaggato, atthi appamāṇo.
analyzed: atthi parittaḥ atthi mahaggataḥ atthi appamāṇaḥ
translated: There is the limited, the exalted, and the measureless.

original: Atthi parittārammaṇo, atthi mahaggatārammaṇo, atthi appamāṇārammaṇo.
analyzed: atthi paritta ārammaṇaḥ atthi mahaggata ārammaṇaḥ atthi appamāṇa ārammaṇaḥ
translated: There is the limited-as-object, the exalted-as-object, and the measureless-as-object.

original: Atthi hīno, atthi majjhimo, atthi paṇīto.
analyzed: atthi hīnaḥ atthi majjhimaḥ atthi paṇītaḥ
translated: There is the inferior, the middling, and the exquisite.

original: Atthi micchattaniyato, atthi sammattaniyato, atthi aniyato.
analyzed: atthi micchatta niyataḥ atthi sammatta niyataḥ atthi aniyataḥ
translated: There is the path-of-action-leading-to-wrong, the path-of-action-leading-to-right, and the indeterminate.

original: Atthi maggārammaṇo, atthi maggahetuko, atthi maggādhipati.
analyzed: atthi magga ārammaṇaḥ atthi magga hetukaḥ atthi magga adhipati
translated: There is the object of the path, the cause of the path, and the dominant condition of the path.

original: Atthi uppanno, atthi anuppanno, atthi uppādī.🔽Atthi atīto, atthi anāgato, atthi paccuppanno.
analyzed: atthi uppannaḥ atthi anuppannaḥ atthi uppādī  atthi atītaḥ atthi anāgataḥ atthi paccuppannaḥ
translated: There is the arisen, the unarisen, and the bound-to-arise.🔽There is the past, the future, and the present.

original: Atthi atītārammaṇo, atthi anāgatārammaṇo, atthi paccuppannārammaṇo.
analyzed: atthi atīta ārammaṇaḥ atthi anāgata ārammaṇaḥ atthi paccuppanna ārammaṇaḥ
translated: There is the past-as-object, the future-as-object, and the present-as-object.

original: Atthi ajjhatto, atthi bahiddho, atthi ajjhattabahiddho.
analyzed: atthi ajjhattaḥ atthi bahiddhaḥ atthi ajjhatta bahiddhaḥ
translated: There is the internal, the external, and the internal-external.

original: Atthi ajjhattārammaṇo, atthi bahiddhārammaṇo, atthi ajjhattabahiddhārammaṇo …pe….
analyzed: atthi ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ atthi bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ atthi ajjhatta bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ pe
translated: There is the internal-as-object, the external-as-object, and the internal-external-as-object. …
So the feeling aggregate is of ten kinds.
As to singlefold:
It is associated with contact.
As to twofold:

original: atthi hetusampayutto, atthi hetuvippayutto …pe… atthi na hetusahetuko, atthi na hetuahetuko.
analyzed: atthi hetu sampayuttaḥ atthi hetu vippayuttaḥ pe atthi na hetu sahetuko atthi na hetu ahetuko
translated: There is that which is related to causes and that which is not so related. … There is that which is not a cause and has no cause, and that which is not a cause but has a cause.
There is that which is mundane and that which is supramundane.

original: Atthi kenaci viññeyyo, atthi kenaci na viññeyyo.
analyzed: atthi kenacid viññeyyaḥ atthi kenacid na viññeyyaḥ
translated: There is that which is cognizable by some kind of direct-knowledge and that which is not so cognizable.

original: Atthi sāsavo, atthi anāsavo.🔽Atthi āsavasampayutto, atthi āsavavippayutto.
analyzed: atthi sa āsavaḥ atthi anāsavaḥ  atthi āsava sampayutto atthi āsava vippayutto
translated: There is that which is subject to cankers and that which is not so subject.🔽There is that which is associated with cankers and that which is not so associated.

original: Atthi āsavavippayuttasāsavo, atthi āsavavippayuttaanāsavo.🔽Atthi saṁyojaniyo, atthi asaṁyojaniyo.
analyzed: atthi āsava vippayutta sāsavaḥ atthi āsava vippayutta anāsavaḥ  atthi sayojaniyaḥ atthi a sayojaniyaḥ
translated: There is that which is not so associated but is subject to cankers, and that which is not so associated and is not subject to cankers.🔽There is that which should be given attention as a unity and that which should be given attention as a diversity.

original: Atthi saṁyojanasampayutto, atthi saṁyojanavippayutto.🔽Atthi saṁyojanavippayuttasaṁyojaniyo, atthi saṁyojanavippayuttaasaṁyojaniyo.🔽Atthi ganthaniyo, atthi aganthaniyo.
analyzed: atthi sa yojana sampayutto atthi sa yojana vippayutto  atthi sayojana vippayutta sayojaniyo atthi sayojana vippayutta asayojaniyo  atthi ganthaniyo atthi a ganthaniyo
translated: There is that which is related to the fetters and that which is not so related.🔽There is that which is not so related but is related to the fetters, and that which is not so related and is not so related to the fetters.🔽There is that which should be given attention as a unity and that which should be given attention as a diversity.

analyzed: atthi gantha sampayutto atthi gantha vippayutto
translated: There is that which is related to the bonds and that which is not so related.🔽There is that which is associated with the bonds and that which is not so associated.

analyzed: atthi gantha vippayutta ganthaniyaḥ atthi gantha vippayutta a ganthaniyaḥ
translated: There is that connected with the knots and disconnected from the underlying tendency to conceit; there is that connected with the underlying tendency to conceit and disconnected from the knots; there is that connected with both the knots and the underlying tendency to conceit; there is that connected with neither the knots nor the underlying tendency to conceit.

original: Atthi oghaniyo, atthi anoghaniyo.🔽Atthi oghasampayutto, atthi oghavippayutto.
analyzed: atthi ogha niyaḥ atthi anogha niyaḥ  atthi ogha sampayutto atthi ogha vippayutto
translated: There is that connected with the floods; there is that disconnected from the floods.🔽There is that connected with the floods and also connected with the bonds; there is that connected with the floods and also disconnected from the bonds.

analyzed: atthi ogha vippayutta ogha niyaḥ atthi ogha vippayutta anogha niyaḥ
translated: There is that connected with the floods and also disconnected from the bonds and not connected with the floods; there is that disconnected from the floods and also disconnected from the bonds.

original: Atthi yoganiyo, atthi ayoganiyo.🔽Atthi yogasampayutto, atthi yogavippayutto.
analyzed: atthi yoganiyo atthi a yoganiyo  atthi yoga sampayutto atthi yoga vippayutto
translated: There is that connected with the bonds; there is that disconnected from the bonds.

analyzed: atthi yoga vippayutta yoga niyo atthi yoga vippayutta a yoga niyo
translated: There is that connected with the bonds and also connected with the floods; there is that connected with the bonds and also disconnected from the floods.🔽There is that connected with the bonds and also disconnected from the floods and not connected with the bonds; there is that disconnected from the bonds and also disconnected from the floods.

original: Atthi nīvaraṇiyo, atthi anīvaraṇiyo.🔽Atthi nīvaraṇasampayutto, atthi nīvaraṇavippayutto.
analyzed: atthi nīvaraṇiyaḥ atthi a nīvaraṇiyaḥ  atthi nīvaraṇa sampayutto atthi nīvaraṇa vippayutto
translated: There is that connected with the hindrances; there is that disconnected from the hindrances.🔽There is that connected with the hindrances and also connected with the floods; there is that connected with the hindrances and also disconnected from the floods.

analyzed: atthi nīvaraṇa vippayutta nīvaraṇiyo atthi nīvaraṇa vippayutta a nīvaraṇiyo
translated: There is that connected with the hindrances and also disconnected from the floods and not connected with the hindrances; there is that disconnected from the hindrances and also disconnected from the floods.

original: Atthi parāmaṭṭho, atthi aparāmaṭṭho.🔽Atthi parāmāsasampayutto, atthi parāmāsavippayutto.
analyzed: atthi parāmaṭṭhaḥ atthi aparāmaṭṭhaḥ  atthi parāmāsa sampayutto atthi parāmāsa vippayutto
translated: There is that clung to by way of perception; there is that not clung to by way of perception.🔽There is that connected with clinging; there is that disconnected from clinging.

analyzed: atthi parāmāsa vippayutta parāmaṭṭho atthi parāmāsa vippayutta aparāmaṭṭho
translated: There is that disconnected from clinging and also clung to by way of perception; there is that disconnected from clinging and also not clung to by way of perception.

original: Atthi upādinno, atthi anupādinno.🔽Atthi upādāniyo, atthi anupādāniyo.🔽Atthi upādānasampayutto, atthi upādānavippayutto.
analyzed: atthi upādinnaḥ atthi anupādinnaḥ  atthi upādāniyaḥ atthi anupādāniyaḥ  atthi upādāna sampayutto atthi upādāna vippayutto
translated: There is that which is clung to, and there is that which is not clung to.🔽There is that which is a condition for clinging, and there is that which is not a condition for clinging.🔽There is that which is associated with clinging, and there is that which is not associated with clinging.

analyzed: atthi upādāna vippayutta aupādāniyaḥ atthi upādāna vippayutta anupādāniyaḥ
translated: There is that which is not associated with clinging but is a condition for clinging, and there is that which is not associated with clinging and is not a condition for clinging.

original: Atthi saṅkilesiko, atthi asaṅkilesiko.🔽Atthi saṅkiliṭṭho, atthi asaṅkiliṭṭho.🔽Atthi kilesasampayutto, atthi kilesavippayutto.
analyzed: atthi saṅkilesikaḥ atthi asaṅkilesikaḥ  atthi saṅkiliṭṭhaḥ atthi a saṅkiliṭṭhaḥ  atthi kilesa sampayutto atthi kilesa vippayutto
translated: There is that which is corruptible, and there is that which is not corruptible.🔽There is that which is defiled, and there is that which is undefiled.🔽There is that which is associated with defilements, and there is that which is not associated with defilements.

analyzed: atthi kilesa vippayutta saṅkilesiko atthi kilesa vippayutta asaṅkilesiko
translated: There is that which is not associated with defilements but is corruptible, and there is that which is not associated with defilements and is not corruptible.

original: Atthi dassanena pahātabbo, atthi na dassanena pahātabbo.🔽Atthi bhāvanāya pahātabbo, atthi na bhāvanāya pahātabbo.🔽Atthi dassanena pahātabbahetuko, atthi na dassanena pahātabbahetuko.
analyzed: atthi dassanena pahātabbo atthi na dassanena pahātabbo  atthi bhāvanāya pahātabbo atthi na bhāvanāya pahātabbo  atthi dassanena pahātabba hetukaḥ atthi na dassanena pahātabba hetukaḥ
translated: There is that which is to be given up through vision (of the First Path), and there is that which is not to be given up through vision (of the First Path).🔽There is that which is to be given up through development (of the rest of the Paths), and there is that which is not to be given up through development (of the rest of the Paths).🔽There is that which has a cause that is to be given up through vision (of the First Path), and there is that which has a cause that is not to be given up through vision (of the First Path).

original: Atthi bhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko, atthi na bhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko.
analyzed: atthi bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ atthi na bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ
translated: There is that which has a cause that is to be given up through development (of the rest of the Paths), and there is that which has a cause that is not to be given up through development (of the rest of the Paths).

analyzed: atthi sa vitakko atthi a vitakko
translated: There is that which is with thinking, and there is that which is without thinking.
There is that with applied thought and sustained thought, and that without applied thought but with sustained thought.
There is that which is accompanied by rapture, and that which is not accompanied by rapture.

original: Atthi pītisahagato, atthi na pītisahagato.🔽Atthi kāmāvacaro, atthi na kāmāvacaro.🔽Atthi rūpāvacaro, atthi na rūpāvacaro.
analyzed: atthi pīti sahagataḥ atthi na pīti sahagataḥ  atthi kāmāvacaro atthi na kāmāvacaro  atthi rūpāvacaro atthi na rūpāvacaro
translated: There is that which is accompanied by happiness, and that which is not accompanied by happiness.🔽There is that which is accompanied by equanimity, and that which is not accompanied by equanimity.🔽There is that which is connected with the sense sphere, and that which is not connected with the sense sphere.🔽There is that which is connected with the fine-material sphere, and that which is not connected with the fine-material sphere.
There is that which is connected with the immaterial sphere, and that which is not connected with the immaterial sphere.

original: Atthi pariyāpanno, atthi apariyāpanno.🔽Atthi niyyāniko, atthi aniyyāniko.🔽Atthi niyato, atthi aniyato.
analyzed: atthi pariyāpannaḥ atthi apariyāpannaḥ  atthi niyyānikaḥ atthi aniyyānikaḥ  atthi niyataḥ atthi aniyataḥ
translated: There is that which is included in the aggregates, and that which is not included in the aggregates.🔽There is that which is included in the sense spheres, and that which is not included in the sense spheres.🔽There is that which is included in the elements, and that which is not included in the elements.🔽There is that which is included in the dependent origination, and that which is not included in the dependent origination.

There is that which is included in the truths, and that which is not included in the truths.🔽There is that which is included in the faculties, and that which is not included in the faculties.🔽There is that which is included in the dependent origination, and that which is not included in the dependent origination.

analyzed: atthi saraṇaḥ atthi araṇaḥ  tividhena vedanākkhandho
translated: There is that which is included in the truths, and that which is not included in the truths.🔽There is that which is included in the faculties, and that which is not included in the faculties.🔽There is that which is included in the dependent origination, and that which is not included in the dependent origination.🔽There is that which is included in the truths, and that which is not included in the truths.

original: atthi kusalo, atthi akusalo, atthi abyākato …pe….🔽Evaṁ dasavidhena vedanākkhandho.🔽Ekavidhena vedanākkhandho—
analyzed: atthi kusalaḥ atthi akusalaḥ atthi abyākataḥ pe  evam dasavidhena vedanā khandhaḥ  ekavidhena vedanākkhandho
translated: There is that which is included in the faculties, and that which is not included in the faculties.
There is that which is included in the dependent origination, and that which is not included in the dependent origination.

analyzed: atthi saraṇaḥ atthi araṇaḥ  tividhena vedanākkhandho
translated: There is that which is included in the truths, and that which is not included in the truths.🔽There is that which is included in the faculties, and that which is not included in the faculties.

original: atthi vipāko, atthi vipākadhammadhammo, atthi nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo.
analyzed: atthi vipākaḥ atthi vipāka dhamma dhammo atthi neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammo
translated: There is that which is included in the dependent origination, and that which is not included in the dependent origination.🔽There

original: Atthi upādinnupādāniyo …pe… atthi ajjhattārammaṇo, atthi bahiddhārammaṇo, atthi ajjhattabahiddhārammaṇo …pe….
analyzed: atthi upādinnupādāniyaḥ pe atthi ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ atthi bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ atthi ajjhatta bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ pe
translated: There is the feeling aggregate that is clung to and that is a condition for what is clung to … There is the feeling aggregate that has an internal object … that has an external object … that has an internal and external object …

analyzed: evam dasavidhena vedanā khandhaḥ  duka mūlaka
translated: Thus the feeling aggregate is of ten kinds.🔽The feeling aggregate is rooted in the six internal sense-spheres.
In one way the feeling aggregate is:
associated with contact.
In two ways the feeling aggregate is:
there is that which has a cause and that which does not have a cause.
In three ways the feeling aggregate is:

original: atthi kusalo, atthi akusalo, atthi abyākato …pe….
analyzed: atthi kusalaḥ atthi akusalaḥ atthi abyākataḥ pe
translated: there is that which is wholesome, that which is unwholesome, and that which is indeterminate …
Thus the feeling aggregate is of ten kinds.
In one way the feeling aggregate is:
associated with contact.
In two ways the feeling aggregate is:

analyzed: atthi hetu sampayuttaḥ atthi hetu vippayuttaḥ
translated: there is that which is associated with a cause and that which is not associated with a cause.
In three ways the feeling aggregate is:

original: atthi kusalo, atthi akusalo, atthi abyākato …pe….
analyzed: atthi kusalaḥ atthi akusalaḥ atthi abyākataḥ pe
translated: there is that which is wholesome, that which is unwholesome, and that which is indeterminate …
Thus the feeling aggregate is of ten kinds.
In one way the feeling aggregate is:
associated with contact.
In two ways the feeling aggregate is:

original: atthi na hetusahetuko, atthi na hetuahetuko.
analyzed: atthi na hetu sahetukaḥ atthi na hetu ahetukaḥ
translated: There is that which is not a condition and not a cause.
There is that which is mundane. There is that which is supramundane.

original: Atthi kenaci viññeyyo, atthi kenaci na viññeyyo.
analyzed: atthi kenacid viññeyyaḥ atthi kenacid na viññeyyaḥ
translated: There is that which is cognizable by some. There is that which is not cognizable by some.
There is that which is subject to cankers. There is that which is free from cankers.

analyzed: atthi āsava sampayutto atthi āsava vippayutto
translated: There is that which is associated with cankers. There is that which is dissociated from cankers.

original: Atthi āsavavippayuttasāsavo, atthi āsavavippayuttaanāsavo …pe… atthi saraṇo, atthi araṇo.
analyzed: atthi āsava vippayutta sāsavaḥ atthi āsava vippayutta anāsavaḥ pe atthi saraṇaḥ atthi araṇaḥ
translated: There is that which is dissociated from cankers and subject to cankers. There is that which is dissociated from cankers and free from cankers. … There is that which is a quarrel. There is that which is not a quarrel.
The feeling aggregate is threefold:

original: atthi kusalo, atthi akusalo, atthi abyākato …pe….
analyzed: atthi kusalaḥ atthi akusalaḥ atthi abyākataḥ pe
translated: There is that which is wholesome. There is that which is unwholesome. There is that which is indeterminate. …
Thus the feeling aggregate is of ten kinds.
The feeling aggregate is of one kind:
it is associated with contact.
The feeling aggregate is of two kinds:
there is that which is a condition and a cause. There is that which is not a condition and not a cause.

original: Tividhena vedanākkhandho—🔽atthi vipāko, atthi vipākadhammadhammo, atthi nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo.
analyzed: tividhena vedanākkhandho  atthi vipākaḥ atthi vipāka dhamma dhammo atthi neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammo
translated: The feeling aggregate is of three kinds:🔽there is result. There is a state that has result. There is that which is neither a result nor a state that has result.

original: Atthi upādinnupādāniyo, atthi anupādinnupādāniyo, atthi anupādinnaanupādāniyo.
analyzed: atthi upādinnupādāniyaḥ atthi anupādinnupādāniyaḥ atthi anupādinna anupādāniyaḥ
translated: There is that which is clung to and a condition for clinging. There is that which is not clung to but a condition for clinging. There is that which is not clung to nor a condition for clinging.

original: Atthi saṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko, atthi asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko, atthi asaṅkiliṭṭhaasaṅkilesiko.
analyzed: atthi saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ atthi a saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ atthi a saṅkiliṭṭha asaṅkilesikaḥ
translated: There is that which is defiled and has a defiled object, that which is defiled but has an undefiled object, and that which is undefiled and has an undefiled object.

original: Atthi savitakkasavicāro, atthi avitakkavicāramatto, atthi avitakkaavicāro.
analyzed: atthi sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ atthi a vitakka vicāra mattaḥ atthi a vitakka a vicāraḥ
translated: There is that which has thinking and exploring, that which has no thinking but has only exploring, and that which has neither thinking nor exploring.

original: Atthi dassanena pahātabbo, atthi bhāvanāya pahātabbo, atthi neva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbo.🔽Atthi dassanena pahātabbahetuko, atthi bhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko, atthi neva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko.🔽Atthi ācayagāmī, atthi apacayagāmī, atthi nevācayagāmināpacayagāmī.
analyzed: atthi dassanena pahātabbaḥ atthi bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ atthi na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ  atthi dassanena pahātabba hetukaḥ atthi bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ atthi na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ  atthi ācaya gāmī atthi apacaya gāmī atthi na iva ācaya gāminā apacaya gāmī
translated: There is that which is to be given up through vision, that which is to be given up through development, and that which is not to be given up.🔽There is that which has a cause to be given up through vision, that which has a cause to be given up through development, and that which has a cause that is not to be given up.🔽There is that which leads to accumulation, that which leads to decrease, and that which leads neither to accumulation nor to decrease.

original: Atthi sekkho, atthi asekkho, atthi nevasekkhanāsekkho.
analyzed: atthi sekkhaḥ atthi asekkhaḥ atthi neva sekkha na asekkhaḥ
translated: There is the trainee, the one beyond training, and the one who is neither.

original: Atthi paritto, atthi mahaggato, atthi appamāṇo.
analyzed: atthi parittaḥ atthi mahaggataḥ atthi appamāṇaḥ
translated: There is the limited, the exalted, and the measureless.

original: Atthi parittārammaṇo, atthi mahaggatārammaṇo, atthi appamāṇārammaṇo.
analyzed: atthi paritta ārammaṇaḥ atthi mahaggata ārammaṇaḥ atthi appamāṇa ārammaṇaḥ
translated: There is that which has a limited object, that which has an exalted object, and that which has a measureless object.

original: Atthi hīno, atthi majjhimo, atthi paṇīto.
analyzed: atthi hīnaḥ atthi majjhimaḥ atthi paṇītaḥ
translated: There is the inferior, the middling, and the superior.

original: Atthi micchattaniyato, atthi sammattaniyato, atthi aniyato.
analyzed: atthi micchatta niyataḥ atthi sammatta niyataḥ atthi aniyataḥ
translated: There is what is determined by wrongness, what is determined by rightness, and what is undetermined.

original: Atthi maggārammaṇo, atthi maggahetuko, atthi maggādhipati.
analyzed: atthi magga ārammaṇaḥ atthi magga hetukaḥ atthi magga adhipati
translated: There is what has a path as its object, what has a path as its cause, and what is dominant in the path.

original: Atthi uppanno, atthi anuppanno, atthi uppādī.🔽Atthi atīto, atthi anāgato, atthi paccuppanno.
analyzed: atthi uppannaḥ atthi anuppannaḥ atthi uppādī  atthi atītaḥ atthi anāgataḥ atthi paccuppannaḥ
translated: There is what has arisen, what has not arisen, and what is bound to arise.🔽There is what is past, what is future, and what is present.

original: Atthi atītārammaṇo, atthi anāgatārammaṇo, atthi paccuppannārammaṇo.
analyzed: atthi atīta ārammaṇaḥ atthi anāgata ārammaṇaḥ atthi paccuppanna ārammaṇaḥ
translated: There is what has a past object, what has a future object, and what has a present object.

original: Atthi ajjhatto, atthi bahiddho, atthi ajjhattabahiddho.
analyzed: atthi ajjhattaḥ atthi bahiddhaḥ atthi ajjhatta bahiddhaḥ
translated: There is what is internal, what is external, and what is both internal and external.

original: Atthi ajjhattārammaṇo, atthi bahiddhārammaṇo, atthi ajjhattabahiddhārammaṇo …pe….
analyzed: atthi ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ atthi bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ atthi ajjhatta bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ pe
translated: There is what has an internal object, what has an external object, and what has both an internal and an external object.
The form-constituent is like this in ten ways.
The form-constituent is like this in one way:
it is associated with contact.

analyzed: duvidhena vedanākkhandho  atthi hetu sampayuttaḥ atthi hetu vippayuttaḥ
translated: The form-constituent is like this in two ways:🔽there is what is associated with a cause and what is not associated with a cause.

original: Atthi na hetusahetuko, atthi na hetuahetuko.
analyzed: atthi na hetu sahetukaḥ atthi na hetu ahetukaḥ
translated: There is what is not a cause and not having a cause, and what is not a cause and not having a cause.
There is what is mundane and what is supramundane.

original: Atthi kenaci viññeyyo, atthi kenaci na viññeyyo.
analyzed: atthi kenacid viññeyyaḥ atthi kenacid na viññeyyaḥ
translated: There is what is cognizable by some and what is not cognizable by some.

original: Atthi sāsavo, atthi anāsavo.🔽Atthi āsavasampayutto, atthi āsavavippayutto.
analyzed: atthi sa āsavaḥ atthi anāsavaḥ  atthi āsava sampayutto atthi āsava vippayutto
translated: There is what is corruptible and what is incorruptible.

analyzed: atthi āsava vippayutta sāsavaḥ atthi āsava vippayutta anāsavaḥ
translated: There is what is connected with the taints and what is unconnected with the taints.🔽There is what is unconnected with the taints but still corruptible, and there is what is unconnected with the taints and incorruptible.

original: Atthi saṁyojaniyo, atthi asaṁyojaniyo …pe… atthi saraṇo, atthi araṇo.
analyzed: atthi sayojaniyaḥ atthi a sayojaniyaḥ pe atthi saraṇaḥ atthi araṇaḥ
translated: There is what should be reflected on and what should not be reflected on. … There is what is a thicket and what is not a thicket.
The feeling-group is threefold:

original: atthi ajjhattārammaṇo, atthi bahiddhārammaṇo, atthi ajjhattabahiddhārammaṇo …pe….
analyzed: atthi ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ atthi bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ atthi ajjhatta bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ pe
translated: There is what has an internal object, what has an external object, and what has an internal-external object. …
Thus the feeling-group is tenfold.
The three roots.
The feeling-group is one-fold:
It is associated with contact.
The feeling-group is two-fold:
There is what has a cause and what has no cause.
The feeling-group is three-fold:

original: atthi kusalo, atthi akusalo, atthi abyākato …pe….
analyzed: atthi kusalaḥ atthi akusalaḥ atthi abyākataḥ pe
translated: There is what is wholesome, what is unwholesome, and what is indeterminate. …

In two ways the perception-group is:
there is (a kind of perception) that has a cause, there is (a kind of perception) that has no cause.
In three ways the perception-group is:

original: atthi kusalo, atthi akusalo, atthi abyākato.
analyzed: atthi kusalaḥ atthi akusalaḥ atthi abyākataḥ
translated: there is (a kind of perception) that is wholesome, there is (a kind of perception) that is unwholesome, there is (a kind of perception) that is indeterminate.
In four ways the perception-group is:

original: atthi kāmāvacaro, atthi rūpāvacaro, atthi arūpāvacaro, atthi apariyāpanno.
analyzed: atthi kāmāvacaraḥ atthi rūpāvacaraḥ atthi arūpāvacaraḥ atthi apariyāpanno
translated: there is (a kind of perception) that belongs to the sensual realm, there is (a kind of perception) that belongs to the form realm, there is (a kind of perception) that belongs to the formless realm, there is (a kind of perception) that is not included.
In five ways the perception-group is:

original: atthi sukhindriyasampayutto, atthi dukkhindriyasampayutto, atthi somanassindriyasampayutto, atthi domanassindriyasampayutto, atthi upekkhindriyasampayutto.
analyzed: atthi sukha indriya sampayuttaḥ atthi dukkha indriya sampayuttaḥ atthi somanassa indriya sampayuttaḥ atthi domanassa indriya sampayuttaḥ atthi upekkhā indriya sampayuttaḥ
translated: connected with the pleasure faculty, connected with the pain faculty, connected with the happiness faculty, connected with the distress faculty, connected with the equanimity faculty.
In this way, the perception component is fivefold.
The perception component is sixfold:

original: cakkhusamphassajā saññā, sotasamphassajā saññā, ghānasamphassajā saññā, jivhāsamphassajā saññā, kāyasamphassajā saññā, manosamphassajā saññā.
analyzed: cakkhu samphassa jā saññā sota samphassa jā saññā ghāna samphassa jā saññā jivhā samphassa jā saññā kāya samphassa jā saññā manas samphassa jā saññā
translated: perception arisen from eye contact, perception arisen from ear contact, perception arisen from nose contact, perception arisen from tongue contact, perception arisen from body contact, perception arisen from mind contact.
In this way, the perception component is sixfold.
The perception component is sevenfold:

original: cakkhusamphassajā saññā, sotasamphassajā saññā, ghānasamphassajā saññā, jivhāsamphassajā
analyzed: cakkhu samphassa jā saññā sota samphassa jā saññā ghāna samphassa jā saññā jivhā samphassa jā
translated: perception arisen from eye contact, perception arisen from ear contact, perception arisen from nose contact, perception arisen from tongue contact,

original: saññā, kāyasamphassajā saññā, manodhātusamphassajā saññā, manoviññāṇadhātusamphassajā saññā.
analyzed: saññā kāya samphassa jā saññā manaḥ dhātu samphassa jā saññā manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu samphassa jā saññā
translated: perception arisen from body contact, perception arisen from mind element contact, perception arisen from mind-consciousness element contact.
In this way, the perception component is sevenfold.
The perception component is eightfold:🔽perception arisen from eye contact …
perception that arises with eye-contact …

original: kāyasamphassajā saññā atthi sukhasahagatā, atthi dukkhasahagatā, manodhātusamphassajā saññā, manoviññāṇadhātusamphassajā saññā.
analyzed: kāya samphassa jā saññā atthi sukha sahagatā atthi dukkha sahagatā manaḥ dhātu samphassa jā saññā manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu samphassa jā saññā
translated: There is perception arisen from body-contact that is connected with pleasure, and there is perception arisen from body-contact that is connected with pain. There is perception arisen from mind-element contact, and there is perception arisen from mind-consciousness-element contact.
So the perception aggregate is of eight kinds.
The perception aggregate is of nine kinds:
Perception arisen from eye-contact …

original: kāyasamphassajā saññā, manodhātusamphassajā saññā, manoviññāṇadhātusamphassajā saññā atthi kusalā, atthi akusalā, atthi abyākatā.
analyzed: kāya samphassa jā saññā manaḥ dhātu samphassa jā saññā manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu samphassa jā saññā atthi kusalā atthi akusalā atthi abyākatā
translated: Perception arisen from body-contact, perception arisen from mind-element contact, and perception arisen from mind-consciousness-element contact are either wholesome, or unwholesome, or indeterminate.
So the perception aggregate is of nine kinds.
The perception aggregate is of ten kinds:
Perception arisen from eye-contact …

original: kāyasamphassajā saññā atthi sukhasahagatā, atthi dukkhasahagatā, manodhātusamphassajā saññā, manoviññāṇadhātusamphassajā saññā atthi kusalā, atthi akusalā, atthi abyākatā.
analyzed: kāya samphassa jā saññā atthi sukha sahagatā atthi dukkha sahagatā manaḥ dhātu samphassa jā saññā manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu samphassa jā saññā atthi kusalā atthi akusalā atthi abyākatā
translated: Perception arisen from body-contact is either connected with pleasure or connected with pain. Perception arisen from mind-element contact, and perception arisen from mind-consciousness-element contact are either wholesome, or unwholesome, or indeterminate.
So the perception aggregate is of ten kinds.
The perception aggregate is of one kind:
it is associated with contact.
The perception aggregate is twofold:
with root cause and without root cause.
The perception aggregate is threefold:

original: atthi sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto, atthi dukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto, atthi adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto …pe….
analyzed: atthi sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ atthi dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ atthi adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ pe
translated: connected with pleasant feeling, connected with painful feeling, and connected with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling. …
In this way, the perception aggregate is tenfold.
The perception aggregate is singlefold:
connected with contact.
The perception aggregate is twofold:
with root cause and without root cause.
The perception aggregate is threefold:

original: atthi vipāko, atthi vipākadhammadhammo, atthi nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo.🔽Atthi upādinnupādāniyo, atthi anupādinnupādāniyo, atthi anupādinnaanupādāniyo.🔽Atthi saṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko, atthi asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko, atthi asaṅkiliṭṭhaasaṅkilesiko.
analyzed: atthi vipākaḥ atthi vipāka dhamma dhammo atthi neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammo  atthi upādinnupādāniyaḥ atthi anupādinnupādāniyaḥ atthi anupādinna anupādāniyaḥ  atthi saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ atthi a saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ atthi a saṅkiliṭṭha asaṅkilesikaḥ
translated: resultant and related to the result of another, neither resultant nor related to the result of another.🔽It is clung to and related to what is clung to, not clung to and related to what is clung to, not clung to and not related to what is clung to.🔽It is corrupted and related to corruption, uncorrupted and related to corruption, uncorrupted and related to what is uncorrupted.

original: Atthi savitakkasavicāro, atthi avitakkavicāramatto, atthi avitakkaavicāro.
analyzed: atthi sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ atthi a vitakka vicāra mattaḥ atthi a vitakka a vicāraḥ
translated: It is accompanied by applied and sustained thought, by neither-applied-nor-sustained thought, and by no thought.

original: Atthi pītisahagato, atthi sukhasahagato, atthi upekkhāsahagato.
analyzed: atthi pīti sahagataḥ atthi sukha sahagataḥ atthi upekkhā sahagataḥ
translated: There is that associated with rapture, that associated with pleasure, that associated with equanimity.

original: Atthi dassanena pahātabbo, atthi bhāvanāya pahātabbo, atthi neva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbo.🔽Atthi dassanena pahātabbahetuko, atthi bhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko, atthi neva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko.🔽Atthi ācayagāmī, atthi apacayagāmī, atthi nevācayagāmināpacayagāmī.
analyzed: atthi dassanena pahātabbaḥ atthi bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ atthi na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ  atthi dassanena pahātabba hetukaḥ atthi bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ atthi na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ  atthi ācaya gāmī atthi apacaya gāmī atthi na iva ācaya gāminā apacaya gāmī
translated: There is that to be given up through vision, that to be given up through development, that not to be given up.🔽There is that which has a cause to be given up through vision, that which has a cause to be given up through development, that which has a cause not to be given up.🔽There is that which leads to accumulation, that which leads to decrease, that which leads neither to accumulation nor to decrease.

original: Atthi sekkho, atthi asekkho, atthi nevasekkhanāsekkho.
analyzed: atthi sekkhaḥ atthi asekkhaḥ atthi neva sekkha na asekkhaḥ
translated: There is that of a trainee, that of a non-trainee, that of neither a trainee nor a non-trainee.

original: Atthi paritto, atthi mahaggato, atthi appamāṇo.
analyzed: atthi parittaḥ atthi mahaggataḥ atthi appamāṇaḥ
translated: There is that which is limited, that which is exalted, that which is measureless.

original: Atthi parittārammaṇo, atthi mahaggatārammaṇo, atthi appamāṇārammaṇo.
analyzed: atthi paritta ārammaṇaḥ atthi mahaggata ārammaṇaḥ atthi appamāṇa ārammaṇaḥ
translated: There is that which has a limited object, that which has an exalted object, that which has a measureless object.

original: Atthi hīno, atthi majjhimo, atthi paṇīto.
analyzed: atthi hīnaḥ atthi majjhimaḥ atthi paṇītaḥ
translated: There is that which is inferior, that which is middling, that which is superior.

original: Atthi micchattaniyato, atthi sammattaniyato, atthi aniyato.
analyzed: atthi micchatta niyataḥ atthi sammatta niyataḥ atthi aniyataḥ
translated: There is that which is subject to wrong, that which is subject to right, that which is not subject.

original: Atthi maggārammaṇo, atthi maggahetuko, atthi maggādhipati.
analyzed: atthi magga ārammaṇaḥ atthi magga hetukaḥ atthi magga adhipati
translated: There is that which has the path as its object, that which has the path as its cause, that which is dominant in the path.

original: Atthi uppanno, atthi anuppanno, atthi uppādī.🔽Atthi atīto, atthi anāgato, atthi paccuppanno.
analyzed: atthi uppannaḥ atthi anuppannaḥ atthi uppādī  atthi atītaḥ atthi anāgataḥ atthi paccuppannaḥ
translated: There is what has arisen, what has not arisen, and what is in the process of arising.🔽There is what is past, what is future, and what is present.

original: Atthi atītārammaṇo, atthi anāgatārammaṇo, atthi paccuppannārammaṇo.
analyzed: atthi atīta ārammaṇaḥ atthi anāgata ārammaṇaḥ atthi paccuppanna ārammaṇaḥ
translated: There is what has a past object, what has a future object, and what has a present object.

original: Atthi ajjhatto, atthi bahiddho, atthi ajjhattabahiddho.
analyzed: atthi ajjhattaḥ atthi bahiddhaḥ atthi ajjhatta bahiddhaḥ
translated: There is what is internal, what is external, and what is internal and external.

original: Atthi ajjhattārammaṇo, atthi bahiddhārammaṇo, atthi ajjhattabahiddhārammaṇo …pe….
analyzed: atthi ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ atthi bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ atthi ajjhatta bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ pe
translated: There is what has an internal object, what has an external object, and what has an internal and external object.
Thus the perception aggregate is of ten kinds.🔽As to singlefold:
the perception aggregate is associated with contact.

analyzed: duvidhena saññākkhandho  atthi hetu sampayuttaḥ atthi hetu vippayuttaḥ
translated: As to twofold:🔽there is what is associated with a cause and what is not associated with a cause.

original: Atthi na hetusahetuko, atthi na hetuahetuko.
analyzed: atthi na hetu sahetukaḥ atthi na hetu ahetukaḥ
translated: There is what is not a cause but has causes, and what is not a cause and has no causes.
There is what is mundane and what is supramundane.

original: Atthi kenaci viññeyyo, atthi kenaci na viññeyyo.🔽Atthi sāsavo, atthi anāsavo.
analyzed: atthi kenacid viññeyyaḥ atthi kenacid na viññeyyaḥ  atthi sa āsavaḥ atthi anāsavaḥ
translated: There is what is cognizable by some and what is not cognizable by some.🔽There is what is subject to cankers and what is free from cankers.

analyzed: atthi āsava sampayutto atthi āsava vippayutto
translated: There is what is associated with cankers and what is free from cankers.

original: Atthi āsavavippayuttasāsavo, atthi āsavavippayuttaanāsavo.🔽Atthi saṁyojaniyo, atthi asaṁyojaniyo.🔽Atthi saṁyojanasampayutto, atthi saṁyojanavippayutto.🔽Atthi saṁyojanavippayuttasaṁyojaniyo, atthi saṁyojanavippayuttaasaṁyojaniyo.
analyzed: atthi āsava vippayutta sāsavaḥ atthi āsava vippayutta anāsavaḥ  atthi sayojaniyaḥ atthi a sayojaniyaḥ  atthi sa yojana sampayutto atthi sa yojana vippayutto  atthi sayojana vippayutta sayojaniyo atthi sayojana vippayutta asayojaniyo
translated: There is what is connected with the taints that is not free from the taints, and there is what is connected with the taints that is free from the taints.🔽There is what is connected with the fetters, and there is what is not connected with the fetters.🔽There is what is associated with the fetters, and there is what is dissociated from the fetters.

original: Atthi ganthaniyo, atthi aganthaniyo.🔽Atthi ganthasampayutto, atthi ganthavippayutto.
analyzed: atthi ganthaniyo atthi a ganthaniyo  atthi gantha sampayutto atthi gantha vippayutto
translated: There is what is dissociated from the fetters that is connected with the fetters, and there is what is dissociated from the fetters that is not connected with the fetters.🔽There is what is connected with the knots, and there is what is not connected with the knots.🔽There is what is associated with the knots, and there is what is dissociated from the knots.

analyzed: atthi gantha vippayutta ganthaniyaḥ atthi gantha vippayutta a ganthaniyaḥ
translated: There is what is dissociated from the knots that is connected with the knots, and there is what is dissociated from the knots that is not connected with the knots.

original: Atthi oghaniyo, atthi anoghaniyo.🔽Atthi oghasampayutto, atthi oghavippayutto.
analyzed: atthi ogha niyaḥ atthi anogha niyaḥ  atthi ogha sampayutto atthi ogha vippayutto
translated: There is what is connected with the floods, and there is what is not connected with the floods.🔽There is what is associated with the floods, and there is what is dissociated from the floods.

analyzed: atthi ogha vippayutta ogha niyaḥ atthi ogha vippayutta anogha niyaḥ
translated: There is what is dissociated from the floods that is connected with the floods, and there is what is dissociated from the floods that is not connected with the floods.

original: Atthi yoganiyo, atthi ayoganiyo.🔽Atthi yogasampayutto, atthi yogavippayutto.
analyzed: atthi yoganiyo atthi a yoganiyo  atthi yoga sampayutto atthi yoga vippayutto
translated: There is what is connected with the bonds, and there is what is not connected with the bonds.🔽There is what is associated with the bonds, and there is what is dissociated from the bonds.

analyzed: atthi yoga vippayutta yoga niyo atthi yoga vippayutta a yoga niyo
translated: There is what is dissociated from the bonds that is connected with the bonds, and there is what is dissociated from the bonds that is not connected with the bonds.
There is what is connected with the hindrances, and there is what is not connected with the hindrances.

original: Atthi nīvaraṇasampayutto, atthi nīvaraṇavippayutto.🔽Atthi nīvaraṇavippayuttanīvaraṇiyo, atthi nīvaraṇavippayuttaanīvaraṇiyo.
analyzed: atthi nīvaraṇa sampayutto atthi nīvaraṇa vippayutto  atthi nīvaraṇa vippayutta nīvaraṇiyo atthi nīvaraṇa vippayutta a nīvaraṇiyo
translated: There is that which is associated with hindrances, and there is that which is unassociated with hindrances.🔽There is that which is unassociated with hindrances and has hindrances, and there is that which is unassociated with hindrances and has no hindrances.

original: Atthi parāmaṭṭho, atthi aparāmaṭṭho.🔽Atthi parāmāsasampayutto, atthi parāmāsavippayutto.
analyzed: atthi parāmaṭṭhaḥ atthi aparāmaṭṭhaḥ  atthi parāmāsa sampayutto atthi parāmāsa vippayutto
translated: There is that which is clung to, and there is that which is not clung to.🔽There is that which is associated with clinging, and there is that which is unassociated with clinging.

analyzed: atthi parāmāsa vippayutta parāmaṭṭho atthi parāmāsa vippayutta aparāmaṭṭho
translated: There is that which is unassociated with clinging and is clung to, and there is that which is unassociated with clinging and is not clung to.

original: Atthi upādinno, atthi anupādinno.🔽Atthi upādāniyo, atthi anupādāniyo.🔽Atthi upādānasampayutto, atthi upādānavippayutto.
analyzed: atthi upādinnaḥ atthi anupādinnaḥ  atthi upādāniyaḥ atthi anupādāniyaḥ  atthi upādāna sampayutto atthi upādāna vippayutto
translated: There is that which is acquired, and there is that which is not acquired.🔽There is that which is subject to acquisition, and there is that which is not subject to acquisition.🔽There is that which is associated with acquisition, and there is that which is unassociated with acquisition.

analyzed: atthi upādāna vippayutta aupādāniyaḥ atthi upādāna vippayutta anupādāniyaḥ
translated: There is that which is unassociated with acquisition and is subject to acquisition, and there is that which is unassociated with acquisition and is not subject to acquisition.

original: Atthi saṅkilesiko, atthi asaṅkilesiko.🔽Atthi saṅkiliṭṭho, atthi asaṅkiliṭṭho.🔽Atthi kilesasampayutto, atthi kilesavippayutto.
analyzed: atthi saṅkilesikaḥ atthi asaṅkilesikaḥ  atthi saṅkiliṭṭhaḥ atthi a saṅkiliṭṭhaḥ  atthi kilesa sampayutto atthi kilesa vippayutto
translated: There is that which is defiled, and there is that which is undefiled.🔽There is that which is stained, and there is that which is unstained.🔽There is that which is associated with defilements, and there is that which is unassociated with defilements.

analyzed: atthi kilesa vippayutta saṅkilesiko atthi kilesa vippayutta asaṅkilesiko
translated: There is that which is unassociated with defilements and is defiled, and there is that which is unassociated with defilements and is undefiled.

original: Atthi dassanena pahātabbo, atthi na dassanena pahātabbo.🔽Atthi bhāvanāya pahātabbo, atthi na bhāvanāya pahātabbo.🔽Atthi dassanena pahātabbahetuko, atthi na dassanena pahātabbahetuko.
analyzed: atthi dassanena pahātabbo atthi na dassanena pahātabbo  atthi bhāvanāya pahātabbo atthi na bhāvanāya pahātabbo  atthi dassanena pahātabba hetukaḥ atthi na dassanena pahātabba hetukaḥ
translated: Some are to be given up through vision, some are not to be given up through vision.🔽Some are to be given up through development, some are not to be given up through development.🔽Some have a cause that is to be given up through vision, some have a cause that is not to be given up through vision.

original: Atthi bhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko, atthi na bhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko.🔽Atthi savitakko, atthi avitakko.🔽Atthi savicāro, atthi avicāro.
analyzed: atthi bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ atthi na bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ  atthi sa vitakko atthi a vitakko  atthi sa vicāraḥ atthi avicāro
translated: Some have a cause that is to be given up through development, some have a cause that is not to be given up through development.🔽Some are connected with thinking, some are not connected with thinking.

original: Atthi sappītiko, atthi appītiko.🔽Atthi pītisahagato, atthi na pītisahagato.🔽Atthi sukhasahagato, atthi na sukhasahagato.
analyzed: atthi sappītikaḥ atthi appītikaḥ  atthi pīti sahagataḥ atthi na pīti sahagataḥ  atthi sukha sahagataḥ atthi na sukha sahagataḥ
translated: Some are connected with reflection, some are not connected with reflection.🔽Some are connected with happiness, some are not connected with happiness.🔽Some are connected with rapture, some are not connected with rapture.

original: Atthi upekkhāsahagato, atthi na upekkhāsahagato.🔽Atthi kāmāvacaro, atthi na kāmāvacaro.🔽Atthi rūpāvacaro, atthi na rūpāvacaro.
analyzed: atthi upekkhā sahagataḥ atthi na upekkhā sahagataḥ  atthi kāmāvacaro atthi na kāmāvacaro  atthi rūpāvacaro atthi na rūpāvacaro
translated: Some are connected with pleasure, some are not connected with pleasure.🔽Some are connected with equanimity, some are not connected with equanimity.🔽Some are in the sense-sphere, some are not in the sense-sphere.🔽Some are in the form-sphere, some are not in the form-sphere.

original: Atthi arūpāvacaro, atthi na arūpāvacaro.🔽Atthi pariyāpanno, atthi apariyāpanno.
analyzed: atthi arūpāvacaraḥ atthi na arūpāvacaro  atthi pariyāpannaḥ atthi apariyāpannaḥ
translated: Some are in the formless-sphere, some are not in the formless-sphere.🔽Some are included, some are not included.
Some are emancipating, some are not emancipating.

original: Atthi niyato, atthi aniyato.🔽Atthi sauttaro, atthi anuttaro.
analyzed: atthi niyataḥ atthi aniyataḥ  atthi sauttaro atthi anuttaro
translated: There is what is fixed and what is unfixed.🔽There is what is with a higher faculty and what is without a higher faculty.
There is what is with an object and what is without an object.
The perception component is threefold:

original: atthi kusalo, atthi akusalo, atthi abyākato …pe….
analyzed: atthi kusalaḥ atthi akusalaḥ atthi abyākataḥ pe
translated: there is what is wholesome, there is what is unwholesome, there is what is indeterminate. …
Thus the perception component is of ten kinds.
The perception component is of one kind:
it is associated with contact.
It is of two kinds:
there is what is with an object and what is without an object.
It is of three kinds:

original: atthi sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto, atthi dukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto, atthi adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto.
analyzed: atthi sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ atthi dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ atthi adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ
translated: there is what is associated with pleasant feeling, there is what is associated with painful feeling, there is what is associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling.

original: Atthi vipāko …pe… atthi ajjhattārammaṇo, atthi bahiddhārammaṇo, atthi ajjhattabahiddhārammaṇo …pe….
analyzed: atthi vipāko pe atthi ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ atthi bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ atthi ajjhatta bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ pe
translated: There is what is result and what is not result … there is what has an internal object and what has an external object, there is what has an internal-external object. …
Thus the perception component is of ten kinds.

original: (Yathā kusalattike vitthāro, evaṁ sabbepi tikā vitthāretabbā.)
analyzed: yathā kusala ttike vitthāraḥ evam sabbe pi tikā vitthāretabbā
translated: (The elaboration should be done in the same way as for the wholesome triad.)
The root “du” .
The perception component is of one kind:
it is associated with contact.
The perception aggregate is twofold:
with cause and without cause.
The perception aggregate is threefold:

original: atthi kusalo, atthi akusalo, atthi abyākato …pe….
analyzed: atthi kusalaḥ atthi akusalaḥ atthi abyākataḥ pe
translated: wholesome, unwholesome, and indeterminate. …
Thus the perception aggregate is tenfold.
The perception aggregate is onefold:
associated with contact.

In one way the perception component is:
associated with contact.
In two ways the perception component is:

original: atthi hetusampayutto, atthi hetuvippayutto …pe… atthi saraṇo, atthi araṇo.

The three-based triad.
In one way the perception component is:
associated with contact.

there is that which has a cause and that which does not have a cause.

associated with contact.

analyzed: atthi hetu sampayuttaḥ atthi hetu vippayuttaḥ

In this way, the perception aggregate is tenfold.

connected with contact.

In this way, the perception aggregate is tenfold.
The perception aggregate is onefold:
connected with contact.

worldly and unworldly.
The perception aggregate is threefold:

In one way the perception aggregate is:
associated with contact.

associated with contact.

associated with contact.

in this way the perception aggregate is tenfold.
The perception aggregate is onefold:

in this way the perception aggregate is tenfold.

in this way the perception aggregate is tenfold.

it is associated with contact.

The perception aggregate is onefold:
it is associated with contact.
It is twofold:

Thus the perception aggregate is tenfold.
The perception aggregate is onefold:
it is associated with contact.

analyzed: atthi uppannaḥ atthi anuppannaḥ atthi uppādī pe

it is associated with contact.
The perception aggregate is twofold:

analyzed: atthi atītaḥ atthi anāgataḥ atthi paccuppannaḥ pe

In this way, the perception aggregate is tenfold.
The perception aggregate is onefold:
it is associated with contact.

it is associated with contact.

there is that which is a hindrance and that which is not a hindrance.
It is of three kinds:

original: atthi ajjhattārammaṇo, atthi bahiddhārammaṇo, atthi ajjhattabahiddhārammaṇo …pe….
analyzed: atthi ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ atthi bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ atthi ajjhatta bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ pe
