So the perception aggregate is of ten kinds.
The sevenfold, etc.
The perception aggregate is of seven kinds:

original: atthi kusalo, atthi akusalo, atthi abyākato, atthi kāmāvacaro, atthi rūpāvacaro, atthi arūpāvacaro, atthi apariyāpanno.
analyzed: atthi kusalaḥ atthi akusalaḥ atthi abyākataḥ atthi kāmāvacaraḥ atthi rūpāvacaraḥ atthi arūpāvacaraḥ atthi apariyāpanno
translated: there is the wholesome, the unwholesome, the indeterminate, the sense sphere, the fine-material sphere, the immaterial sphere, and the supramundane.
So the perception aggregate is of seven kinds.

original: Aparopi sattavidhena saññākkhandho—🔽atthi sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto, atthi dukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto, atthi adukkhamasukhāya
analyzed: aparaḥ api sattavidhena saññākkhandho  atthi sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ atthi dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ atthi adukkhamasukhāya
translated: The perception aggregate is of another seven kinds:🔽there is that associated with pleasant feeling, that associated with painful feeling, and that associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling,

original: vedanāya sampayutto, atthi kāmāvacaro, atthi rūpāvacaro, atthi arūpāvacaro, atthi
analyzed: vedanāya sampayuttaḥ atthi kāmāvacaraḥ atthi rūpāvacaraḥ atthi arūpāvacaraḥ atthi
translated: there is that pertaining to the sense sphere, that pertaining to the fine-material sphere, and that pertaining to the immaterial sphere,🔽and there is that which is

original: apariyāpanno …pe… atthi ajjhattārammaṇo, atthi bahiddhārammaṇo, atthi ajjhattabahiddhārammaṇo,
analyzed: apariyāpannaḥ pe atthi ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ atthi bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ atthi ajjhatta bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ
translated: not included in the sustenances … is internal or external or both internal and external …

original: atthi kāmāvacaro, atthi rūpāvacaro, atthi arūpāvacaro, atthi apariyāpanno.
analyzed: atthi kāmāvacaraḥ atthi rūpāvacaraḥ atthi arūpāvacaraḥ atthi apariyāpanno
translated: is connected with the sense-spheres of the sensual sphere or the fine-material sphere or the immaterial sphere or is unconnected …
Thus the perception component is sevenfold.
The perception component is twenty-fourfold:

original: cakkhusamphassapaccayā saññākkhandho atthi kusalo, atthi akusalo, atthi abyākato;🔽sotasamphassapaccayā …pe…🔽ghānasamphassapaccayā …pe…
analyzed: cakkhu samphassa paccayā saññā kkhandho atthi kusalaḥ atthi akusalaḥ atthi abyākataḥ  sota samphassa paccayā pe  ghāna samphassa paccayā pe
translated: Perception component conditioned by eye-contact is wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate;🔽perception component conditioned by ear-contact …🔽perception component conditioned by nose-contact …
perception component conditioned by tongue-contact …
perception component conditioned by body-contact …

original: manosamphassapaccayā saññākkhandho atthi kusalo, atthi akusalo, atthi abyākato;
analyzed: manaḥ samphassa paccayā saññā kkhandho atthi kusalaḥ atthi akusalaḥ atthi abyākataḥ
translated: perception component conditioned by mind-contact is wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate;

original: cakkhusamphassajā saññā, sotasamphassajā saññā, ghānasamphassajā saññā, jivhāsamphassajā saññā, kāyasamphassajā saññā, manosamphassajā saññā.
analyzed: cakkhu samphassa jā saññā sota samphassa jā saññā ghāna samphassa jā saññā jivhā samphassa jā saññā kāya samphassa jā saññā manas samphassa jā saññā
translated: perception born of eye-contact, perception born of ear-contact, perception born of nose-contact, perception born of tongue-contact, perception born of body-contact, perception born of mind-contact.
Thus the perception component is twenty-fourfold.
Another one of twenty-four kinds:

original: cakkhusamphassapaccayā saññākkhandho atthi sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto …pe… atthi
analyzed: cakkhu samphassa paccayā saññā kkhandho atthi sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ pe atthi
translated: The perception component that is a condition for the consciousness component is sometimes connected with pleasure, sometimes connected with pain, sometimes connected with neither pleasure nor pain.

original: ajjhattārammaṇo, atthi bahiddhārammaṇo, atthi ajjhattabahiddhārammaṇo, cakkhusamphassajā saññā …pe…
analyzed: ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ atthi bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ atthi ajjhatta bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ cakkhu samphassa jā saññā pe
translated: Sometimes it has an internal object, sometimes an external object, sometimes an internal-external object. Perception arisen from eye contact …

analyzed: manaḥ samphassa jā saññā  sota samphassa paccayā pe  ghāna samphassa paccayā pe  jivhā samphassa paccayā pe  kāya samphassa paccayā pe
translated: perception arisen from mind contact.🔽The perception component that is a condition for the consciousness component is sometimes connected with pleasure, sometimes connected with pain, sometimes connected with neither pleasure nor pain.

original: manosamphassapaccayā saññākkhandho atthi sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto …pe… atthi ajjhattārammaṇo, atthi bahiddhārammaṇo, atthi ajjhattabahiddhārammaṇo;
analyzed: manaḥ samphassa paccayā saññā kkhandho atthi sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ pe atthi ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ atthi bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ atthi ajjhatta bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ
translated: Sometimes it has an internal object, sometimes an external object, sometimes an internal-external object.
Perception arisen from eye contact …
perception arisen from mind contact.
In this way the perception component is of twenty-four kinds.
The perception component is of thirty kinds:

original: cakkhusamphassapaccayā saññākkhandho atthi kāmāvacaro, atthi rūpāvacaro, atthi arūpāvacaro, atthi apariyāpanno, sotasamphassapaccayā …pe…🔽ghānasamphassapaccayā …pe…
analyzed: cakkhu samphassa paccayā saññā kkhandho atthi kāmāvacaraḥ atthi rūpāvacaraḥ atthi arūpāvacaraḥ atthi apariyāpanno sota samphassa paccayā pe  ghāna samphassa paccayā pe
translated: The perception component that is a condition for the feeling component is sometimes a root cause, sometimes not a root cause.🔽The perception component that is a condition for the feeling component is sometimes a great principle, sometimes not a great principle.🔽The perception component that is a condition for the feeling component is sometimes a training principle, sometimes not a training principle.🔽The perception component that is a condition for the feeling component is sometimes a faculty, sometimes not a faculty.🔽The perception component that is a condition for the feeling component is sometimes a power, sometimes not a power.🔽The perception component that is a condition for the feeling component is sometimes a factor of awakening, sometimes not a factor of awakening.🔽The perception component that is a condition for the feeling component is sometimes a path factor, sometimes not a path factor.

analyzed: jivhā samphassa paccayā pe  kāya samphassa paccayā pe
translated: The perception component that is a condition for the feeling component is sometimes a fruit, sometimes a cause of fruit.🔽The perception component that is a condition for the feeling component is sometimes a sheathed formation, sometimes an un-sheathed formation.🔽The perception component that is a condition for the feeling component is sometimes a great earth, sometimes not a great earth.🔽The perception component that is a condition for the feeling component is sometimes a divine state, sometimes not a divine state.🔽The perception component that is a condition for the feeling component is sometimes a formless divine state, sometimes not a formless divine state.🔽The perception component that is a condition for the feeling component is sometimes a meditative attainment, sometimes not a meditative attainment.

original: manosamphassapaccayā saññākkhandho atthi kāmāvacaro, atthi rūpāvacaro, atthi arūpāvacaro, atthi apariyāpanno, cakkhusamphassajā saññā …pe…🔽manosamphassajā saññā.
analyzed: manaḥ samphassa paccayā saññā kkhandho atthi kāmāvacaraḥ atthi rūpāvacaraḥ atthi arūpāvacaraḥ atthi apariyāpannaḥ cakkhu samphassa jā saññā pe manaḥ samphassa jā saññā
translated: The perception component that is a condition for the feeling component is sometimes a base of spiritual power, sometimes not a base of spiritual power.

original: Evaṁ tiṁsatividhena saññākkhandho.🔽Bahuvidhena saññākkhandho—🔽cakkhusamphassapaccayā saññākkhandho atthi kusalo, atthi akusalo, atthi abyākato,
analyzed: evam tisatividhena saññākkhandho  bahuvidhena saññākkhandho  cakkhu samphassa paccayā saññā kkhandho atthi kusalaḥ atthi akusalaḥ atthi abyākataḥ
translated: The perception component that is a condition for the feeling component is sometimes a faculty, sometimes not a faculty.🔽The perception component that is a condition for the feeling component is sometimes a power, sometimes not a power.🔽The perception component that is a condition for the feeling component is sometimes a factor of enlightenment, sometimes not a factor of enlightenment.

original: atthi kāmāvacaro, atthi rūpāvacaro, atthi arūpāvacaro, atthi apariyāpanno, sotasamphassapaccayā …pe…🔽ghānasamphassapaccayā …pe…
analyzed: atthi kāmāvacaraḥ atthi rūpāvacaraḥ atthi arūpāvacaraḥ atthi apariyāpanno sota samphassa paccayā pe  ghāna samphassa paccayā pe
translated: The perception component that is a condition for the feeling component is sometimes a path factor, sometimes not a path factor.
The perception component that is a condition for the feeling component
From body-contact as a condition: …

original: manosamphassapaccayā saññākkhandho atthi kusalo, atthi akusalo, atthi abyākato, atthi
analyzed: manaḥ samphassa paccayā saññā kkhandho atthi kusalaḥ atthi akusalaḥ atthi abyākataḥ atthi
translated: From mind-contact as a condition there is perception component that is wholesome, that is unwholesome, that is indeterminate,

original: kāmāvacaro, atthi rūpāvacaro, atthi arūpāvacaro, atthi apariyāpanno, cakkhusamphassajā saññā …pe…
analyzed: kāmāvacaraḥ atthi rūpāvacaraḥ atthi arūpāvacaraḥ atthi apariyāpanno cakkhu samphassa jā saññā pe
translated: that is connected to the sense-sphere, that is connected to the form-sphere, that is connected to the formless-sphere, that is unconnected, perception arising from eye-contact …
perception arising from mind-contact.
In this way the perception component is manifold.
Furthermore, the perception component is manifold:

original: cakkhusamphassapaccayā saññākkhandho atthi sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto …pe… atthi
analyzed: cakkhu samphassa paccayā saññā kkhandho atthi sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ pe atthi
translated: From eye-contact as a condition there is a perception component that is connected with pleasure, … that is connected with equanimity, …

original: ajjhattārammaṇo, atthi bahiddhārammaṇo, atthi ajjhattabahiddhārammaṇo, atthi kāmāvacaro,
analyzed: ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ atthi bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ atthi ajjhatta bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ atthi kāmāvacaro
translated: that has an internal object, that has an external object, that has an internal-external object, that is connected to the sense-sphere,

original: atthi rūpāvacaro, atthi arūpāvacaro, atthi apariyāpanno, sotasamphassapaccayā …pe…
analyzed: atthi rūpāvacaraḥ atthi arūpāvacaraḥ atthi apariyāpanno sota samphassa paccayā pe
translated: that is connected to the form-sphere, that is connected to the formless-sphere, that is unconnected, from ear-contact as a condition …
from nose-contact as a condition …
from tongue-contact as a condition …
from body-contact as a condition …

original: manosamphassapaccayā saññākkhandho atthi ajjhattārammaṇo, atthi bahiddhārammaṇo,
analyzed: manaḥ samphassa paccayā saññā kkhandho atthi ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ atthi bahiddha ārammaṇaḥ
translated: Dependent on mind-contact there is a perception aggregate that is internal and has internal objects, that is external and has external objects,

original: atthi ajjhattabahiddhārammaṇo, atthi kāmāvacaro, atthi rūpāvacaro, atthi arūpāvacaro,
analyzed: atthi ajjhatta bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ atthi kāmāvacaraḥ atthi rūpāvacaraḥ atthi arūpāvacaraḥ
translated: that is internal and external and has internal and external objects, that is of the sense sphere, that is of the fine-material sphere, that is of the immaterial sphere,

original: atthi apariyāpanno, cakkhusamphassajā saññā, sotasamphassajā saññā, ghānasamphassajā
analyzed: atthi a pariyāpannaḥ cakkhu samphassa jā saññā sota samphassa jā saññā ghāna samphassa jā
translated: that is not to be included. Perception born of eye-contact, perception born of ear-contact, perception born of nose-contact,

original: saññā, jivhāsamphassajā saññā, kāyasamphassajā saññā, manosamphassajā saññā.
analyzed: saññā jivhā samphassa jā saññā kāya samphassa jā saññā manaḥ samphassa jā saññā
translated: perception born of tongue-contact, perception born of body-contact, perception born of mind-contact.
Thus the perception aggregate is of many kinds.

analyzed: ayam vuccati saññā khandho  saṅkhāra kkhandha
translated: This is called the perception aggregate.🔽.. The formations aggregate
Herein, what is the formations aggregate?
In one way the formations aggregate is:
associated with consciousness.
In two ways the formations aggregate is:
there is a cause, there is no cause.
In three ways the formations aggregate is:

original: atthi kusalo, atthi akusalo, atthi abyākato.
analyzed: atthi kusalaḥ atthi akusalaḥ atthi abyākataḥ
translated: there is the profitable, there is the unprofitable, there is the indeterminate.
In four ways the formations aggregate is:

original: atthi kāmāvacaro, atthi rūpāvacaro, atthi arūpāvacaro, atthi apariyāpanno.
analyzed: atthi kāmāvacaraḥ atthi rūpāvacaraḥ atthi arūpāvacaraḥ atthi apariyāpanno
translated: there is the form-sphere, there is the formless-sphere, there is the unincluded.
The formations-group is fivefold by way of the five faculties:

original: atthi sukhindriyasampayutto, atthi dukkhindriyasampayutto, atthi somanassindriyasampayutto, atthi domanassindriyasampayutto, atthi upekkhindriyasampayutto.
analyzed: atthi sukha indriya sampayuttaḥ atthi dukkha indriya sampayuttaḥ atthi somanassa indriya sampayuttaḥ atthi domanassa indriya sampayuttaḥ atthi upekkhā indriya sampayuttaḥ
translated: there is (the formations-group) associated with the pleasure faculty, there is (the formations-group) associated with the pain faculty, there is (the formations-group) associated with the happiness faculty, there is (the formations-group) associated with the grief faculty, there is (the formations-group) associated with the equanimity faculty.
Thus the formations-group is fivefold.
The formations-group is sixfold by way of the six kinds of contact:

original: cakkhusamphassajā cetanā, sotasamphassajā cetanā, ghānasamphassajā cetanā, jivhāsamphassajā cetanā, kāyasamphassajā cetanā, manosamphassajā cetanā.
analyzed: cakkhu samphassa jā cetanā sota samphassa jā cetanā ghāna samphassa jā cetanā jivhā samphassa jā cetanā kāya samphassa jā cetanā manas samphassa jā cetanā
translated: there is volition arisen from eye-contact, there is volition arisen from ear-contact, there is volition arisen from nose-contact, there is volition arisen from tongue-contact, there is volition arisen from body-contact, there is volition arisen from mind-contact.
Thus the formations-group is sixfold.
The formations-group is sevenfold by way of the seven stations of consciousness:

original: cakkhusamphassajā cetanā, sotasamphassajā cetanā, ghānasamphassajā cetanā, jivhāsamphassajā
analyzed: cakkhu samphassa jā cetanā sota samphassa jā cetanā ghāna samphassa jā cetanā jivhā samphassa jā
translated: there is volition arisen from eye-contact, there is volition arisen from ear-contact, there is volition arisen from nose-contact, there is volition arisen from tongue-contact,

original: cetanā, kāyasamphassajā cetanā, manodhātusamphassajā cetanā, manoviññāṇadhātusamphassajā cetanā.
analyzed: cetanā kāya samphassa jā cetanā manaḥ dhātu samphassa jā cetanā manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu samphassa jā cetanā
translated: intention born of eye-contact, intention born of ear-contact, intention born of nose-contact, intention born of tongue-contact, intention born of body-contact, intention born of mind-contact, intention born of the mind element, intention born of the mind-consciousness element.
In this way, the formations aggregate is sevenfold.
The formations aggregate is eightfold:
intention born of eye-contact …

original: kāyasamphassajā cetanā atthi sukhasahagatā, atthi dukkhasahagatā, manodhātusamphassajā cetanā, manoviññāṇadhātusamphassajā cetanā.
analyzed: kāya samphassa jā cetanā atthi sukha sahagatā atthi dukkha sahagatā manas dhātu samphassa jā cetanā manas viññāṇa dhātu samphassa jā cetanā
translated: intention born of body-contact is either connected with pleasure or connected with pain, intention born of the mind element, intention born of the mind-consciousness element.
In this way, the formations aggregate is eightfold.
The formations aggregate is ninefold:
intention born of eye-contact …

original: manodhātusamphassajā cetanā, manoviññāṇadhātusamphassajā cetanā atthi kusalā, atthi akusalā, atthi abyākatā.
analyzed: manaḥ dhātu samphassa jā cetanā manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu samphassa jā cetanā atthi kusalā atthi akusalā atthi abyākatā
translated: intention born of the mind element, intention born of the mind-consciousness element is either wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate.
In this way, the formations aggregate is ninefold.
The formations aggregate is tenfold:
intention born of eye-contact …

original: kāyasamphassajā cetanā atthi sukhasahagatā, atthi dukkhasahagatā, manodhātusamphassajā cetanā, manoviññāṇadhātusamphassajā cetanā atthi kusalā, atthi akusalā, atthi abyākatā.
analyzed: kāya samphassa jā cetanā atthi sukha sahagatā atthi dukkha sahagatā manaḥ dhātu samphassa jā cetanā manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu samphassa jā cetanā atthi kusalā atthi akusalā atthi abyākatā
translated: There is bodily volition that is pleasant, there is bodily volition that is painful, there is mental volition that is associated with the mind element, there is mental volition that is associated with the mind-consciousness element, there is wholesome, there is unwholesome, there is indeterminate.
Thus the formations aggregate is of ten kinds.
In one way the formations aggregate is:
associated with consciousness.
In two ways the formations aggregate is:
there is that which is a cause, there is that which is not a cause.

original: Tividhena saṅkhārakkhandho—🔽atthi sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto, atthi dukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto, atthi adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto.🔽Atthi vipāko, atthi vipākadhammadhammo, atthi nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo.
analyzed: tividhena saṅkhāra kkhandho  atthi sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ atthi dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ atthi adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ  atthi vipākaḥ atthi vipāka dhamma dhammo atthi neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammo
translated: In three ways the formations aggregate is:🔽associated with pleasant feeling, associated with painful feeling, associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling.🔽there is result, there is a state having result, there is neither-result-nor-a-state-having-result.

original: Atthi upādinnupādāniyo, atthi anupādinnupādāniyo, atthi anupādinnaanupādāniyo.
analyzed: atthi upādinnupādāniyaḥ atthi anupādinnupādāniyaḥ atthi anupādinna anupādāniyaḥ
translated: there is that which is clung to and causes clinging, there is that which is not clung to but causes clinging, there is that which is not clung to and does not cause clinging.

original: Atthi saṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko, atthi asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko, atthi asaṅkiliṭṭhaasaṅkilesiko.
analyzed: atthi saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ atthi a saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ atthi a saṅkiliṭṭha asaṅkilesikaḥ
translated: There is that which is defiled and has a defiled object, that which is defiled but has an undefiled object, and that which is undefiled and has an undefiled object.

original: Atthi savitakkasavicāro, atthi avitakkavicāramatto, atthi avitakkaavicāro.
analyzed: atthi sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ atthi a vitakka vicāra mattaḥ atthi a vitakka a vicāraḥ
translated: There is that which is accompanied by applied and sustained thought, that which is accompanied by neither, and that which is accompanied by sustained thought only.

original: Atthi pītisahagato, atthi sukhasahagato, atthi upekkhāsahagato.
analyzed: atthi pīti sahagataḥ atthi sukha sahagataḥ atthi upekkhā sahagataḥ
translated: There is that which is accompanied by joy, that which is accompanied by happiness, and that which is accompanied by equanimity.

original: Atthi dassanena pahātabbo, atthi bhāvanāya pahātabbo, atthi neva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbo.🔽Atthi dassanena pahātabbahetuko, atthi bhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko, atthi neva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko.🔽Atthi ācayagāmī, atthi apacayagāmī, atthi nevācayagāmināpacayagāmī.
analyzed: atthi dassanena pahātabbaḥ atthi bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ atthi na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ  atthi dassanena pahātabba hetukaḥ atthi bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ atthi na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ  atthi ācaya gāmī atthi apacaya gāmī atthi na iva ācaya gāminā apacaya gāmī
translated: There is that which is to be given up through vision, that which is to be given up through development, and that which is not to be given up.🔽There is that which has a cause to be given up through vision, that which has a cause to be given up through development, and that which has a cause not to be given up.🔽There is that which leads to accumulation, that which leads to decrease, and that which leads neither to accumulation nor to decrease.

original: Atthi sekkho, atthi asekkho, atthi nevasekkhanāsekkho.
analyzed: atthi sekkhaḥ atthi asekkhaḥ atthi neva sekkha na asekkhaḥ
translated: There is that which is for a trainee, that which is for one beyond training, and that which is neither for a trainee nor for one beyond training.

original: Atthi paritto, atthi mahaggato, atthi appamāṇo.
analyzed: atthi parittaḥ atthi mahaggataḥ atthi appamāṇaḥ
translated: There is that which is limited, that which is exalted, and that which is measureless.

original: Atthi parittārammaṇo, atthi mahaggatārammaṇo, atthi appamāṇārammaṇo.
analyzed: atthi paritta ārammaṇaḥ atthi mahaggata ārammaṇaḥ atthi appamāṇa ārammaṇaḥ
translated: There is that which has a limited object, that which has an exalted object, and that which has a measureless object.

original: Atthi hīno, atthi majjhimo, atthi paṇīto.
analyzed: atthi hīnaḥ atthi majjhimaḥ atthi paṇītaḥ
translated: There is the inferior, the medium, and the superior.

original: Atthi micchattaniyato, atthi sammattaniyato, atthi aniyato.
analyzed: atthi micchatta niyataḥ atthi sammatta niyataḥ atthi aniyataḥ
translated: There is the one determined for wrong, the one determined for right, and the undetermined.

original: Atthi maggārammaṇo, atthi maggahetuko, atthi maggādhipati.
analyzed: atthi magga ārammaṇaḥ atthi magga hetukaḥ atthi magga adhipati
translated: There is the one with a path as its object, the one with a path as its cause, and the one with a path as its dominant.

original: Atthi uppanno, atthi anuppanno, atthi uppādī.🔽Atthi atīto, atthi anāgato, atthi paccuppanno.
analyzed: atthi uppannaḥ atthi anuppannaḥ atthi uppādī  atthi atītaḥ atthi anāgataḥ atthi paccuppannaḥ
translated: There is the arisen, the unarisen, and the liable to arise.🔽There is the past, the future, and the present.

original: Atthi atītārammaṇo, atthi anāgatārammaṇo, atthi paccuppannārammaṇo.
analyzed: atthi atīta ārammaṇaḥ atthi anāgata ārammaṇaḥ atthi paccuppanna ārammaṇaḥ
translated: There is the one with a past object, the one with a future object, and the one with a present object.

original: Atthi ajjhatto, atthi bahiddho, atthi ajjhattabahiddho.
analyzed: atthi ajjhattaḥ atthi bahiddhaḥ atthi ajjhatta bahiddhaḥ
translated: There is the internal, the external, and the internal and external.

original: Atthi ajjhattārammaṇo, atthi bahiddhārammaṇo, atthi ajjhattabahiddhārammaṇo …pe….
analyzed: atthi ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ atthi bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ atthi ajjhatta bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ pe
translated: There is the one with an internal object, the one with an external object, and the one with an internal and external object.
The formations aggregate is of ten kinds in this way.
The formations aggregate is of one kind:
associated with consciousness.

analyzed: duvidhena saṅkhāra kkhandho  atthi sa hetukaḥ atthi ahetukaḥ
translated: The formations aggregate is of two kinds:🔽there is the one with a cause, and the one without a cause.

analyzed: atthi hetu sampayuttaḥ atthi hetu vippayuttaḥ
translated: There is the one associated with a cause, and the one dissociated from a cause.

original: Atthi hetu ceva sahetuko ca, atthi sahetuko ceva na ca hetu.🔽Atthi hetu ceva hetusampayutto ca, atthi hetusampayutto ceva na ca hetu.
analyzed: atthi hetu ca iva sa hetuko ca atthi sa hetuko ca iva na ca hetu  atthi hetu ca iva hetu sampayutto ca atthi hetu sampayutto ca iva na ca hetu
translated: There is that which is a cause and also related to a cause; there is that which is related to a cause but is not a cause.🔽There is that which is a cause and also related to a cause; there is that which is related to a cause but is not a cause.

original: Atthi na hetu sahetuko, atthi na hetu ahetuko.
analyzed: atthi na hetu sa hetukaḥ atthi na hetu ahetukaḥ
translated: There is that which is not a cause but is related to a cause; there is that which is neither a cause nor related to a cause.
There is that which is mundane; there is that which is supramundane.

original: Atthi kenaci viññeyyo, atthi kenaci na viññeyyo.🔽Atthi āsavo, atthi no āsavo.🔽Atthi sāsavo, atthi anāsavo.
analyzed: atthi kenacid viññeyyaḥ atthi kenacid na viññeyyaḥ  atthi āsavaḥ atthi no āsavaḥ  atthi sa āsavaḥ atthi anāsavaḥ
translated: There is that which is cognizable by some kind of cognition; there is that which is not cognizable by any kind of cognition.🔽There is that which is subject to cankers; there is that which is not subject to cankers.🔽There is that which is subject to cankers; there is that which is not subject to cankers.

original: Atthi āsavasampayutto, atthi āsavavippayutto.🔽Atthi āsavo ceva sāsavo ca, atthi sāsavo ceva no ca āsavo.🔽Atthi āsavo ceva āsavasampayutto ca, atthi āsavasampayutto ceva no ca āsavo.
analyzed: atthi āsava sampayutto atthi āsava vippayutto  atthi āsavo ca iva sāsavo ca atthi sāsavaḥ ca iva no ca āsavo  atthi āsavo ca iva āsava sampayutto ca atthi āsava sampayutto ca iva no ca āsavo
translated: There is that which is associated with cankers; there is that which is not associated with cankers.🔽There is that which is subject to cankers and also associated with cankers; there is that which is associated with cankers but is not subject to cankers.

analyzed: atthi āsava vippayutta sāsavaḥ atthi āsava vippayutta anāsavaḥ
translated: There is that which is not subject to cankers but is associated with cankers; there is that which is not subject to cankers and is not associated with cankers.

original: Atthi saṁyojanaṁ, atthi no saṁyojanaṁ.🔽Atthi saṁyojaniyo, atthi asaṁyojaniyo.
analyzed: atthi sayojana atthi no sayojana  atthi sayojaniyaḥ atthi a sayojaniyaḥ
translated: There is that which is a fetter; there is that which is not a fetter.

analyzed: atthi sa yojana sampayutto atthi sa yojana vippayutto
translated: There is that which is fettered; there is that which is not fettered.🔽There is that which is associated with fetters; there is that which is not associated with fetters.

original: Atthi saṁyojanañceva saṁyojaniyo ca, atthi saṁyojaniyo ceva no ca saṁyojanaṁ.🔽Atthi saṁyojanañceva saṁyojanasampayutto ca, atthi saṁyojanasampayutto ceva no ca saṁyojanaṁ.
analyzed: atthi sayojanañca iva sayojaniyo ca atthi sayojaniyo ca iva no ca sayojana  atthi sayojana ca iva sayojana sampayutto ca atthi sayojana sampayutto ca iva no ca sayojana
translated: There is that which is a fetter and also fetterable, and there is that which is fetterable but not a fetter.🔽There is that which is a fetter and also associated with a fetter, and there is that which is associated with a fetter but not a fetter.

analyzed: atthi sayojana vippayutta sayojaniyo atthi sayojana vippayutta asayojaniyo
translated: There is that which is dissociated from a fetter and fetterable, and there is that which is dissociated from a fetter and not fetterable.

original: Atthi gantho, atthi no gantho.🔽Atthi ganthaniyo, atthi aganthaniyo.
analyzed: atthi ganthaḥ atthi no gantho  atthi ganthaniyo atthi a ganthaniyo
translated: There is a knot, and there is no knot.🔽There is that which is knotty, and there is that which is not knotty.

original: Atthi ganthasampayutto, atthi ganthavippayutto.🔽Atthi gantho ceva ganthaniyo ca, atthi ganthaniyo ceva no ca gantho.🔽Atthi gantho ceva ganthasampayutto ca, atthi ganthasampayutto ceva no ca gantho.
analyzed: atthi gantha sampayutto atthi gantha vippayutto  atthi gantho ca iva ganthaniyo ca atthi ganthaniyo ca iva no ca gantho  atthi gantho ca iva gantha sampayutto ca atthi gantha sampayutto ca iva no ca gantho
translated: There is that which is associated with a knot, and there is that which is dissociated from a knot.🔽There is that which is a knot and also knotty, and there is that which is knotty but not a knot.🔽There is that which is a knot and also associated with a knot, and there is that which is associated with a knot but not a knot.

analyzed: atthi gantha vippayutta ganthaniyaḥ atthi gantha vippayutta a ganthaniyaḥ
translated: There is that which is dissociated from a knot and knotty, and there is that which is dissociated from a knot and not knotty.

original: Atthi ogho, atthi no ogho.🔽Atthi oghaniyo, atthi anoghaniyo.
analyzed: atthi oghaḥ atthi no oghaḥ  atthi ogha niyaḥ atthi anogha niyaḥ
translated: There is a flood, and there is no flood.🔽There is that which is floodable, and there is that which is not floodable.

analyzed: atthi ogha sampayutto atthi ogha vippayutto
translated: There is that which is associated with a flood, and there is that which is dissociated from a flood.

original: Atthi ogho ceva oghaniyo ca, atthi oghaniyo ceva no ca ogho.🔽Atthi ogho ceva oghasampayutto ca, atthi oghasampayutto ceva no ca ogho.
analyzed: atthi ogho ca iva ogha niyo ca atthi ogha niyo ca iva no ca ogho  atthi ogho ca iva ogha sampayutto ca atthi ogha sampayutto ca iva no ca ogho
translated: There is a flood that is also a pursuit, and there is a pursuit that is not a flood.🔽There is a flood that is also associated with a pursuit, and there is what is associated with a pursuit that is not a flood.

analyzed: atthi ogha vippayutta ogha niyaḥ atthi ogha vippayutta anogha niyaḥ
translated: There is what is dissociated from a flood that is a pursuit, and there is what is dissociated from a flood that is not a pursuit.

original: Atthi yogo, atthi no yogo.🔽Atthi yoganiyo, atthi ayoganiyo.🔽Atthi yogasampayutto, atthi yogavippayutto.
analyzed: atthi yogaḥ atthi no yogaḥ  atthi yoganiyo atthi a yoganiyo  atthi yoga sampayutto atthi yoga vippayutto
translated: There is a bond, and there is no bond.🔽There is what is bound, and there is what is not bound.🔽There is what is associated with a bond, and there is what is dissociated from a bond.

original: Atthi yogo ceva yoganiyo ca, atthi yoganiyo ceva no ca yogo.🔽Atthi yogo ceva yogasampayutto ca, atthi yogasampayutto ceva no ca yogo.
analyzed: atthi yogo ca iva yoga niyo ca atthi yoga niyo ca iva no ca yogo  atthi yogo ca iva yoga sampayutto ca atthi yoga sampayutto ca iva no ca yogo
translated: There is a bond that is also what is bound, and there is what is bound that is not a bond.🔽There is a bond that is also associated with a bond, and there is what is associated with a bond that is not a bond.

analyzed: atthi yoga vippayutta yoga niyo atthi yoga vippayutta a yoga niyo
translated: There is what is dissociated from a bond that is what is bound, and there is what is dissociated from a bond that is not what is bound.

original: Atthi nīvaraṇaṁ, atthi no nīvaraṇaṁ.🔽Atthi nīvaraṇiyo, atthi anīvaraṇiyo.
analyzed: atthi nīvaraṇa atthi no nīvaraṇa  atthi nīvaraṇiyaḥ atthi a nīvaraṇiyaḥ
translated: There is an hindrance, and there is no hindrance.🔽There is what is hindered, and there is what is not hindered.

analyzed: atthi nīvaraṇa sampayutto atthi nīvaraṇa vippayutto
translated: There is what is associated with a hindrance, and there is what is dissociated from a hindrance.

original: Atthi nīvaraṇañceva nīvaraṇiyo ca, atthi nīvaraṇiyo ceva no ca nīvaraṇaṁ.
analyzed: atthi nīvaraṇañca iva nīvaraṇiyo ca atthi nīvaraṇiyo ca iva no ca nīvaraṇa
translated: There is a hindrance that is also what is hindered, and there is what is hindered that is not a hindrance.

original: Atthi nīvaraṇañceva nīvaraṇasampayutto ca, atthi nīvaraṇasampayutto ceva no ca nīvaraṇaṁ.
analyzed: atthi nīvaraṇañca iva nīvaraṇa sampayutto ca atthi nīvaraṇa sampayutto ca iva no ca nīvaraṇa
translated: There is that which is both a hindrance and connected with the hindrances, and there is that which is connected with the hindrances but is not a hindrance.

analyzed: atthi nīvaraṇa vippayutta nīvaraṇiyo atthi nīvaraṇa vippayutta a nīvaraṇiyo
translated: There is that which is unconnected with the hindrances and related to the hindrances, and there is that which is unconnected with the hindrances and unrelated to the hindrances.

original: Atthi parāmāso, atthi no parāmāso.🔽Atthi parāmaṭṭho, atthi aparāmaṭṭho.
analyzed: atthi parāmāsaḥ atthi no parāmāsaḥ  atthi parāmaṭṭhaḥ atthi aparāmaṭṭhaḥ
translated: There is misapprehension, and there is no misapprehension.🔽There is that which is misapprehended, and there is that which is not misapprehended.

analyzed: atthi parāmāsa sampayutto atthi parāmāsa vippayutto
translated: There is that which is associated with misapprehension, and there is that which is dissociated from misapprehension.

original: Atthi parāmāso ceva parāmaṭṭho ca, atthi parāmaṭṭho ceva no ca parāmāso.🔽Atthi parāmāsavippayuttaparāmaṭṭho, atthi parāmāsavippayuttaaparāmaṭṭho.
analyzed: atthi parāmāso ca iva parāmaṭṭho ca atthi parāmaṭṭho ca iva no ca parāmāso  atthi parāmāsa vippayutta parāmaṭṭho atthi parāmāsa vippayutta aparāmaṭṭho
translated: There is that which is both misapprehension and misapprehended, and there is that which is misapprehended but is not misapprehension.🔽There is that which is dissociated from misapprehension and misapprehended, and there is that which is dissociated from misapprehension and not misapprehended.
There is that which is clung to, and there is that which is not clung to.

original: Atthi upādānaṁ, atthi no upādānaṁ.🔽Atthi upādāniyo, atthi anupādāniyo.🔽Atthi upādānasampayutto, atthi upādānavippayutto.
analyzed: atthi upādāna atthi no upādāna  atthi upādāniyaḥ atthi anupādāniyaḥ  atthi upādāna sampayutto atthi upādāna vippayutto
translated: There is clinging, and there is no clinging.🔽There is that which is related to clinging, and there is that which is unrelated to clinging.🔽There is that which is associated with clinging, and there is that which is dissociated from clinging.

original: Atthi upādānañceva upādāniyo ca, atthi upādāniyo ceva no ca upādānaṁ.
analyzed: atthi upādānañca iva upādāniyo ca atthi upādāniyo ca iva no ca upādāna
translated: There is that which is both clinging and related to clinging, and there is that which is related to clinging but is not clinging.

original: Atthi upādānañceva upādānasampayutto ca, atthi upādānasampayutto ceva no ca upādānaṁ.
analyzed: atthi upādānam ca iva upādāna sampayutto ca atthi upādāna sampayutto ca iva no ca upādāna
translated: There is clinging and what is associated with clinging. There is what is associated with clinging but is not clinging.

analyzed: atthi upādāna vippayutta aupādāniyaḥ atthi upādāna vippayutta anupādāniyaḥ
translated: There is what is unconnected with clinging and subject to clinging. There is what is unconnected with clinging and not subject to clinging.

original: Atthi kileso, atthi no kileso.🔽Atthi saṅkilesiko, atthi asaṅkilesiko.🔽Atthi saṅkiliṭṭho, atthi asaṅkiliṭṭho.
analyzed: atthi kilesaḥ atthi no kilesaḥ  atthi saṅkilesikaḥ atthi asaṅkilesikaḥ  atthi saṅkiliṭṭhaḥ atthi a saṅkiliṭṭhaḥ
translated: There is defilement. There is no defilement.🔽There is what is defiled. There is what is undefiled.🔽There is what is defiled. There is what is undefiled.

analyzed: atthi kilesa sampayutto atthi kilesa vippayutto
translated: There is what is associated with defilement. There is what is not associated with defilement.

original: Atthi kileso ceva saṅkilesiko ca, atthi saṅkilesiko ceva no ca kileso.🔽Atthi kileso ceva saṅkiliṭṭho ca, atthi saṅkiliṭṭho ceva no ca kileso.🔽Atthi kileso ceva kilesasampayutto ca, atthi kilesasampayutto ceva no ca kileso.
analyzed: atthi kileso ca iva saṅkilesiko ca atthi saṅkilesikaḥ ca iva no ca kileso  atthi kileso ca iva saṅkiliṭṭho ca atthi saṅkiliṭṭho ca iva no ca kileso  atthi kileso ca iva kilesa sampayutto ca atthi kilesa sampayutto ca iva no ca kileso
translated: There is defilement and what is defiled. There is what is defiled but is not defilement.🔽There is defilement and what is defiled. There is what is defiled but is not defilement.🔽There is defilement and what is associated with defilement. There is what is associated with defilement but is not defilement.

analyzed: atthi kilesa vippayutta saṅkilesiko atthi kilesa vippayutta asaṅkilesiko
translated: There is what is unconnected with defilement and what is defiled. There is what is unconnected with defilement and what is undefiled.

original: Atthi dassanena pahātabbo, atthi na dassanena pahātabbo.
analyzed: atthi dassanena pahātabbo atthi na dassanena pahātabbo
translated: There is what is to be given up by seeing. There is what is not to be given up by seeing.

original: Atthi bhāvanāya pahātabbo, atthi na bhāvanāya pahātabbo.🔽Atthi dassanena pahātabbahetuko, atthi na dassanena pahātabbahetuko.
analyzed: atthi bhāvanāya pahātabbo atthi na bhāvanāya pahātabbo  atthi dassanena pahātabba hetukaḥ atthi na dassanena pahātabba hetukaḥ
translated: Some are to be given up through development, some are not to be given up through development.🔽Some have a cause that is to be given up through vision, some do not have a cause that is to be given up through vision.

original: Atthi bhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko, atthi na bhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko.🔽Atthi savitakko, atthi avitakko.🔽Atthi savicāro, atthi avicāro.
analyzed: atthi bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ atthi na bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ  atthi sa vitakko atthi a vitakko  atthi sa vicāraḥ atthi avicāro
translated: Some have a cause that is to be given up through development, some do not have a cause that is to be given up through development.🔽Some are connected with thinking, some are not connected with thinking.

original: Atthi sappītiko, atthi appītiko.🔽Atthi pītisahagato, atthi na pītisahagato.🔽Atthi sukhasahagato, atthi na sukhasahagato.
analyzed: atthi sappītikaḥ atthi appītikaḥ  atthi pīti sahagataḥ atthi na pīti sahagataḥ  atthi sukha sahagataḥ atthi na sukha sahagataḥ
translated: Some are connected with reflection, some are not connected with reflection.🔽Some are connected with happiness, some are not connected with happiness.🔽Some are connected with joy, some are not connected with joy.

original: Atthi upekkhāsahagato, atthi na upekkhāsahagato.🔽Atthi kāmāvacaro, atthi na kāmāvacaro.🔽Atthi rūpāvacaro, atthi na rūpāvacaro.
analyzed: atthi upekkhā sahagataḥ atthi na upekkhā sahagataḥ  atthi kāmāvacaro atthi na kāmāvacaro  atthi rūpāvacaro atthi na rūpāvacaro
translated: Some are connected with pleasure, some are not connected with pleasure.🔽Some are connected with equanimity, some are not connected with equanimity.🔽Some are in the sense-sphere, some are not in the sense-sphere.🔽Some are in the form-sphere, some are not in the form-sphere.

original: Atthi arūpāvacaro, atthi na arūpāvacaro.🔽Atthi pariyāpanno, atthi apariyāpanno.🔽Atthi niyyāniko, atthi aniyyāniko.
analyzed: atthi arūpāvacaraḥ atthi na arūpāvacaro  atthi pariyāpannaḥ atthi apariyāpannaḥ  atthi niyyānikaḥ atthi aniyyānikaḥ
translated: Some are in the formless-sphere, some are not in the formless-sphere.🔽Some are included, some are not included.🔽Some are emancipations, some are not emancipations.
Some are fixed, some are not fixed.
Some are higher, some are not higher.
There is that which is a refuge. There is that which is not a refuge.
The formation aggregate is threefold:

original: atthi kusalo, atthi akusalo, atthi abyākato …pe….
analyzed: atthi kusalaḥ atthi akusalaḥ atthi abyākataḥ pe
translated: there is that which is wholesome, there is that which is unwholesome, there is that which is indeterminate. …
Thus the formation aggregate is of ten kinds.
The formation aggregate is of one kind:
it is associated with consciousness.
It is of two kinds:
there is that which is a refuge. There is that which is not a refuge.
The formation aggregate is threefold:

original: atthi sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto …pe… atthi ajjhattārammaṇo, atthi bahiddhārammaṇo, atthi ajjhattabahiddhārammaṇo …pe….
analyzed: atthi sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ pe atthi ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ atthi bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ atthi ajjhatta bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ pe

analyzed: evam dasavidhena saṅkhāra kkhandho  duka mūlaka

it is associated with consciousness.

it is associated with cognizance.
The formation aggregate is twofold:

analyzed: atthi ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ atthi bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ atthi ajjhatta bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ pe

The formation aggregate is onefold:
it is associated with cognizance.

analyzed: atthi ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ atthi bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ atthi ajjhatta bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ pe
translated: there is that which has an internal object, there is that which has an external object, there is that which has an internal-external object. …
Thus the formation aggregate is tenfold.

The formation aggregate is onefold:
associated with consciousness.
The formation aggregate is twofold:
there is that which has a cause and that which does not have a cause.
The formation aggregate is threefold:

original: atthi kusalo, atthi akusalo, atthi abyākato …pe….
analyzed: atthi kusalaḥ atthi akusalaḥ atthi abyākataḥ pe

original: atthi sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto, atthi dukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto, atthi adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto …pe….
analyzed: atthi sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ atthi dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ atthi adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ pe
translated: there is that which is associated with pleasant feeling, that which is associated with painful feeling, and that which is associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling. …
Thus the formation aggregate is tenfold.
The formation aggregate is onefold:
associated with consciousness.
