analyzed: atthi hetu sampayuttaḥ atthi hetu vippayuttaḥ
translated: there is that which is associated with a cause and that which is dissociated from a cause.
The formation aggregate is threefold:

original: atthi vipāko, atthi vipākadhammadhammo, atthi nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo …pe….
analyzed: atthi vipākaḥ atthi vipāka dhamma dhammo atthi neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammo pe
translated: there is what is resultant and what has resultant nature, there is what is neither resultant nor has resultant nature. …
In this way the aggregate of volitional formations is of ten kinds.
In one way the aggregate of volitional formations is:
associated with consciousness.
In two ways the aggregate of volitional formations is:

original: atthi hetu ceva sahetuko ca, atthi sahetuko ceva na ca hetu.
analyzed: atthi hetu ca iva sa hetuko ca atthi sa hetuko ca iva na ca hetu
translated: there is what is a cause and also has a cause, there is what has a cause but is not a cause.
In three ways the aggregate of volitional formations is:

original: atthi upādinnupādāniyo, atthi anupādinnupādāniyo, atthi anupādinnaanupādāniyo …pe….
analyzed: atthi upādinnupādāniyaḥ atthi anupādinnupādāniyaḥ atthi anupādinna anupādāniyaḥ pe
translated: there is what is clung to and a condition for clinging, there is what is not clung to but a condition for clinging, there is what is not clung to nor a condition for clinging. …
In this way the aggregate of volitional formations is of ten kinds.
In one way the aggregate of volitional formations is:
associated with consciousness.
In two ways the aggregate of volitional formations is:

original: atthi hetu ceva hetusampayutto ca, atthi hetusampayutto ceva na ca hetu.
analyzed: atthi hetu ca iva hetu sampayutto ca atthi hetu sampayutto ca iva na ca hetu
translated: there is what is a cause and also associated with a cause, there is what is associated with a cause but is not a cause.
In three ways the aggregate of volitional formations is:

original: atthi saṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko, atthi asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko, atthi asaṅkiliṭṭhaasaṅkilesiko …pe….
analyzed: atthi saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ atthi a saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ atthi a saṅkiliṭṭha asaṅkilesikaḥ pe
translated: there is what is defiled and subject to defilements, there is what is not defiled but subject to defilements, there is what is neither defiled nor subject to defilements. …

analyzed: evam dasavidhena saṅkhāra kkhandho  ekavidhena saṅkhāra kkhandho
translated: So the formations aggregate is of ten kinds.
As to the kinds of consciousness: the formations aggregate is of one kind, being associated with consciousness.

original: atthi na hetu sahetuko, atthi na hetu ahetuko.🔽Tividhena saṅkhārakkhandho—
analyzed: atthi na hetu sa hetukaḥ atthi na hetu ahetukaḥ  tividhena saṅkhāra kkhandho
translated: As to root cause and so on: it is of two kinds as with root cause and dissociated from a root cause.

original: atthi savitakkasavicāro, atthi avitakkavicāramatto, atthi avitakkaavicāro …pe….
analyzed: atthi sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ atthi a vitakka vicāra mattaḥ atthi a vitakka a vicāraḥ
translated: As to accompanied by joy, and so on: it is of three kinds as accompanied by joy, accompanied by equanimity, and unaccompanied by either.

analyzed: evam dasavidhena saṅkhāra kkhandho  ekavidhena saṅkhāra kkhandho
translated: So the formations aggregate is of ten kinds.
As to the kinds of consciousness: the formations aggregate is of one kind, being associated with consciousness.

analyzed: atthi lokiyaḥ atthi lokuttaro  tividhena saṅkhāra kkhandho
translated: As to mundane and so on: it is of two kinds as mundane and supramundane.

original: atthi pītisahagato, atthi sukhasahagato, atthi upekkhāsahagato …pe….
analyzed: atthi pīti sahagataḥ atthi sukha sahagataḥ atthi upekkhā sahagataḥ pe
translated: As to accompanied by joy, and so on: it is of three kinds as accompanied by joy, accompanied by happiness, and accompanied by equanimity.

analyzed: evam dasavidhena saṅkhāra kkhandho  ekavidhena saṅkhāra kkhandho
translated: So the formations aggregate is of ten kinds.
As to the kinds of consciousness: the formations aggregate is of one kind, being associated with consciousness.

original: atthi kenaci viññeyyo, atthi kenaci na viññeyyo.
analyzed: atthi kenacid viññeyyaḥ atthi kenacid na viññeyyaḥ
translated: As to cognizable by means of an awareness and so on: it is of two kinds as cognizable by means of an awareness and as not cognizable by means of an awareness.
As to accompanied by joy, and so on: it is of three kinds as accompanied by joy, accompanied by happiness, and accompanied by equanimity.

original: atthi dassanena pahātabbo, atthi bhāvanāya pahātabbo, atthi neva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbo …pe….
analyzed: atthi dassanena pahātabbaḥ atthi bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ atthi na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ pe
translated: there is what is to be given up by seeing, what is to be given up by development, and what is not to be given up by either seeing or development. …
In this way the aggregate of volitional formations is of ten kinds.
In one way the aggregate of volitional formations is:
associated with consciousness.
In two ways the aggregate of volitional formations is:
there is what is subject to cankers, and what is not subject to cankers.
In three ways the aggregate of volitional formations is:

original: atthi dassanena pahātabbahetuko, atthi bhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko, atthi neva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko …pe….
analyzed: atthi dassanena pahātabba hetukaḥ atthi bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ atthi na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ pe
translated: there is what has a root that is to be given up by seeing, what has a root that is to be given up by development, and what has a root that is not to be given up by either seeing or development. …
In this way the aggregate of volitional formations is of ten kinds.
In one way the aggregate of volitional formations is:
In two ways the aggregate of volitional formations is:
there is what is corrupted, and what is uncorrupted.
In three ways the aggregate of volitional formations is:

original: atthi ācayagāmī, atthi apacayagāmī, atthi nevācayagāmināpacayagāmī …pe….
analyzed: atthi ācaya gāmī atthi apacaya gāmī atthi na iva ācaya gāminā apacaya gāmī pe
translated: there is what leads to accumulation, what leads to decrease, and what leads neither to accumulation nor to decrease. …
In this way the aggregate of volitional formations is of ten kinds.
In one way the aggregate of volitional formations is:
associated with the mind.
The formation aggregate is twofold:

analyzed: atthi āsava sampayutto atthi āsava vippayutto
translated: connected with the taints and unconnected with the taints.
The formation aggregate is threefold:

original: atthi sekkho, atthi asekkho, atthi nevasekkhanāsekkho …pe….
analyzed: atthi sekkhaḥ atthi asekkhaḥ atthi nevasekkhanāsekkho pe
translated: in one in training, in one beyond training, and in one neither in training nor beyond training. …
Thus the formation aggregate is of ten kinds.
The formation aggregate is of one kind:
associated with the mind.
The formation aggregate is twofold:

original: atthi āsavo ceva sāsavo ca, atthi sāsavo ceva no ca āsavo.
analyzed: atthi āsavo ca iva sāsavo ca atthi sāsavaḥ ca iva no ca āsavo
translated: a taint and something that is subject to taints, and something that is subject to taints but is not a taint.
The formation aggregate is threefold:

original: atthi paritto, atthi mahaggato, atthi appamāṇo …pe….
analyzed: atthi parittaḥ atthi mahaggataḥ atthi appamāṇaḥ pe
translated: limited, exalted, and immeasurable. …
Thus the formation aggregate is of ten kinds.
The formation aggregate is of one kind:
associated with the mind.
The formation aggregate is twofold:

original: atthi āsavo ceva āsavasampayutto ca, atthi āsavasampayutto ceva no ca āsavo.
analyzed: atthi āsavo ca iva āsava sampayutto ca atthi āsava sampayutto ca iva no ca āsavo
translated: a taint and something connected with taints, and something connected with taints but is not a taint.
The formation aggregate is threefold:

original: atthi parittārammaṇo, atthi mahaggatārammaṇo, atthi appamāṇārammaṇo …pe….
analyzed: atthi paritta ārammaṇaḥ atthi mahaggata ārammaṇaḥ atthi appamāṇa ārammaṇaḥ pe
translated: There is that with a limited object, there is that with a great object, there is that with an infinite object. …
In this way the formations aggregate is of ten kinds.
In one way the formations aggregate is:
associated with consciousness.
In two ways the formations aggregate is:

analyzed: atthi āsava vippayutta sāsavaḥ atthi āsava vippayutta anāsavaḥ
translated: there is that which is dissociated from the defilements and possesses the defilements, there is that which is dissociated from the defilements and does not possess the defilements.
In three ways the formations aggregate is:

original: atthi hīno, atthi majjhimo, atthi paṇīto …pe….
analyzed: atthi hīnaḥ atthi majjhimaḥ atthi paṇītaḥ pe
translated: there is that which is inferior, there is that which is medium, there is that which is superior. …
In this way the formations aggregate is of ten kinds.
In one way the formations aggregate is:
associated with consciousness.
In two ways the formations aggregate is:
there is that which is a fetter, there is that which is not a fetter.
In three ways the formations aggregate is:

original: atthi micchattaniyato, atthi sammattaniyato, atthi aniyato …pe….
analyzed: atthi micchatta niyataḥ atthi sammatta niyataḥ atthi aniyataḥ pe
translated: there is that which is subject to wrong, there is that which is subject to right, there is that which is not subject to either. …
In this way the formations aggregate is of ten kinds.
In one way the formations aggregate is:
associated with consciousness.
In two ways the formations aggregate is:
There is what is connected to the fetters and what is not connected to the fetters.
The formation aggregate is threefold:

original: atthi maggārammaṇo, atthi maggahetuko, atthi maggādhipati …pe….
analyzed: atthi magga ārammaṇaḥ atthi magga hetukaḥ atthi magga adhipati pe
translated: There is what has the path as its object, what has the path as its cause, and what is dominant in the path. …
In this way, the formation aggregate is tenfold.
The formation aggregate is onefold:
It is associated with consciousness.
The formation aggregate is twofold:

analyzed: atthi sa yojana sampayutto atthi sa yojana vippayutto
translated: There is what is connected to the fetters and what is not connected to the fetters.
The formation aggregate is threefold:

original: atthi uppanno, atthi anuppanno, atthi uppādī …pe….
analyzed: atthi uppannaḥ atthi anuppannaḥ atthi uppādī pe
translated: There is what has arisen, what has not arisen, and what is in the process of arising. …
In this way, the formation aggregate is tenfold.
The formation aggregate is onefold:
It is associated with consciousness.
The formation aggregate is twofold:

original: atthi saṁyojanañceva saṁyojaniyo ca, atthi saṁyojaniyo ceva no ca saṁyojanaṁ.
analyzed: atthi sayojanañca iva sayojaniyo ca atthi sayojaniyo ca iva no ca sayojana
translated: There is what is a fetter and also connected to the fetters, and what is connected to the fetters but is not a fetter.
The formation aggregate is threefold:

original: atthi atīto, atthi anāgato, atthi paccuppanno …pe….
analyzed: atthi atītaḥ atthi anāgataḥ atthi paccuppannaḥ pe
translated: There is what is past, what is future, and what is present. …
In this way, the formation aggregate is tenfold.
The formation aggregate is onefold:
associated with consciousness.
It is twofold:

original: atthi saṁyojanañceva saṁyojanasampayutto ca, atthi saṁyojanasampayutto ceva no ca saṁyojanaṁ.
analyzed: atthi sayojana ca iva sayojana sampayutto ca atthi sayojana sampayutto ca iva no ca sayojana
translated: there is that which is a fetter and also associated with a fetter, and there is that which is associated with a fetter but is not a fetter.
It is threefold:

original: atthi atītārammaṇo, atthi anāgatārammaṇo, atthi paccuppannārammaṇo …pe….
analyzed: atthi atīta ārammaṇaḥ atthi anāgata ārammaṇaḥ atthi paccuppanna ārammaṇaḥ pe
translated: there is that which has a past object, there is that which has a future object, there is that which has a present object. …
Thus the formation aggregate is tenfold.
The formation aggregate is onefold:
associated with consciousness.🔽It is twofold:

analyzed: atthi sayojana vippayutta sayojaniyo atthi sayojana vippayutta asayojaniyo
translated: there is that which is dissociated from the fetters but is subject to the fetters, and there is that which is dissociated from the fetters and is not subject to the fetters.
It is threefold:

original: atthi ajjhatto, atthi bahiddho, atthi ajjhattabahiddho …pe….
analyzed: atthi ajjhattaḥ atthi bahiddhaḥ atthi ajjhatta bahiddhaḥ pe
translated: there is that which is internal, there is that which is external, there is that which is both internal and external. …
Thus the formation aggregate is tenfold.
The formation aggregate is onefold:
associated with consciousness.
It is twofold:
there is that which is a knot, and there is that which is not a knot.
The formations aggregate is threefold:

original: atthi ajjhattārammaṇo, atthi bahiddhārammaṇo, atthi ajjhattabahiddhārammaṇo …pe….
analyzed: atthi ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ atthi bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ atthi ajjhatta bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ pe
translated: there is that with internal objects, there is that with external objects, there is that with internal-external objects. …
Thus the formations aggregate is of ten kinds.
The two-fold increase.
The formations aggregate is sevenfold:

original: atthi kusalo, atthi akusalo, atthi abyākato;
analyzed: atthi kusalaḥ atthi akusalaḥ atthi abyākataḥ
translated: there is profitable, there is unprofitable, there is indeterminate;

original: atthi kāmāvacaro, atthi rūpāvacaro, atthi arūpāvacaro, atthi apariyāpanno.
analyzed: atthi kāmāvacaraḥ atthi rūpāvacaraḥ atthi arūpāvacaraḥ atthi apariyāpanno
translated: there is of the sense sphere, there is of the fine-material sphere, there is of the immaterial sphere, there is unincluded.
Thus the formations aggregate is of seven kinds.
Another sevenfold classification of the formations aggregate is this:

original: atthi sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto, atthi dukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto, atthi adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto;
analyzed: atthi sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ atthi dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ atthi adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ
translated: there is that associated with pleasant feeling, there is that associated with painful feeling, there is that associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling;

original: atthi kāmāvacaro, atthi rūpāvacaro, atthi arūpāvacaro, atthi apariyāpanno …pe… atthi ajjhattārammaṇo, atthi bahiddhārammaṇo atthi ajjhattabahiddhārammaṇo;
analyzed: atthi kāmāvacaraḥ atthi rūpāvacaraḥ atthi arūpāvacaraḥ atthi apariyāpannaḥ pe atthi ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ atthi bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ atthi ajjhatta bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ
translated: there is that of the sense sphere, there is that of the fine-material sphere, there is that of the immaterial sphere, there is that unincluded; … there is that with internal objects, there is that with external objects, there is that with internal-external objects;

original: atthi kāmāvacaro, atthi rūpāvacaro, atthi arūpāvacaro, atthi apariyāpanno.
analyzed: atthi kāmāvacaraḥ atthi rūpāvacaraḥ atthi arūpāvacaraḥ atthi apariyāpanno
translated: There is the form-sphere, there is the formless-sphere, there is the unincluded.
Thus the formations-group is sevenfold.
The formations-group is twenty-fourfold—

original: cakkhusamphassapaccayā saṅkhārakkhandho atthi kusalo, atthi akusalo, atthi abyākato;🔽sotasamphassapaccayā …pe…🔽ghānasamphassapaccayā …pe…
analyzed: cakkhu samphassa paccayā saṅkhāra kkhandho atthi kusalaḥ atthi akusalaḥ atthi abyākataḥ  sota samphassa paccayā pe  ghāna samphassa paccayā pe
translated: The formations-group conditioned by eye-contact is sometimes wholesome, sometimes unwholesome, sometimes indeterminate;🔽The formations-group conditioned by ear-contact …🔽The formations-group conditioned by nose-contact …
The formations-group conditioned by tongue-contact …
The formations-group conditioned by body-contact …

original: manosamphassapaccayā saṅkhārakkhandho atthi kusalo, atthi akusalo, atthi abyākato;
analyzed: manaḥ samphassa paccayā saṅkhāra kkhandho atthi kusalaḥ atthi akusalaḥ atthi abyākataḥ
translated: The formations-group conditioned by mind-contact is sometimes wholesome, sometimes unwholesome, sometimes indeterminate;
Intentions based on eye-contact …

analyzed: manaḥ samphassa jā cetanā  evam catuvīsatividhena saṅkhāra kkhandho
translated: Intentions based on mind-contact.🔽Thus the formations-group is twenty-fourfold.
Another way the formations-group is twenty-fourfold—

original: cakkhusamphassapaccayā saṅkhārakkhandho atthi sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto …pe… atthi ajjhattārammaṇo, atthi bahiddhārammaṇo, atthi ajjhattabahiddhārammaṇo;
analyzed: cakkhu samphassa paccayā saṅkhāra kkhandho atthi sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ pe atthi ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ atthi bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ atthi ajjhatta bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ
translated: The formations aggregate conditioned by eye-contact is sometimes associated with pleasant feeling …
There is intention based on eye-contact …

analyzed: manaḥ samphassa jā cetanā  sota samphassa paccayā pe  ghāna samphassa paccayā pe
translated: There is intention based on mind-contact.🔽The formations aggregate conditioned by ear-contact …🔽The formations aggregate conditioned by nose-contact …
The formations aggregate conditioned by tongue-contact …
The formations aggregate conditioned by body-contact …

original: manosamphassapaccayā saṅkhārakkhandho atthi sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto …pe… atthi ajjhattārammaṇo, atthi bahiddhārammaṇo, atthi ajjhattabahiddhārammaṇo;
analyzed: manaḥ samphassa paccayā saṅkhāra kkhandho atthi sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ pe atthi ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ atthi bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ atthi ajjhatta bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ
translated: The formations aggregate conditioned by mind-contact is sometimes associated with pleasant feeling … There is intention based on mind-contact.

original: cakkhusamphassajā cetanā, sotasamphassajā cetanā, ghānasamphassajā cetanā, jivhāsamphassajā cetanā, kāyasamphassajā cetanā, manosamphassajā cetanā.
analyzed: cakkhu samphassa jā cetanā sota samphassa jā cetanā ghāna samphassa jā cetanā jivhā samphassa jā cetanā kāya samphassa jā cetanā manas samphassa jā cetanā
translated: There is intention based on eye-contact, intention based on ear-contact, intention based on nose-contact, intention based on tongue-contact, intention based on body-contact, and intention based on mind-contact.
In this way, the formations aggregate is of twenty-four kinds.
The formations aggregate is of thirty kinds:

original: cakkhusamphassapaccayā saṅkhārakkhandho atthi kāmāvacaro, atthi rūpāvacaro, atthi arūpāvacaro, atthi apariyāpanno;
analyzed: cakkhu samphassa paccayā saṅkhāra kkhandho atthi kāmāvacaraḥ atthi rūpāvacaraḥ atthi arūpāvacaraḥ atthi apariyāpannaḥ
translated: The formations aggregate conditioned by eye-contact is sometimes of the sense sphere, sometimes of the fine-material sphere, sometimes of the immaterial sphere, and sometimes it is not classified.

analyzed: sota samphassa paccayā pe  ghāna samphassa paccayā pe
translated: The formations aggregate conditioned by ear-contact …🔽The formations aggregate conditioned by nose-contact …
The formations aggregate conditioned by tongue-contact …
The formations aggregate conditioned by body-contact …

original: manosamphassapaccayā saṅkhārakkhandho atthi kāmāvacaro, atthi rūpāvacaro, atthi arūpāvacaro, atthi apariyāpanno;
analyzed: manaḥ samphassa paccayā saṅkhāra kkhandho atthi kāmāvacaraḥ atthi rūpāvacaraḥ atthi arūpāvacaraḥ atthi apariyāpannaḥ
translated: The formations aggregate conditioned by mind-contact is sometimes of the sense sphere, sometimes of the fine-material sphere, sometimes of the immaterial sphere, and sometimes it is not classified.
The intention based on eye-contact …
The intention based on mind-contact.
Thus the formations aggregate is of thirty kinds.
The formations aggregate is of many kinds—

original: cakkhusamphassapaccayā saṅkhārakkhandho atthi kusalo, atthi akusalo, atthi abyākato, atthi kāmāvacaro, atthi rūpāvacaro, atthi arūpāvacaro, atthi apariyāpanno;🔽sotasamphassapaccayā …pe…🔽ghānasamphassapaccayā …pe…
analyzed: cakkhu samphassa paccayā saṅkhāra kkhandho atthi kusalaḥ atthi akusalaḥ atthi abyākataḥ atthi kāmāvacaraḥ atthi rūpāvacaraḥ atthi arūpāvacaraḥ atthi apariyāpannaḥ  sota samphassa paccayā pe  ghāna samphassa paccayā pe
translated: The formations aggregate conditioned by eye-contact is wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate; it is of the sense sphere, the fine-material sphere, the immaterial sphere, or it is not classified.🔽The formations aggregate conditioned by ear-contact …🔽The formations aggregate conditioned by nose-contact …
The formations aggregate conditioned by tongue-contact …
From body-contact as a condition: …

original: manosamphassapaccayā saṅkhārakkhandho atthi kusalo, atthi akusalo, atthi abyākato, atthi kāmāvacaro, atthi rūpāvacaro, atthi arūpāvacaro, atthi apariyāpanno;
analyzed: manaḥ samphassa paccayā saṅkhāra kkhandho atthi kusalaḥ atthi akusalaḥ atthi abyākataḥ atthi kāmāvacaraḥ atthi rūpāvacaraḥ atthi arūpāvacaraḥ atthi apariyāpannaḥ
translated: From mind-contact as a condition: the formations aggregate is sometimes wholesome, sometimes unwholesome, sometimes indeterminate, sometimes belonging to the sense sphere, sometimes belonging to the form-sphere, sometimes belonging to the formless-sphere, sometimes not belonging to any of the three spheres.

original: cakkhusamphassajā cetanā, sotasamphassajā cetanā, ghānasamphassajā cetanā, jivhāsamphassajā cetanā, kāyasamphassajā cetanā, manosamphassajā cetanā.
analyzed: cakkhu samphassa jā cetanā sota samphassa jā cetanā ghāna samphassa jā cetanā jivhā samphassa jā cetanā kāya samphassa jā cetanā manas samphassa jā cetanā
translated: Mind-direction-thoughts born of eye-contact, mind-direction-thoughts born of ear-contact, mind-direction-thoughts born of nose-contact, mind-direction-thoughts born of tongue-contact, mind-direction-thoughts born of body-contact, mind-direction-thoughts born of mind-contact.
In this way the formations aggregate is manifold.

original: Aparopi bahuvidhena saṅkhārakkhandho—🔽cakkhusamphassapaccayā saṅkhārakkhandho atthi sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto, atthi
analyzed: aparaḥ api bahuvidhena saṅkhāra kkhandho  cakkhu samphassa paccayā saṅkhāra kkhandho atthi sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ atthi
translated: Furthermore, the formations aggregate is manifold:

original: dukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto, atthi adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto …pe… atthi
analyzed: dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ atthi adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ pe atthi
translated: From eye-contact as a condition: the formations aggregate is sometimes connected with pleasure, sometimes connected with pain, sometimes connected with neither pleasure nor pain, …

original: ajjhattārammaṇo, atthi bahiddhārammaṇo, atthi ajjhattabahiddhārammaṇo, atthi kāmāvacaro,
analyzed: ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ atthi bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ atthi ajjhatta bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ atthi kāmāvacaro
translated: sometimes connected with the internal, sometimes connected with the external, sometimes connected with the internal and the external, sometimes belonging to the sense-sphere,

original: atthi rūpāvacaro, atthi arūpāvacaro, atthi apariyāpanno;
analyzed: atthi rūpāvacaraḥ atthi arūpāvacaraḥ atthi apariyāpanno
translated: there is that which is in the form-world, there is that which is in the formless-world, there is that which is not to be included here;

analyzed: sota samphassa paccayā pe  ghāna samphassa paccayā pe
translated: with mind-contact as condition there is a (volitional) process in the form of a resultant feeling that is pleasant …🔽with nose-contact as condition …
with tongue-contact as condition …
with body-contact as condition …

original: manosamphassapaccayā saṅkhārakkhandho atthi sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto …pe… atthi
analyzed: manaḥ samphassa paccayā saṅkhāra kkhandho atthi sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ pe atthi
translated: with mind-contact as condition there is a (volitional) process in the form of a resultant feeling that is pleasant …

original: ajjhattārammaṇo, atthi bahiddhārammaṇo, atthi ajjhattabahiddhārammaṇo, atthi kāmāvacaro,
analyzed: ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ atthi bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ atthi ajjhatta bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ atthi kāmāvacaro
translated: there is that which is an internal object, there is that which is an external object, there is that which is an internal and external object, there is that which is in the sense-sphere,

original: atthi rūpāvacaro, atthi arūpāvacaro, atthi apariyāpanno;
analyzed: atthi rūpāvacaraḥ atthi arūpāvacaraḥ atthi apariyāpanno
translated: there is that which is in the form-world, there is that which is in the formless-world, there is that which is not to be included here;

original: cakkhusamphassajā cetanā, sotasamphassajā cetanā, ghānasamphassajā cetanā, jivhāsamphassajā cetanā, kāyasamphassajā cetanā, manosamphassajā cetanā.
analyzed: cakkhu samphassa jā cetanā sota samphassa jā cetanā ghāna samphassa jā cetanā jivhā samphassa jā cetanā kāya samphassa jā cetanā manas samphassa jā cetanā
translated: intentions born of eye-contact, intentions born of ear-contact, intentions born of nose-contact, intentions born of tongue-contact, intentions born of body-contact, intentions born of mind-contact.
In this way also, (the aggregate) is manifold as the (volitional) process aggregate.
This, monastics, is said to be the (volitional) process aggregate.
… The consciousness aggregate
Herein, what is the consciousness aggregate?
In one way, the consciousness aggregate is—
associated with contact.
The consciousness aggregate is twofold:
there is that with cause, and there is that without cause.
The consciousness aggregate is threefold:

original: atthi kusalo, atthi akusalo, atthi abyākato.
analyzed: atthi kusalaḥ atthi akusalaḥ atthi abyākataḥ
translated: there is that which is wholesome, there is that which is unwholesome, there is that which is indeterminate.
The consciousness aggregate is fourfold:

original: atthi kāmāvacaro, atthi rūpāvacaro, atthi arūpāvacaro, atthi apariyāpanno.
analyzed: atthi kāmāvacaraḥ atthi rūpāvacaraḥ atthi arūpāvacaraḥ atthi apariyāpanno
translated: there is that which is connected with the sensual realm, there is that which is connected with the form realm, there is that which is connected with the formless realm, there is that which is unconnected.
The consciousness aggregate is fivefold:

original: atthi sukhindriyasampayutto, atthi dukkhindriyasampayutto, atthi somanassindriyasampayutto, atthi domanassindriyasampayutto, atthi upekkhindriyasampayutto.
analyzed: atthi sukha indriya sampayuttaḥ atthi dukkha indriya sampayuttaḥ atthi somanassa indriya sampayuttaḥ atthi domanassa indriya sampayuttaḥ atthi upekkhā indriya sampayuttaḥ
translated: there is that associated with the pleasure faculty, there is that associated with the pain faculty, there is that associated with the happiness faculty, there is that associated with the grief faculty, there is that associated with the equanimity faculty.
Thus the consciousness aggregate is fivefold.
The consciousness aggregate is sixfold:

original: cakkhuviññāṇaṁ, sotaviññāṇaṁ, ghānaviññāṇaṁ, jivhāviññāṇaṁ, kāyaviññāṇaṁ, manoviññāṇaṁ.
analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇa sota viññāṇa ghāna viññāṇa jivhā viññāṇa kāya viññāṇa manas viññāṇa
translated: eye-consciousness, ear-consciousness, nose-consciousness, tongue-consciousness, body-consciousness, mind-consciousness.
Thus the consciousness aggregate is sixfold.
The consciousness aggregate is sevenfold:

original: cakkhuviññāṇaṁ, sotaviññāṇaṁ, ghānaviññāṇaṁ, jivhāviññāṇaṁ, kāyaviññāṇaṁ, manodhātu, manoviññāṇadhātu.
analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇa sota viññāṇa ghāna viññāṇa jivhā viññāṇa kāya viññāṇa manas dhātu manas viññāṇa dhātu
translated: Eye-consciousness, ear-consciousness, nose-consciousness, tongue-consciousness, body-consciousness, mind-element, mind-consciousness-element.
In this way, the consciousness aggregate is sevenfold.
The consciousness aggregate is eightfold:

original: cakkhuviññāṇaṁ, sotaviññāṇaṁ, ghānaviññāṇaṁ, jivhāviññāṇaṁ, kāyaviññāṇaṁ atthi sukhasahagataṁ, atthi dukkhasahagataṁ, manodhātu, manoviññāṇadhātu.
analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇa sota viññāṇa ghāna viññāṇa jivhā viññāṇa kāya viññāṇaṃ atthi sukha sahagata atthi dukkha sahagata manaḥ dhātu manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu
translated: Eye-consciousness, ear-consciousness, nose-consciousness, tongue-consciousness, body-consciousness, either associated with pleasure or associated with pain, the mind-element, the mind-consciousness-element.
In this way, the consciousness aggregate is eightfold.
The consciousness aggregate is ninefold:

original: cakkhuviññāṇaṁ, sotaviññāṇaṁ, ghānaviññāṇaṁ, jivhāviññāṇaṁ, kāyaviññāṇaṁ, manodhātu, manoviññāṇadhātu atthi kusalo, atthi akusalo, atthi abyākato.
analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇa sota viññāṇa ghāna viññāṇa jivhā viññāṇa kāya viññāṇa manaḥ dhātu manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu atthi kusalaḥ atthi akusalaḥ atthi abyākataḥ
translated: Eye-consciousness, ear-consciousness, nose-consciousness, tongue-consciousness, body-consciousness, either associated with pleasure or associated with pain, the mind-element, the mind-consciousness-element, either wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate.
In this way, the consciousness aggregate is ninefold.
The consciousness aggregate is tenfold:🔽Eye-consciousness …
eye-consciousness …🔽

original: kāyaviññāṇaṁ atthi sukhasahagataṁ, atthi dukkhasahagataṁ, manodhātu, manoviññāṇadhātu atthi kusalaṁ, atthi akusalaṁ, atthi abyākataṁ.
analyzed: kāya viññāṇaṃ atthi sukha sahagata atthi dukkha sahagata manaḥ dhātu manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu atthi kusala atthi akusala atthi abyākata
translated: There is body-consciousness that is connected with pleasure, there is body-consciousness that is connected with pain, the mind-element, the mind-consciousness-element is wholesome, unwholesome, and indeterminate.
Thus the consciousness component is of ten kinds.
In one way the consciousness component is:
associated with contact.
In two ways the consciousness component is:
there is that which has a cause, there is that which is without a cause.
In three ways the consciousness component is:

original: atthi sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto, atthi dukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto, atthi adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto.
analyzed: atthi sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ atthi dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ atthi adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ
translated: connected with the pleasant feeling, connected with the painful feeling, connected with the neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling.

original: Atthi vipāko, atthi vipākadhammadhammo, atthi nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo.🔽Atthi upādinnupādāniyo, atthi anupādinnupādāniyo, atthi anupādinnaanupādāniyo.
analyzed: atthi vipākaḥ atthi vipāka dhamma dhammo atthi neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammo  atthi upādinnupādāniyaḥ atthi anupādinnupādāniyaḥ atthi anupādinna anupādāniyaḥ
translated: There is result, there is a state that has result, there is that which is neither result nor has result.🔽There is that which is clung to and causes clinging, there is that which is not clung to and causes clinging, there is that which is not clung to and does not cause clinging.

original: Atthi saṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko, atthi asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko, atthi asaṅkiliṭṭhaasaṅkilesiko.
analyzed: atthi saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ atthi a saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ atthi a saṅkiliṭṭha asaṅkilesikaḥ
translated: There is that which is corrupted and causes corruption, there is that which is not corrupted but causes corruption, there is that which is not corrupted and does not cause corruption.

original: Atthi savitakkasavicāro, atthi avitakkavicāramatto, atthi avitakkaavicāro.
analyzed: atthi sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ atthi a vitakka vicāra mattaḥ atthi a vitakka a vicāraḥ
translated: There is that which is accompanied by applied and sustained thought, that which is accompanied by neither.

original: Atthi pītisahagato, atthi sukhasahagato, atthi upekkhāsahagato.
analyzed: atthi pīti sahagataḥ atthi sukha sahagataḥ atthi upekkhā sahagataḥ
translated: There is that which is accompanied by rapture, that which is accompanied by pleasure, that which is accompanied by equanimity.

original: Atthi dassanena pahātabbo, atthi bhāvanāya pahātabbo, atthi neva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbo.🔽Atthi dassanena pahātabbahetuko, atthi bhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko, atthi neva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko.🔽Atthi ācayagāmī, atthi apacayagāmī, atthi nevācayagāmināpacayagāmī.
analyzed: atthi dassanena pahātabbaḥ atthi bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ atthi na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ  atthi dassanena pahātabba hetukaḥ atthi bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ atthi na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ  atthi ācaya gāmī atthi apacaya gāmī atthi na iva ācaya gāminā apacaya gāmī
translated: There is that which is to be given up through vision, that which is to be given up through development, that which is not to be given up.🔽There is that which has a cause that is to be given up through vision, that which has a cause that is to be given up through development, that which has a cause that is not to be given up.🔽There is that which leads to accumulation, that which leads to decrease, that which leads neither to accumulation nor to decrease.

original: Atthi sekkho, atthi asekkho, atthi nevasekkhanāsekkho.
analyzed: atthi sekkhaḥ atthi asekkhaḥ atthi neva sekkha na asekkhaḥ
translated: There is that which is for a trainee, that which is for one beyond training, that which is neither for a trainee nor for one beyond training.

original: Atthi paritto, atthi mahaggato, atthi appamāṇo.
analyzed: atthi parittaḥ atthi mahaggataḥ atthi appamāṇaḥ
translated: There is that which is limited, that which is exalted, that which is measureless.

original: Atthi parittārammaṇo, atthi mahaggatārammaṇo, atthi appamāṇārammaṇo.
analyzed: atthi paritta ārammaṇaḥ atthi mahaggata ārammaṇaḥ atthi appamāṇa ārammaṇaḥ
translated: There is that which has a limited object, that which has an exalted object, that which has a measureless object.

original: Atthi hīno, atthi majjhimo, atthi paṇīto.
analyzed: atthi hīnaḥ atthi majjhimaḥ atthi paṇītaḥ
translated: There is that which is inferior, that which is middling, that which is superior.

original: Atthi micchattaniyato, atthi sammattaniyato, atthi aniyato.
analyzed: atthi micchatta niyataḥ atthi sammatta niyataḥ atthi aniyataḥ
translated: There is that which is subject to wrong, that which is subject to right, that which is not subject to either.

original: Atthi maggārammaṇo, atthi maggahetuko, atthi maggādhipati.
analyzed: atthi magga ārammaṇaḥ atthi magga hetukaḥ atthi magga adhipati
translated: has a path as its object, is caused by a path, is dominant in a path.

original: Atthi uppanno, atthi anuppanno, atthi uppādī.🔽Atthi atīto, atthi anāgato, atthi paccuppanno.
analyzed: atthi uppannaḥ atthi anuppannaḥ atthi uppādī  atthi atītaḥ atthi anāgataḥ atthi paccuppannaḥ
translated: is produced, is not yet produced, is due to be produced.🔽is past, is future, is present.

original: Atthi atītārammaṇo, atthi anāgatārammaṇo, atthi paccuppannārammaṇo.
analyzed: atthi atīta ārammaṇaḥ atthi anāgata ārammaṇaḥ atthi paccuppanna ārammaṇaḥ
translated: has a past object, has a future object, has a present object.

original: Atthi ajjhatto, atthi bahiddho, atthi ajjhattabahiddho.
analyzed: atthi ajjhattaḥ atthi bahiddhaḥ atthi ajjhatta bahiddhaḥ
translated: is internal, is external, is both internal and external.

original: Atthi ajjhattārammaṇo, atthi bahiddhārammaṇo, atthi ajjhattabahiddhārammaṇo …pe….
analyzed: atthi ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ atthi bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ atthi ajjhatta bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ pe
translated: has an internal object, has an external object, has both internal and external objects.
The consciousness aggregate is of ten kinds in this way.
The consciousness aggregate is of one kind,
in that it is associated with contact.

analyzed: duvidhena viññāṇa kkhandho  atthi hetu sampayuttaḥ atthi hetu vippayuttaḥ
translated: The consciousness aggregate is of two kinds,🔽in that it is either associated with a cause or not associated with a cause.

original: Atthi na hetu sahetuko, atthi na hetu ahetuko.
analyzed: atthi na hetu sa hetukaḥ atthi na hetu ahetukaḥ
translated: It is either not a cause but has causes, or it is not a cause and has no causes.

original: Atthi lokiyo, atthi lokuttaro.🔽Atthi kenaci viññeyyo, atthi kenaci na viññeyyo.
analyzed: atthi lokiyaḥ atthi lokuttaro  atthi kenacid viññeyyaḥ atthi kenacid na viññeyyaḥ
translated: It is either mundane or supramundane.🔽It is either cognizable or not cognizable.
It is either subject to cankers or not subject to cankers.

analyzed: atthi āsava sampayutto atthi āsava vippayutto
translated: There is that associated with the taints, and there is that disassociated from the taints.

original: Atthi āsavavippayuttasāsavo, atthi āsavavippayuttaanāsavo.🔽Atthi saṁyojaniyo, atthi asaṁyojaniyo.🔽Atthi saṁyojanasampayutto, atthi saṁyojanavippayutto.
analyzed: atthi āsava vippayutta sāsavaḥ atthi āsava vippayutta anāsavaḥ  atthi sayojaniyaḥ atthi a sayojaniyaḥ  atthi sa yojana sampayutto atthi sa yojana vippayutto
translated: There is that disassociated from the taints that is subject to the taints, and there is that disassociated from the taints that is not subject to the taints.🔽There is that which causes fetters, and there is that which does not cause fetters.

original: Atthi saṁyojanavippayuttasaṁyojaniyo, atthi saṁyojanavippayuttaasaṁyojaniyo.🔽Atthi ganthaniyo, atthi aganthaniyo.
analyzed: atthi sayojana vippayutta sayojaniyo atthi sayojana vippayutta asayojaniyo  atthi ganthaniyo atthi a ganthaniyo
translated: There is that associated with fetters, and there is that disassociated from fetters.🔽There is that disassociated from fetters that causes fetters, and there is that disassociated from fetters that does not cause fetters.🔽There is that which causes bonds, and there is that which does not cause bonds.

original: Atthi ganthasampayutto, atthi ganthavippayutto.🔽Atthi ganthavippayuttaganthaniyo, atthi ganthavippayuttaaganthaniyo.
analyzed: atthi gantha sampayutto atthi gantha vippayutto  atthi gantha vippayutta ganthaniyaḥ atthi gantha vippayutta a ganthaniyaḥ
translated: There is that associated with bonds, and there is that disassociated from bonds.🔽There is that disassociated from bonds that causes bonds, and there is that disassociated from bonds that does not cause bonds.

original: Atthi oghaniyo, atthi anoghaniyo.🔽Atthi oghasampayutto, atthi oghavippayutto.
analyzed: atthi ogha niyaḥ atthi anogha niyaḥ  atthi ogha sampayutto atthi ogha vippayutto
translated: There is that which causes floods, and there is that which does not cause floods.🔽There is that associated with floods, and there is that disassociated from floods.

original: Atthi oghavippayuttaoghaniyo, atthi oghavippayuttaanoghaniyo.🔽Atthi yoganiyo, atthi ayoganiyo.
analyzed: atthi ogha vippayutta ogha niyaḥ atthi ogha vippayutta anogha niyaḥ  atthi yoganiyo atthi a yoganiyo
translated: There is that disassociated from floods that causes floods, and there is that disassociated from floods that does not cause floods.🔽There is that which causes bonds, and there is that which does not cause bonds.

analyzed: atthi yoga sampayutto atthi yoga vippayutto
translated: There is that associated with bonds, and there is that disassociated from bonds.

analyzed: atthi yoga vippayutta yoga niyo atthi yoga vippayutta a yoga niyo
translated: There is that which is connected with bonds and that which is not connected with bonds.

original: Atthi nīvaraṇiyo, atthi anīvaraṇiyo.🔽Atthi nīvaraṇasampayutto, atthi nīvaraṇavippayutto.
analyzed: atthi nīvaraṇiyaḥ atthi a nīvaraṇiyaḥ  atthi nīvaraṇa sampayutto atthi nīvaraṇa vippayutto
translated: There is that which is a hindrance and that which is not a hindrance.🔽There is that which is associated with hindrances and that which is not associated with hindrances.

analyzed: atthi nīvaraṇa vippayutta nīvaraṇiyo atthi nīvaraṇa vippayutta a nīvaraṇiyo
translated: There is that which is not associated with hindrances and is a hindrance and that which is not associated with hindrances and is not a hindrance.

original: Atthi parāmaṭṭho, atthi aparāmaṭṭho.🔽Atthi parāmāsasampayutto, atthi parāmāsavippayutto.
analyzed: atthi parāmaṭṭhaḥ atthi aparāmaṭṭhaḥ  atthi parāmāsa sampayutto atthi parāmāsa vippayutto
translated: There is that which is clung to and that which is not clung to.🔽There is that which is associated with clinging and that which is not associated with clinging.

analyzed: atthi parāmāsa vippayutta parāmaṭṭho atthi parāmāsa vippayutta aparāmaṭṭho
translated: There is that which is not associated with clinging and is clung to and that which is not associated with clinging and is not clung to.

original: Atthi upādinno, atthi anupādinno.🔽Atthi upādāniyo, atthi anupādāniyo.🔽Atthi upādānasampayutto, atthi upādānavippayutto.
analyzed: atthi upādinnaḥ atthi anupādinnaḥ  atthi upādāniyaḥ atthi anupādāniyaḥ  atthi upādāna sampayutto atthi upādāna vippayutto
translated: There is that which is acquired and that which is not acquired.🔽There is that which is subject to acquisition and that which is not subject to acquisition.🔽There is that which is associated with acquisition and that which is not associated with acquisition.

original: Atthi upādānavippayuttaupādāniyo, atthi upādānavippayuttaanupādāniyo.🔽Atthi saṅkilesiko, atthi asaṅkilesiko.
analyzed: atthi upādāna vippayutta aupādāniyaḥ atthi upādāna vippayutta anupādāniyaḥ  atthi saṅkilesikaḥ atthi asaṅkilesikaḥ
translated: There is that which is not associated with acquisition and is subject to acquisition and that which is not associated with acquisition and is not subject to acquisition.🔽There is that which is defiled and that which is undefiled.
There is that which is defiled and that which is undefiled.

analyzed: atthi kilesa sampayutto atthi kilesa vippayutto
translated: There is that which is associated with defilements, and there is that which is dissociated from defilements.

analyzed: atthi kilesa vippayutta saṅkilesiko atthi kilesa vippayutta asaṅkilesiko
translated: There is that which is dissociated from defilements but is corrupting, and there is that which is dissociated from defilements and is not corrupting.

original: Atthi dassanena pahātabbo, atthi na dassanena pahātabbo.🔽Atthi bhāvanāya pahātabbo, atthi na bhāvanāya pahātabbo.🔽Atthi dassanena pahātabbahetuko, atthi na dassanena pahātabbahetuko.
analyzed: atthi dassanena pahātabbo atthi na dassanena pahātabbo  atthi bhāvanāya pahātabbo atthi na bhāvanāya pahātabbo  atthi dassanena pahātabba hetukaḥ atthi na dassanena pahātabba hetukaḥ
translated: There is that which is to be given up through vision (of the First Path), and there is that which is not to be given up through vision (of the First Path).🔽There is that which is to be given up through development (of the rest of the Paths), and there is that which is not to be given up through development (of the rest of the Paths).🔽There is that which has a cause that is to be given up through vision (of the First Path), and there is that which has a cause that is not to be given up through vision (of the First Path).

original: Atthi bhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko, atthi na bhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko.
analyzed: atthi bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ atthi na bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ
translated: There is that which has a cause that is to be given up through development (of the rest of the Paths), and there is that which has a cause that is not to be given up through development (of the rest of the Paths).

analyzed: atthi sa vitakko atthi a vitakko
translated: There is that which is with thinking, and there is that which is without thinking.

original: Atthi savicāro, atthi avicāro.🔽Atthi sappītiko, atthi appītiko.🔽Atthi pītisahagato, atthi na pītisahagato.
analyzed: atthi sa vicāraḥ atthi avicāro  atthi sappītikaḥ atthi appītikaḥ  atthi pīti sahagataḥ atthi na pīti sahagataḥ
translated: There is that which is with pondering, and there is that which is without pondering.🔽There is that which is with happiness, and there is that which is without happiness.🔽There is that which is accompanied by happiness, and there is that which is not accompanied by happiness.

analyzed: atthi sukha sahagataḥ atthi na sukha sahagataḥ
translated: There is that which is accompanied by pleasure, and there is that which is not accompanied by pleasure.

original: Atthi upekkhāsahagato, atthi na upekkhāsahagato.🔽Atthi kāmāvacaro, atthi na kāmāvacaro.
analyzed: atthi upekkhā sahagataḥ atthi na upekkhā sahagataḥ  atthi kāmāvacaro atthi na kāmāvacaro
translated: There is that which is accompanied by equanimity, and there is that which is not accompanied by equanimity.🔽There is that which is of the sense-desire (realm), and there is that which is not of the sense-desire (realm).
There is that which is of the form (realm), and there is that which is not of the form (realm).

original: Atthi arūpāvacaro, atthi na arūpāvacaro, atthi pariyāpanno, atthi apariyāpanno.
analyzed: atthi arūpāvacaraḥ atthi na arūpāvacaraḥ atthi pariyāpannaḥ atthi apariyāpannaḥ
translated: There is the immaterial-sphere element, and there is the not-immaterial-sphere element.

original: Atthi niyyāniko, atthi aniyyāniko.🔽Atthi niyato, atthi aniyato.🔽Atthi sauttaro, atthi anuttaro.
analyzed: atthi niyyānikaḥ atthi aniyyānikaḥ  atthi niyataḥ atthi aniyataḥ  atthi sauttaro atthi anuttaro
translated: There is the element that is included, and there is the element that is not included.🔽There is the element that is bound up with the fetters, and there is the element that is not bound up with the fetters.🔽There is the element that is fixed, and there is the element that is unfixed.
There is the element that is higher, and there is the element that is not higher.🔽There is the element that is with conflict, and there is the element that is without conflict.
The consciousness element is threefold:

original: atthi kusalo, atthi akusalo, atthi abyākato …pe….
analyzed: atthi kusalaḥ atthi akusalaḥ atthi abyākataḥ pe
translated: there is the profitable, there is the unprofitable, there is the indeterminate.
Thus the consciousness element is of ten kinds.
The consciousness element is of one kind:
it is associated with contact.
The consciousness element is of two kinds:
there is the element that is with conflict, and there is the element that is without conflict.
The consciousness element is of three kinds:

original: atthi sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto, atthi dukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto, atthi adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto.
analyzed: atthi sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ atthi dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ atthi adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ
translated: it is associated with pleasant feeling, it is associated with painful feeling, it is associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling.

original: Atthi vipāko …pe… atthi ajjhattārammaṇo, atthi bahiddhārammaṇo, atthi ajjhattabahiddhārammaṇo …pe….
analyzed: atthi vipāko pe atthi ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ atthi bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ atthi ajjhatta bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ pe
translated: It is a resultant … it has internal objects … it has external objects … it has internal-and-external objects.
Thus the consciousness element is of ten kinds.
It is rooted in the difficult.
The consciousness aggregate is onefold:
It is associated with contact.
It is twofold:
There is that with cause and that without cause.
It is threefold:

original: atthi kusalo, atthi akusalo, atthi abyākato …pe….
analyzed: atthi kusalaḥ atthi akusalaḥ atthi abyākataḥ pe
translated: There is the profitable, the unprofitable, and the indeterminate. …
Thus the consciousness aggregate is tenfold.
The consciousness aggregate is onefold:
It is associated with contact.
It is twofold:

original: atthi hetusampayutto, atthi hetuvippayutto …pe… atthi saraṇo, atthi araṇo.
analyzed: atthi hetu sampayuttaḥ atthi hetu vippayuttaḥ pe atthi saraṇaḥ atthi araṇo
translated: There is that associated with cause and that dissociated from cause. … There is that with resistance and that without resistance.
It is threefold:

original: atthi kusalo, atthi akusalo, atthi abyākato …pe….
analyzed: atthi kusalaḥ atthi akusalaḥ atthi abyākataḥ pe
translated: There is the profitable, the unprofitable, and the indeterminate. …
Thus the consciousness aggregate is tenfold.
The consciousness aggregate is onefold:
It is associated with contact.
It is twofold:
There is that with cause and that without cause.
It is threefold:

original: atthi sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto, atthi dukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto, atthi adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto.
analyzed: atthi sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ atthi dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ atthi adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ
translated: Associated with pleasant feeling, associated with painful feeling, associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling.

original: Atthi vipāko …pe… atthi ajjhattārammaṇo, atthi bahiddhārammaṇo, atthi ajjhattabahiddhārammaṇo …pe….
analyzed: atthi vipāko pe atthi ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ atthi bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ atthi ajjhatta bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ pe
translated: Resultant … has an internal object … has an external object … has an external and internal object …
In this way, too, the consciousness aggregate is of ten kinds.
In one way, the consciousness aggregate is:
associated with contact.
In two ways, the consciousness aggregate is:

original: atthi hetusampayutto, atthi hetuvippayutto …pe… atthi saraṇo, atthi araṇo.
analyzed: atthi hetu sampayuttaḥ atthi hetu vippayuttaḥ pe atthi saraṇaḥ atthi araṇo
translated: associated with a cause, not associated with a cause … has a tangle, is without a tangle.
In three ways, the consciousness aggregate is:

original: atthi ajjhattārammaṇo, atthi bahiddhārammaṇo, atthi ajjhattabahiddhārammaṇo …pe….
analyzed: atthi ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ atthi bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ atthi ajjhatta bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ pe
translated: has an internal object, has an external object, has an external and internal object …
In this way, too, the consciousness aggregate is of ten kinds.
The triad root.
In one way, the consciousness aggregate is:
associated with contact.
In two ways, the consciousness aggregate is:
with cause, without cause.
In three ways, the consciousness aggregate is:

original: atthi kusalo, atthi akusalo, atthi abyākato …pe….
analyzed: atthi kusalaḥ atthi akusalaḥ atthi abyākataḥ pe
translated: there is what is skillful, there is what is unskillful, there is what is indeterminate. …
In this way, the consciousness aggregate is of ten kinds.
In one way, the consciousness aggregate is:
associated with contact.
In two ways, the consciousness aggregate is:

analyzed: atthi hetu sampayuttaḥ atthi hetu vippayuttaḥ
translated: there is what is associated with causes, there is what is not associated with causes.
In three ways, the consciousness aggregate is:

original: atthi sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto, atthi dukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto, atthi adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto …pe….
analyzed: atthi sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ atthi dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ atthi adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ pe
translated: associated with pleasant feeling, associated with painful feeling, associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling. …
In this way, the consciousness aggregate is of ten kinds.
In one way, the consciousness aggregate is:
associated with contact.
In two ways, the consciousness aggregate is:

original: atthi na hetu sahetuko, atthi na hetu ahetuko.
analyzed: atthi na hetu sa hetukaḥ atthi na hetu ahetukaḥ
translated: there is what is not a cause but has causes, there is what is not a cause and has no causes.
In three ways, the consciousness aggregate is:

original: atthi vipāko, atthi vipākadhammadhammo, atthi nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo …pe….
analyzed: atthi vipākaḥ atthi vipāka dhamma dhammo atthi neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammo pe
translated: there is result, there is what has the nature of result, there is what is neither result nor has the nature of result. …
In this way, the consciousness aggregate is of ten kinds.
In one way, the consciousness aggregate is:
associated with contact.
The consciousness aggregate is twofold:
there is that which is worldly and there is that which is transcendental.
The consciousness aggregate is threefold:

original: atthi upādinnupādāniyo, atthi anupādinnupādāniyo, atthi anupādinnaanupādāniyo …pe….
analyzed: atthi upādinnupādāniyaḥ atthi anupādinnupādāniyaḥ atthi anupādinna anupādāniyaḥ pe
translated: there is that which is clung to and related to the kinds of clinging, there is that which is not clung to but related to the kinds of clinging, and there is that which is not clung to nor related to the kinds of clinging. …
Thus the consciousness aggregate is tenfold.
The consciousness aggregate is singlefold:
it is associated with contact.
The consciousness aggregate is twofold:

original: atthi kenaci viññeyyo, atthi kenaci na viññeyyo.
analyzed: atthi kenacid viññeyyaḥ atthi kenacid na viññeyyaḥ
translated: there is that which is cognizable by some kind of consciousness and that which is not cognizable by some kind of consciousness.
The consciousness aggregate is threefold:

original: atthi saṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko, atthi asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko, atthi asaṅkiliṭṭhaasaṅkilesiko …pe….
analyzed: atthi saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ atthi a saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ atthi a saṅkiliṭṭha asaṅkilesikaḥ pe
translated: there is that which is defiled and related to defilements, there is that which is undefiled but related to defilements, and there is that which is undefiled and unrelated to defilements. …
Thus the consciousness aggregate is tenfold.
The consciousness aggregate is singlefold:
it is associated with contact.
The consciousness aggregate is twofold:
there is that which is subject to cankers and that which is free from cankers.
The consciousness aggregate is threefold:

original: atthi savitakkasavicāro, atthi avitakkavicāramatto, atthi avitakkaavicāro …pe….
analyzed: atthi sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ atthi a vitakka vicāra mattaḥ atthi a vitakka a vicāraḥ
translated: there is that which is accompanied by applied and sustained thought, that which is accompanied by neither applied nor sustained thought, and that which is accompanied by sustained thought but not by applied thought. …
So the consciousness aggregate is of ten kinds.
The consciousness aggregate is of one kind:
it is associated with contact.
It is of two kinds:

analyzed: atthi āsava sampayutto atthi āsava vippayutto
translated: there is that associated with taints and there is that dissociated from taints.
It is of three kinds:

original: atthi pītisahagato, atthi sukhasahagato, atthi upekkhāsahagato …pe….
