analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā vipākā siyā vipāka dhamma dhammā siyā nevavipāka navipāka dhamma dhammā  upādinnattika
translated: The four aggregates may be resultants, or states subject to resultant-consciousness, or neither resultant nor states subject to resultant-consciousness.🔽… Is clung-to?
The form aggregate may be clung-to and subject to clinging, or not clung-to and subject to clinging, or not clung-to and not subject to clinging.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā upādinnupādāniyā, siyā anupādinnupādāniyā, siyā anupādinnaanupādāniyā.🔽3.1.5. Saṅkiliṭṭhattika
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā upādinnu pādāniyā siyā anupādinnu pādāniyā siyā anupādinna anupādāniyā  saṅkiliṭṭhattika
translated: The four mental aggregates may be clung-to and subject to clinging, or not clung-to and subject to clinging, or not clung-to and not subject to clinging.🔽… Is defiled?
The form aggregate is undefiled and not a source of defilements.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā saṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesikā, siyā asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesikā, siyā asaṅkiliṭṭhaasaṅkilesikā.🔽3.1.6. Vitakkattika
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikā siyā asaṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikā siyā asaṅkiliṭṭha asaṅkilesikā  vitakkattika
translated: The four mental aggregates may be defiled and a source of defilements, or undefiled and a source of defilements, or undefiled and not a source of defilements.🔽… Has thinking?
The form aggregate is without thinking and without exploration.

original: Tayo khandhā siyā savitakkasavicārā, siyā avitakkavicāramattā, siyā avitakkaavicārā.
analyzed: tayo khandhā siyā sa vitakka sa vicārā siyā a vitakka vicāra mattā siyā a vitakka a vicārā
translated: Three aggregates may be with thinking and with exploration, or without thinking and with exploration only, or without thinking and without exploration.

original: Saṅkhārakkhandho siyā savitakkasavicāro, siyā avitakkavicāramatto, siyā avitakkaavicāro, siyā na vattabbo—“savitakkasavicāro”tipi, “avitakkavicāramatto”tipi, “avitakkaavicāro”tipi.🔽3.1.7. Pītittika
analyzed: saṅkhāra kkhandho siyā sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ siyā avitakka vicāra mattaḥ siyā avitakka avicāraḥ siyā na vattabbaḥ sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ itipi avitakka vicāra mattaḥ itipi avitakka avicāraḥ itipi  pītittika
translated: The volitional formations aggregate may be with thought and examination, or without thought and with only examination, or without thought and without examination, or it should not be said that it is with thought and examination, or without thought and with only examination, or without thought and without examination.🔽… with joy
The form aggregate should not be said

analyzed: pīti sahagatā utipi sukha sahagatā utipi upekkhā sahagatā utipi
translated: to be associated with joy, or with happiness, or with equanimity.

original: Vedanākkhandho siyā pītisahagato na sukhasahagato na upekkhāsahagato, siyā na vattabbo—“pītisahagato”ti.
analyzed: vedanā khandhaḥ siyā pīti sahagataḥ na sukha sahagataḥ na upekkhā sahagataḥ siyā na vattabbaḥ upīti sahagataḥ ti
translated: The feeling aggregate may be associated with joy but not with happiness or with equanimity, or it should not be said to be associated with joy.🔽Three aggregates may be associated with joy, or with happiness, or with equanimity, or it should not be said that they are associated with joy, or with happiness, or with equanimity.

original: Tayo khandhā siyā pītisahagatā, siyā sukhasahagatā, siyā upekkhāsahagatā, siyā na vattabbā—“pītisahagatā”tipi, “sukhasahagatā”tipi, “upekkhāsahagatā”tipi.🔽3.1.8. Dassanenapahātabbattika
analyzed: tayo khandhā siyā pīti sahagatā siyā sukha sahagatā siyā upekkhā sahagatā siyā na vattabbā pīti sahagatā atipi sukha sahagatā atipi upekkhā sahagatā atipi  dassanena apahātabba ttika
translated: … to be abandoned by seeing

original: Rūpakkhandho neva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbo.
analyzed: rūpakkhandhaḥ na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ
translated: The form aggregate is neither to be abandoned by seeing nor by keeping in being.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā dassanena pahātabbā, siyā bhāvanāya pahātabbā, siyā neva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbā.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā dassanena pahātabbā siyā bhāvanāya pahātabbā siyā na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbā
translated: The four aggregates may be given up by seeing, may be given up by development, may not be given up by seeing or by development.
... With cause to be given up by seeing, etc.

original: Rūpakkhandho neva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko.
analyzed: rūpakkhandhaḥ na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ
translated: The form aggregate has no cause to be given up by seeing or by development.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā dassanena pahātabbahetukā, siyā bhāvanāya pahātabbahetukā, siyā neva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbahetukā.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā dassanena pahātabba hetukā siyā bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukā siyā na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukā
translated: The four aggregates may have a cause to be given up by seeing, may have a cause to be given up by development, may have no cause to be given up by seeing or by development.
... With increase, etc.

analyzed: rūpakkhandhaḥ na iva ācaya gāminā apacaya gāmī
translated: The form aggregate has no increase or decrease.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā ācayagāmino, siyā apacayagāmino, siyā nevācayagāmināpacayagāmino.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā ācaya gāmino siyā apacaya gāmino siyā na iva ācaya gāminā apacaya gāmino
translated: The four aggregates may have increase or decrease, may have no increase or decrease.
... With training, etc.

original: Rūpakkhandho nevasekkhanāsekkho.🔽Cattāro khandhā siyā sekkhā, siyā asekkhā, siyā nevasekkhanāsekkhā.
analyzed: rūpakkhandho na iva sekkha na asekkhaḥ  cattāro khandhā siyā sekkhā siyā asekkhā siyā nevasekkhanā asekkhā
translated: The form aggregate is neither with training nor without training.
The four aggregates may be with training, may be without training, may be neither with training nor without training.🔽... Limited, etc.
The form aggregate is limited.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā parittā, siyā mahaggatā, siyā appamāṇā.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā parittā siyā mahaggatā siyā appamāṇā
translated: The four aggregates may be limited, may be exalted, may be immeasurable.
3.1.13. Limited-object

The form-constituent is not an object.🔽The four formless constituents may be limited-objects, exalted-objects, or measureless-objects, or they are not to be spoken of as limited-objects, exalted-objects, or measureless-objects.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā parittārammaṇā, siyā mahaggatārammaṇā, siyā appamāṇārammaṇā, siyā na vattabbā—“parittārammaṇā”tipi, “mahaggatārammaṇā”tipi, “appamāṇārammaṇā”tipi.🔽3.1.14. Hīnattika
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā paritta ārammaṇā siyā mahaggata ārammaṇā siyā appamāṇa ārammaṇā siyā na vattabbā aparitta ārammaṇā atipi mahaggata ārammaṇā atipi appamāṇa ārammaṇā atipi  hīnattika
translated: ... Inferior-type
The form-constituent is middling.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā hīnā, siyā majjhimā, siyā paṇītā.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā hīnā siyā majjhimā siyā paṇītā
translated: The four formless constituents may be inferior, middling, or superior.
... Wrongness-tied-type
The form-constituent is untied.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā micchattaniyatā, siyā sammattaniyatā, siyā aniyatā.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā micchatta niyatā siyā sammatta niyatā siyā aniyatā
translated: The four formless constituents may be tied to wrongness, tied to rightness, or untied.
... Path-object-type
The form-constituent is not an object.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā maggārammaṇā, siyā maggahetukā, siyā maggādhipatino, siyā na vattabbā—“maggārammaṇā”tipi, “maggahetukā”tipi, “maggādhipatino”tipi.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā magga ārammaṇā siyā magga hetukā siyā magga adhipatino siyā na vattabbā a magga ārammaṇā atipi magga hetukā atipi magga adhipatino tipi
translated: The four formless constituents may be objects of the path, causes of the path, or associated with the path, or they are not to be spoken of as objects of the path, causes of the path, or associated with the path.
... Arisen-type

original: Siyā uppannā, siyā anuppannā, siyā uppādino.
analyzed: siyā uppannā siyā anuppannā siyā uppādinaḥ
translated: They may be arisen, not yet arisen, or about to arise.
3.1.18. Past, future, present

original: Siyā atītā, siyā anāgatā, siyā paccuppannā.
analyzed: siyā atītā siyā anāgatā siyā paccuppannā
translated: They may be past, future, or present.
... With a past object
The form-constituent is not an object.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā atītārammaṇā, siyā anāgatārammaṇā, siyā paccuppannārammaṇā, siyā na vattabbā—“atītārammaṇā”tipi, “anāgatārammaṇā”tipi, “paccuppannārammaṇā”tipi.🔽3.1.20. Ajjhattattika
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā atīta ārammaṇā siyā anāgata ārammaṇā siyā paccuppanna ārammaṇā siyā na vattabbā atīta ārammaṇā atipi anāgata ārammaṇā atipi paccuppanna ārammaṇā atipi  ajjhattattika
translated: The four constituents may be with a past object, with a future object, with a present object, or they are not to be spoken of as with a past object, with a future object, or with a present object.🔽... Internal, external, or both

original: Siyā ajjhattā, siyā bahiddhā, siyā ajjhattabahiddhā.
analyzed: siyā ajjhattā siyā bahiddhā siyā ajjhatta bahiddhā
translated: They may be internal, external, or both.
... With an internal object
The form-constituent is not an object.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā ajjhattārammaṇā, siyā bahiddhārammaṇā, siyā ajjhattabahiddhārammaṇā,
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā ajjhatta ārammaṇā siyā bahiddha ārammaṇā siyā ajjhatta bahiddha ārammaṇā
translated: The four constituents may be with an internal object, with an external object, or with an internal and external object,

analyzed: siyā na vattabbā ajjhatta ārammaṇā atipi bahiddha ārammaṇā atipi ajjhatta bahiddha ārammaṇā atipi  sani dassana ttika
translated: or they are not to be spoken of as with an internal object, with an external object, or with an internal and external object.🔽... Visible, invisible, or not so classifiable
The four constituents are not visible and are not a sense-base.

original: Rūpakkhandho siyā sanidassanasappaṭigho, siyā anidassanasappaṭigho, siyā anidassanaappaṭigho.
analyzed: rūpa kkhandho siyā sa nidassana sappaṭighaḥ siyā anidassana sappaṭighaḥ siyā anidassana appaṭighaḥ
translated: The form-element may be both-with-object-of-consciousness-and-with-object, or it may be without-object-of-consciousness-and-with-object, or it may be without-object-of-consciousness-and-without-object.
… The dyads
… The causalities
Four aggregates are not causes.

original: Saṅkhārakkhandho siyā hetu, siyā na hetu.
analyzed: saṅkhāra kkhandho siyā hetu siyā na hetu
translated: The formations aggregate may be a cause or it may not be a cause.
The form aggregate is not a cause.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā sahetukā, siyā ahetukā.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā sahetukā siyā ahetukā
translated: Four aggregates may be with cause or may be without cause.
The form aggregate is dissociated from cause.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā hetusampayuttā, siyā hetuvippayuttā.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā hetu sampayuttā siyā hetu vippayuttā
translated: Four aggregates may be associated with cause or may be dissociated from cause.
The form aggregate should not be said to be

original: “hetu ceva sahetuko cā”tipi, “sahetuko ceva na ca hetū”tipi.
analyzed: hetu ca iva sa hetukaḥ sa hetukaḥ ca iva na ca
translated: either a cause and with cause or with cause and not a cause.
Three aggregates should not be said to be

original: “hetū ceva sahetukā cā”ti, siyā sahetukā ceva na ca hetū, siyā na vattabbā—“sahetukā ceva na ca hetū”ti.
analyzed: hetū ca iva sa hetukā ca ati siyā sa hetukā ca iva na ca hetū siyā na vattabbā a sahetukā ca iva na ca hetū ti
translated: either causes and with cause or with cause and not causes. They may be with cause and not a cause; or it should not be said that they are with cause and not a cause.

original: Saṅkhārakkhandho siyā hetu ceva sahetuko ca, siyā sahetuko ceva na ca hetu, siyā na vattabbo—“hetu ceva sahetuko cā”tipi, “sahetuko ceva na ca hetū”tipi.
analyzed: saṅkhāra kkhandho siyā hetu ca iva sa hetukaḥ ca siyā sa hetukaḥ ca iva na ca hetu siyā na vattabbaḥ uhetu ca iva sa hetukaḥ ca atipi sa hetukaḥ ca iva na ca hetu atipi
translated: The formations aggregate may be a cause and related to a cause, or it may be related to a cause but not a cause, or it may not be a cause and not related to a cause.

original: Rūpakkhandho na vattabbo—🔽“hetu ceva hetusampayutto cā”tipi, “hetusampayutto ceva na ca hetū”tipi.🔽Tayo khandhā na vattabbā—
analyzed: rūpa kkhandhaḥ na vattabbaḥ  hetu ca iva hetu sampayutto ca atipi hetu sampayuttaḥ ca iva na ca  tayaḥ khandhāḥ na vattabbā
translated: The form aggregate is not a cause related to a cause.

original: “hetū ceva hetusampayuttā cā”ti, siyā hetusampayuttā ceva na ca hetū, siyā na vattabbā—“hetusampayuttā ceva na ca hetū”ti.
analyzed: hetū ca iva hetu sampayuttā ca ati siyā hetu sampayuttā ca iva na ca hetū siyā na vattabbā a hetu sampayuttā ca iva na ca hetū ti
translated: The three aggregates are not causes related to a cause, but they may be related to a cause but not a cause, or they may not be a cause and not related to a cause.

original: Saṅkhārakkhandho siyā hetu ceva hetusampayutto ca, siyā hetusampayutto ceva na ca hetu, siyā na vattabbo—“hetu ceva hetusampayutto cā”tipi, “hetusampayutto ceva na ca hetū”tipi.
analyzed: saṅkhāra kkhandho siyā hetu ca iva hetu sampayutto ca siyā hetu sampayutto ca iva na ca hetu siyā na vattabbaḥ hetu ca iva hetu sampayutto ca atipi hetu sampayuttaḥ ca iva na ca hetu atipi
translated: The formations aggregate may be a cause related to a cause, or it may be related to a cause but not a cause, or it may not be a cause and not related to a cause.
The form aggregate is not a cause and is unrelated to a cause.

original: Tayo khandhā siyā na hetū sahetukā, siyā na hetū ahetukā.
analyzed: tayo khandhā siyā na hetū sa hetukā siyā na hetū ahetukā
translated: The three aggregates may be not a cause and related to a cause, or they may be not a cause and unrelated to a cause.

original: Saṅkhārakkhandho siyā na hetu sahetuko, siyā na hetu ahetuko, siyā na vattabbo—“na hetu sahetuko”tipi, “na hetu ahetuko”tipi.
analyzed: saṅkhāra kkhandho siyā na hetu sa hetukaḥ siyā na hetu ahetukaḥ siyā na vattabbaḥ na hetu sa hetukaḥ itipi na hetu ahetukaḥ itipi
translated: The formations aggregate may be without cause and related to causes, or without cause and unrelated to causes, or it may not be described as either without cause and related to causes or without cause and unrelated to causes.
… The short triad
With conditions, and formed.
Four aggregates are not visible.

analyzed: rūpakkhandho siyā sa nidassanaḥ siyā a nidassanaḥ
translated: The form aggregate may be visible or invisible.
Four aggregates are not impingements.

analyzed: rūpa kkhandho siyā sa paṭighaḥ siyā appaṭighaḥ
translated: The form aggregate may be an impingement or not an impingement.
The form aggregate is form.
Four aggregates are not form.
The form aggregate is mundane.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā lokiyā, siyā lokuttarā;
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā lokiyā siyā lokuttarā
translated: Four aggregates may be mundane or supramundane;
cognizable by some kinds of knowledge, not by others.
… The section on the effluents
Four aggregates are not effluents.

original: Saṅkhārakkhandho siyā āsavo, siyā no āsavo.
analyzed: saṅkhāra kkhandho siyā āsavaḥ siyā no āsavaḥ
translated: The formations aggregate may be an effluent or not an effluent.
The form aggregate is subject to cankers.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā sāsavā, siyā anāsavā.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā sa āsavā siyā anāsavā
translated: Four aggregates may be subject to cankers or free from cankers.
The form aggregate is unconnected with the cankers.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā āsavasampayuttā, siyā āsavavippayuttā.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā āsava sampayuttā siyā āsava vippayuttā
translated: The four aggregates may be connected to defilements or not connected to defilements.
The form aggregate is not to be spoken of

original: “āsavo ceva sāsavo cā”ti, sāsavo ceva no ca āsavo.
analyzed: āsavaḥ ca iva sāsavaḥ ca ati sāsavaḥ ca iva no ca āsavaḥ
translated: as a defilement and also as connected to defilements: it is connected to defilements but is not a defilement.
The three remaining aggregates are not to be spoken of

original: “āsavā ceva sāsavā cā”ti, siyā sāsavā ceva no ca āsavā, siyā na vattabbā—“sāsavā ceva no ca āsavā”ti.
analyzed: āsavā ca iva sāsavā ca ati siyā sāsavā ca iva no ca āsavā siyā na vattabbā asāsavā ca iva no ca āsavā ati
translated: as defilements and also as connected to defilements: they may be connected to defilements but are not defilements, or they are not to be spoken of as connected to defilements but are not defilements.🔽The formations aggregate is not to be spoken of

original: Saṅkhārakkhandho siyā āsavo ceva sāsavo ca, siyā sāsavo ceva no ca āsavo, siyā na vattabbo—“āsavo ceva sāsavo cā”tipi, “sāsavo ceva no ca āsavo”tipi.
analyzed: saṅkhāra kkhandho siyā āsavaḥ ca iva sāsavaḥ ca siyā sāsavaḥ ca iva no ca āsavo siyā na vattabbo āsavaḥ ca iva sāsavaḥ ca atipi sāsavaḥ ca iva no ca āsavaḥ tipi
translated: as a defilement and also as connected to defilements, or as connected to defilements but is not a defilement.
The form aggregate is not to be spoken of

original: “āsavo ceva āsavasampayutto cā”tipi, “āsavasampayutto ceva no ca āsavo”tipi.
analyzed: āsavo ca iva āsava sampayutto ca atipi āsava sampayutto ca iva no ca āsavo tipi
translated: as a defilement and also as connected to defilements, or as connected to defilements but is not a defilement.
The three remaining aggregates are not to be spoken of

original: “āsavā ceva āsavasampayuttā cā”ti, siyā āsavasampayuttā ceva no ca āsavā, siyā na vattabbā—“āsavasampayuttā ceva no ca āsavā”ti.
analyzed: āsavā ca iva āsava sampayuttā ca ati siyā āsava sampayuttā ca iva no ca āsavā siyā na vattabbā āsava sampayuttā ca iva no ca āsavā ati
translated: as defilements and also as connected to defilements: they may be connected to defilements but are not defilements, or they are not to be spoken of as connected to defilements but are not defilements.

original: Saṅkhārakkhandho siyā āsavo ceva āsavasampayutto ca, siyā āsavasampayutto ceva no
analyzed: saṅkhāra kkhandho siyā āsavo ca iva āsava sampayutto ca siyā āsava sampayutto ca iva no
translated: The formations aggregate may be a defilement and also related to a defilement,🔽or it may be related to a defilement but not a defilement,

original: ca āsavo, siyā na vattabbo—“āsavo ceva āsavasampayutto cā”tipi, “āsavasampayutto🔽ceva no ca āsavo”tipi.
analyzed: ca āsavaḥ siyā na vattabbaḥ āsavaḥ ca iva āsava sampayutto āsava sampayutto  ca iva naḥ ca āsava utipi
translated: or it may not be said to be a defilement and related to a defilement, or to be related to a defilement but not a defilement.

analyzed: rūpa kkhandho āsava vippayutta sa āsavaḥ
translated: The form aggregate is not related to the defilements but has defilements.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā āsavavippayuttasāsavā, siyā āsavavippayuttaanāsavā, siyā na vattabbā—“āsavavippayuttasāsavā”tipi, “āsavavippayuttaanāsavā”tipi.🔽3.2.4. Saṁyojanagocchaka
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā āsava vippayutta sāsavā siyā āsava vippayutta anāsavā siyā na vattabbā āsava vippayutta sāsavā atipi āsava vippayutta anāsavā atipi  sayojana gocchaka
translated: The four remaining aggregates may be not related to the defilements but have defilements, or they may be not related to the defilements and be free from defilements, or they may not be said to be not related to the defilements but have defilements, or to be not related to the defilements and be free from defilements.
... The four remaining aggregates are not bonds.

original: Saṅkhārakkhandho siyā saṁyojanaṁ, siyā no saṁyojanaṁ.
analyzed: saṅkhāra kkhandho siyā sayojana siyā no sayojana
translated: The formations aggregate may be a bond or it may not be a bond.
The form aggregate is connected to the bonds.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā saṁyojaniyā, siyā asaṁyojaniyā.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā sayojaniyā siyā asayojaniyā
translated: The four remaining aggregates may be connected to the bonds or not connected to the bonds.
The form aggregate is unconnected to the defilements.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā saṁyojanasampayuttā, siyā saṁyojanavippayuttā.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā sayojana sampayuttā siyā sayojana vippayuttā
translated: The four remaining aggregates may be connected to the defilements or unconnected to the defilements.
The form aggregate cannot be said to be

original: “saṁyojanañceva saṁyojaniyo cā”ti, saṁyojaniyo ceva no ca saṁyojanaṁ.
analyzed: sayojanam ca iva sayojaniyaḥ ca ati sayojaniyaḥ ca iva no ca
translated: “A fetter and also fetter-connected,” and “fetter-connected but not a fetter.”
The three aggregates should not be stated

original: “saṁyojanā ceva saṁyojaniyā cā”ti, siyā saṁyojaniyā ceva no ca saṁyojanā, siyā na vattabbā—“saṁyojaniyā ceva no ca saṁyojanā”ti.🔽Saṅkhārakkhandho siyā saṁyojanañceva saṁyojaniyo ca, siyā saṁyojaniyo ceva no ca🔽saṁyojanaṁ, siyā na vattabbo—“saṁyojanañceva saṁyojaniyo cā”tipi, “saṁyojaniyo ceva
analyzed: sayojanā ca iva sayojaniyā ca ati siyā sayojaniyā ca iva no ca sayojanā siyā na vattabbā asayojaniyā ca iva no ca sayojanā ati  saṅkhāra kkhandho siyā sayojanaṃ ca iva sayojaniyaḥ ca siyā sayojaniyaḥ ca iva no ca  siyā na vattabba usayojanaṃ ca iva sayojaniyaḥ ca atipi sayojaniyaḥ ca iva
translated: in the way beginning “a fetter and also fetter-connected.” They may be stated as “fetter-connected but not a fetter” or as “not to be stated as ‘fetter-connected but not a fetter.’”

The formations aggregate may be stated as “a fetter and also fetter-connected,” or as “fetter-connected but not a fetter,” or as “not to be stated as ‘a fetter and also fetter-connected’ or as ‘fetter-connected but not a fetter.’”
The form aggregate should not be stated

original: “saṁyojanañceva saṁyojanasampayutto cā”tipi, “saṁyojanasampayutto ceva no ca saṁyojanan”tipi.
analyzed: sayojanam ca iva sayojana sampayuttaḥ sayojana sampayuttaḥ ca iva no ca
translated: in the way beginning “a fetter and also associated with a fetter.” It may be stated as “associated with a fetter but not a fetter” or as “not to be stated as ‘associated with a fetter but not a fetter.’”

The three aggregates should not be stated🔽in the way beginning “a fetter and also associated with a fetter.” They may be stated as “associated with a fetter but not a fetter” or as “not to be stated as ‘associated with a fetter but not a fetter.’”

original: “saṁyojanā ceva saṁyojanasampayuttā cā”ti, siyā saṁyojanasampayuttā ceva no ca saṁyojanā, siyā na vattabbā—“saṁyojanasampayuttā ceva no ca saṁyojanā”ti.
analyzed: sayojanā ca iva sayojana sampayuttā ca ati siyā sayojana sampayuttā ca iva no ca sayojanā siyā na vattabbā a sayojana sampayuttā ca iva no ca sayojanā ati
translated: “The fetters and also connected with the fetters,” it may be that they are connected with the fetters but are not fetters, or it may be that they are not to be spoken of as connected with the fetters but are not fetters.

original: Saṅkhārakkhandho siyā saṁyojanañceva saṁyojanasampayutto ca, siyā saṁyojanasampayutto
analyzed: saṅkhāra kkhandho siyā sayojanam ca iva sayojana sampayutto ca siyā sayojana sampayutto
translated: The formations aggregate is either a fetter and also connected with the fetters, or it is connected with the fetters

original: ceva no ca saṁyojanaṁ, siyā na vattabbo—“saṁyojanañceva saṁyojanasampayutto cā”tipi,🔽“saṁyojanasampayutto ceva no ca saṁyojanan”tipi.
analyzed: ca iva no ca siyā na vattabbaḥ usayojana ca iva sayojana sampayuttaḥ ca atipi  sayojana sampayuttaḥ ca iva no ca
translated: but is not a fetter, or it is not to be spoken of as a fetter and also connected with the fetters.
The form aggregate is unconnected with the fetters but related to the fetters.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā saṁyojanavippayuttasaṁyojaniyā, siyā saṁyojanavippayuttaasaṁyojaniyā,
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā sayojana vippayutta sayojaniyā siyā sayojana vippayutta asayojaniyā
translated: The four remaining aggregates are either unconnected with the fetters but related to the fetters, or unconnected with the fetters and unrelated to the fetters,

analyzed: siyā na vattabbā a sayojana vippayutta sayojaniyā atipi sayojana vippayutta a sayojaniyā atipi  gantha gocchaka
translated: or they are not to be spoken of as unconnected with the fetters but related to the fetters, or as unconnected with the fetters and unrelated to the fetters.
… The four aggregates are not bonds.

original: Saṅkhārakkhandho siyā gantho, siyā no gantho.
analyzed: saṅkhāra kkhandho siyā gantho siyā no gantho
translated: The formations aggregate is either a bond or not a bond.
The form aggregate is that which is knotted.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā ganthaniyā, siyā aganthaniyā.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā ganthaniyā siyā a ganthaniyā
translated: The four remaining aggregates may be that which is knotted or not that which is knotted.
The form aggregate is unconnected with the knots.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā ganthasampayuttā, siyā ganthavippayuttā.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā gantha sampayuttā siyā gantha vippayuttā
translated: The four remaining aggregates may be connected with the knots or unconnected with the knots.
The form aggregate is not to be spoken of

original: “gantho ceva ganthaniyo cā”ti, ganthaniyo ceva no ca gantho.
analyzed: gantho ca iva ganthaniyaḥ ca ati ganthaniyaḥ ca iva no ca gantho
translated: as a knot and that which is knotted. It is only that which is knotted, not a knot.
The three remaining aggregates are not to be spoken of

original: “ganthā ceva ganthaniyā cā”ti, siyā ganthaniyā ceva no ca ganthā, siyā na vattabbā—“ganthaniyā ceva no ca ganthā”ti.
analyzed: ganthā ca iva ganthaniyā ca ati siyā ganthaniyā ca iva no ca ganthā siyā na vattabbā a ganthaniyā ca iva no ca ganthā ati
translated: as knots and that which is knotted. They may be only that which is knotted, not a knot, or they are not to be spoken of as only that which is knotted, not a knot.

original: Saṅkhārakkhandho siyā gantho ceva ganthaniyo ca, siyā ganthaniyo ceva no ca gantho, siyā na vattabbo—“gantho ceva ganthaniyo cā”tipi, “ganthaniyo ceva no ca gantho”tipi.
analyzed: saṅkhāra kkhandho siyā ganthaḥ ca iva ganthaniyo ca siyā ganthaniyaḥ ca iva no ca gantho siyā na vattabbo ganthaḥ ca iva ganthaniyaḥ ca atipi ganthaniyaḥ ca iva no ca gantho tipi
translated: The formations aggregate may be a knot and that which is knotted, or only that which is knotted, not a knot, or it is not to be spoken of as a knot and that which is knotted, or as only that which is knotted, not a knot.
The form aggregate is not to be spoken of

original: “gantho ceva ganthasampayutto cā”tipi, “ganthasampayutto ceva no ca gantho”tipi.
analyzed: gantho ca iva gantha sampayutto ca atipi gantha sampayutto ca iva no ca gantho tipi
translated: as a knot and connected with the knots, or as connected with the knots, not a knot.
The three aggregates are not to be spoken of as both bonds and what is bound up with bonds.🔽They may be bound up with bonds but are not bonds.

original: “ganthā ceva ganthasampayuttā cā”ti, siyā ganthasampayuttā ceva no ca ganthā, siyā na vattabbā—“ganthasampayuttā ceva no ca ganthā”ti.
analyzed: ganthā ca iva gantha sampayuttā ca ati siyā gantha sampayuttā ca iva no ca ganthā siyā na vattabbā a gantha sampayuttā ca iva no ca ganthā ati
translated: They may not be spoken of as bound up with bonds but not bonds.

original: Saṅkhārakkhandho siyā gantho ceva ganthasampayutto ca, siyā ganthasampayutto ceva🔽no ca gantho, siyā na vattabbo—“gantho ceva ganthasampayutto cā”tipi, “ganthasampayutto
analyzed: saṅkhāra kkhandho siyā gantho ca iva gantha sampayutto ca siyā gantha sampayutto ca iva  no ca gantho siyā na vattabbo gantho ca iva gantha sampayutto ca atipi gantha sampayutto
translated: The formations aggregate is either a bond and also bound up with bonds,🔽or it is bound up with bonds but is not a bond,🔽or it is not to be spoken of as a bond and also bound up with bonds,

analyzed: ca iva no ca gantha utipi
translated: or it is not to be spoken of as bound up with bonds but not a bond.
The form aggregate is unconnected with bonds and not subject to bonds.🔽The four aggregates are either unconnected with bonds and not subject to bonds,🔽or unconnected with bonds and subject to bonds,

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā ganthavippayuttaganthaniyā, siyā ganthavippayuttaaganthaniyā, siyā na vattabbā—“ganthavippayuttaganthaniyā”tipi, “ganthavippayuttaaganthaniyā”tipi.🔽3.2.6. Oghayoganīvaraṇagocchaka
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā gantha vippayutta ganthaniyā siyā gantha vippayutta aganthaniyā siyā na vattabbā a gantha vippayutta ganthaniyā atipi gantha vippayutta a ganthaniyā atipi  ogha yoga nīvaraṇa gocchaka
translated: or they are not to be spoken of as unconnected with bonds and not subject to bonds.🔽… Are subject to the floods, bonds, hindrances, and the aggregates
The four aggregates are not floods …
not bonds …
not hindrances.

original: Saṅkhārakkhandho siyā nīvaraṇaṁ, siyā no nīvaraṇaṁ.
translated: The formations aggregate may be a Hindrance or it may not be a Hindrance.
The form aggregate is subject to Hindrances.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā nīvaraṇiyā, siyā anīvaraṇiyā.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā nīvaraṇiyā siyā a nīvaraṇiyā
translated: Four aggregates are either subject to Hindrances or not subject to Hindrances.
The form aggregate is unconnected with Hindrances.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā nīvaraṇasampayuttā, siyā nīvaraṇavippayuttā.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā nīvaraṇa sampayuttā siyā nīvaraṇa vippayuttā
translated: Four aggregates are either connected with Hindrances or unconnected with Hindrances.
The form aggregate is not to be spoken of

original: “nīvaraṇañceva nīvaraṇiyo cā”ti, “nīvaraṇiyo ceva no ca nīvaraṇaṁ”.
analyzed: nīvaraṇam ca iva nīvaraṇiyaḥ ca ati nīvaraṇiyaḥ ca iva no ca nīvaraṇa
translated: as a Hindrance and also subject to Hindrances, or as subject to Hindrances and not a Hindrance.
Three aggregates are not to be spoken of

original: “nīvaraṇā ceva nīvaraṇiyā cā”ti, siyā nīvaraṇiyā ceva no ca nīvaraṇā, siyā na vattabbā—“nīvaraṇiyā ceva no ca nīvaraṇā”ti.
analyzed: nīvaraṇā ca iva nīvaraṇiyā ca ati siyā nīvaraṇiyā ca iva no ca nīvaraṇā siyā na vattabbā a nīvaraṇiyā ca iva no ca nīvaraṇā ati
translated: as Hindrances and also subject to Hindrances; they may be subject to Hindrances and not Hindrances, or they are not to be spoken of as subject to Hindrances and not Hindrances.

original: Saṅkhārakkhandho siyā nīvaraṇañceva nīvaraṇiyo ca, siyā nīvaraṇiyo ceva no ca nīvaraṇaṁ, siyā na vattabbo—“nīvaraṇañceva nīvaraṇiyo cā”tipi, “nīvaraṇiyo ceva no ca nīvaraṇan”tipi.
analyzed: saṅkhāra kkhandho siyā nīvaraṇam ca iva nīvaraṇiyo ca siyā nīvaraṇiyo ca iva no ca nīvaraṇa siyā na vattabbo nīvaraṇam ca iva nīvaraṇiyo ca atipi nīvaraṇiyo ca iva no ca nīvaraṇantipi
translated: The formations aggregate may be a Hindrance and also subject to Hindrances, or it may be subject to Hindrances and not a Hindrance, or it is not to be spoken of as a Hindrance and also subject to Hindrances, or as subject to Hindrances and not a Hindrance.🔽The form aggregate is not to be spoken of
The form aggregate should not be said to be:🔽🔽

original: “nīvaraṇañceva nīvaraṇasampayutto cā”tipi, “nīvaraṇasampayutto ceva no ca nīvaraṇan”tipi.
analyzed: nīvaraṇam ca iva nīvaraṇa sampayuttaḥ ca atipi nīvaraṇa sampayuttaḥ ca iva no ca nīvaraṇantipi
translated: “An obstruction and connected with an obstruction” and “connected with an obstruction but not an obstruction”.

original: Tayo khandhā na vattabbā—🔽“nīvaraṇā ceva nīvaraṇasampayuttā cā”ti, siyā nīvaraṇasampayuttā ceva no ca nīvaraṇā, siyā na vattabbā—“nīvaraṇasampayuttā ceva no ca nīvaraṇā”ti.
analyzed: tayaḥ khandhāḥ na vattabbā  nīvaraṇā ca iva nīvaraṇa sampayuttā ca ati siyā nīvaraṇa sampayuttā ca iva no ca nīvaraṇā siyā na vattabbā a nīvaraṇa sampayuttā ca iva no ca nīvaraṇā ati
translated: The three aggregates are not to be spoken of🔽as “obstructions and connected with obstructions”. The form and consciousness aggregates are not obstructions.

original: Saṅkhārakkhandho siyā nīvaraṇañceva nīvaraṇasampayutto ca, siyā nīvaraṇasampayutto🔽ceva no ca nīvaraṇaṁ, siyā na vattabbo—“nīvaraṇañceva nīvaraṇasampayutto cā”tipi,
analyzed: saṅkhāra kkhandho siyā nīvaraṇam ca iva nīvaraṇa sampayutto ca siyā nīvaraṇa sampayutto  ca iva no ca nīvaraṇa siyā na vattabbaḥ nīvaraṇam ca iva nīvaraṇa sampayuttaḥ ca atipi
translated: The formations aggregate is either an obstruction and connected with an obstruction, or connected with an obstruction but not an obstruction, or it is not to be spoken of as “an obstruction and connected with an obstruction”

analyzed: nīvaraṇa sampayuttaḥ ca iva no ca
translated: or as “connected with an obstruction but not an obstruction”.
The form aggregate is unconnected with the obstructions and not an obstruction.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā nīvaraṇavippayuttanīvaraṇiyā, siyā nīvaraṇavippayuttaanīvaraṇiyā, siyā na vattabbā—“nīvaraṇavippayuttanīvaraṇiyā”tipi, “nīvaraṇavippayuttaanīvaraṇiyā”tipi.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā nīvaraṇa vippayutta nīvaraṇiyā siyā nīvaraṇa vippayutta anīvaraṇiyā siyā na vattabbā a nīvaraṇa vippayutta nīvaraṇiyā atipi nīvaraṇa vippayutta a nīvaraṇiyā atipi
translated: The three remaining aggregates are either unconnected with the obstructions and not an obstruction, or unconnected with the obstructions and an obstruction, or they are not to be spoken of as “unconnected with the obstructions and not an obstruction” or as “unconnected with the obstructions and an obstruction”.
3.2.9. The basis of adherences
Four aggregates are not adherences.

original: Saṅkhārakkhandho siyā parāmāso, siyā no parāmāso.
analyzed: saṅkhāra kkhandhaḥ siyā parāmāsaḥ siyā no parāmāsaḥ
translated: The formations aggregate may be an adherence or it may not be an adherence.
The form aggregate is adhered to.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā parāmaṭṭhā, siyā aparāmaṭṭhā.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā parāmaṭṭhā siyā aparāmaṭṭhā
translated: Four aggregates may be adhered to or they may not be adhered to.
The form aggregate is unconnected with adherences.

original: Tayo khandhā siyā parāmāsasampayuttā, siyā parāmāsavippayuttā.
analyzed: tayo khandhā siyā parāmāsa sampayuttā siyā parāmāsa vippayuttā
translated: Three aggregates may be connected with or unconnected with adherences.

original: Saṅkhārakkhandho siyā parāmāsasampayutto, siyā parāmāsavippayutto, siyā na vattabbo—“parāmāsasampayutto”tipi, “parāmāsavippayutto”tipi.
analyzed: saṅkhāra kkhandho siyā parāmāsa sampayuttaḥ siyā parāmāsa vippayuttaḥ siyā na vattabbaḥ parāmāsa sampayuttaḥ tipi parāmāsa vippayuttaḥ tipi
translated: The formations aggregate may be connected with adherences, or it may be unconnected with adherences, or it is not to be spoken of as connected with adherences or unconnected with adherences.
The form aggregate is not to be spoken of

original: “parāmāso ceva parāmaṭṭho cā”ti, parāmaṭṭho ceva no ca parāmāso.
analyzed: parāmāso ca iva parāmaṭṭho ca ati parāmaṭṭho ca iva no ca parāmāso
translated: as an adherence and also adhered to, but it is adhered to and not an adherence.
Three aggregates are not to be spoken of

original: “parāmāsā ceva parāmaṭṭhā cā”ti, siyā parāmaṭṭhā ceva no ca parāmāsā, siyā na vattabbā—“parāmaṭṭhā ceva no ca parāmāsā”ti.
analyzed: parāmāsā ca iva parāmaṭṭhā ca ati siyā parāmaṭṭhā ca iva no ca parāmāsā siyā na vattabbā aparāmaṭṭhā ca iva no ca parāmāsā ati
translated: as adherences and also adhered to, but they may be adhered to and not adherences, or it is not to be spoken of as adhered to and not an adherence.

original: Saṅkhārakkhandho siyā parāmāso ceva parāmaṭṭho ca, siyā parāmaṭṭho ceva no ca parāmāso, siyā na vattabbo—“parāmāso ceva parāmaṭṭho cā”tipi, “parāmaṭṭho ceva no ca parāmāso”tipi.
analyzed: saṅkhāra khandho siyā parāmāsaḥ ca iva parāmaṭṭho ca siyā parāmaṭṭho ca iva no ca parāmāso siyā na vattabba uparāmāsaḥ ca iva parāmaṭṭho ca atipi parāmaṭṭho ca iva no ca parāmāsaḥ itipi
translated: The formations aggregate may be clinging and clung to, or it may be clung to but not clinging, or it may not be stated as either clinging and clung to or clung to but not clinging.
The form aggregate is not subject to cankers but is clung to.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā parāmāsavippayuttaparāmaṭṭhā, siyā parāmāsavippayuttaaparāmaṭṭhā, siyā na vattabbā—“parāmāsavippayuttaparāmaṭṭhā”tipi, “parāmāsavippayuttaaparāmaṭṭhā”tipi.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā parāmāsa vippayutta parāmaṭṭhā siyā parāmāsa vippayutta aparāmaṭṭhā siyā na vattabbā a parāmāsa vippayutta parāmaṭṭhā atipi parāmāsa vippayutta aparāmaṭṭhā atipi
translated: Four aggregates may be not subject to cankers and clung to, or not subject to cankers and not clung to, or they may not be stated as either not subject to cankers and clung to or not subject to cankers and not clung to.
... The second section on the long version
The form aggregate is not an object.
Four aggregates are objects.
The consciousness aggregate is cognizance.
Four aggregates are not cognizance.
Three aggregates are mental.
Two aggregates are not mental.
Three aggregates are associated with cognizance.
The form aggregate is dissociated from cognizance.
The consciousness aggregate is not stated as either

analyzed: cittena sampayuttaḥ tipi cittena vippayuttaḥ tipi
translated: “Associated with the mind” and “not associated with the mind”.
Three of the aggregates are mixed with the mind.
The form aggregate is not mixed with the mind.
The consciousness aggregate is not to be spoken of

analyzed: cittena sasaṭṭhaḥ tipi cittena visasaṭṭhaḥ tipi
translated: as “mixed with the mind” or “not mixed with the mind”.
Three of the aggregates are originated by the mind.
The consciousness aggregate is not originated by the mind.

original: Rūpakkhandho siyā cittasamuṭṭhāno, siyā no cittasamuṭṭhāno.
analyzed: rūpa kkhandho siyā citta samuṭṭhānaḥ siyā no citta samuṭṭhānaḥ
translated: The form aggregate may be originated by the mind or not originated by the mind.
Three of the aggregates are conjoined with the mind.
The consciousness aggregate is not conjoined with the mind.

original: Rūpakkhandho siyā cittasahabhū, siyā no cittasahabhū.
analyzed: rūpakkhandho siyā citta sahabhū siyā no citta sahabhū
translated: The form aggregate may be conjoined with the mind or not conjoined with the mind.
Three of the aggregates are subject to change in accordance with the mind.
The consciousness aggregate is not subject to change in accordance with the mind.

original: Rūpakkhandho siyā cittānuparivatti, siyā no cittānuparivatti.
analyzed: rūpakkhandho siyā citta anuparivatti siyā no citta anuparivatti
translated: The form aggregate may be subject to change in accordance with the mind or not subject to change in accordance with the mind.
Three of the aggregates are mixed with the mind and originated by the mind.
Two of the aggregates are not mixed with the mind and not originated by the mind.
Three of the aggregates are mixed with the mind, originated by the mind, and conjoined with the mind.
Two aggregates are not conjoined with consciousness, but are originated by consciousness.

analyzed: tayo khandhāḥ citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāna anuparivattinaḥ
translated: Three aggregates are both conjoined with consciousness and originated by consciousness.
Two aggregates are not conjoined with consciousness, but are originated by consciousness.
The consciousness aggregate is internal.
Three aggregates are external.

analyzed: rūpa khandho siyā ajjhattikaḥ siyā bāhiraḥ
translated: The form aggregate may be either internal or external.
... With clinging as object
Four aggregates are without clinging.

original: Rūpakkhandho siyā upādā, siyā no upādā, siyā upādinnā, siyā anupādinnā.
analyzed: rūpakkhandho siyā upādā siyā no upādā siyā upādinnā siyā anupādinnā
translated: The form aggregate may be with clinging or without clinging, may be clung to or not clung to.
Four aggregates are without clinging.

original: Saṅkhārakkhandho siyā upādānaṁ, siyā no upādānaṁ.
analyzed: saṅkhāra kkhandho siyā upādāna siyā no upādāna
translated: The formations aggregate may be with clinging or without clinging.
The form aggregate is subject to clinging.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā upādāniyā, siyā anupādāniyā.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā upādāniyā siyā anupādāniyā
translated: Four aggregates may be subject to clinging or not subject to clinging.
The form aggregate is unconnected with clinging.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā upādānasampayuttā, siyā upādānavippayuttā.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā upādāna sampayuttā siyā upādāna vippayuttā
translated: Four aggregates may be connected with clinging or unconnected with clinging.
The form aggregate cannot be said to be either connected with clinging or unconnected with clinging.

original: “upādānañceva upādāniyo cā”ti, upādāniyo ceva no ca upādānaṁ.
analyzed: upādānam ca iva upādāniyā ca ati upādāniyā ca iva no ca upādāna
translated: “clinging and also connected to clinging”: connected to clinging but not clinging.
The three aggregates are not to be spoken of

original: “upādānañceva upādāniyā cā”ti, siyā upādāniyā ceva no ca upādānā, siyā na vattabbā—“upādāniyā ceva no ca upādānā”ti.
analyzed: upādānam ca iva upādāniyā ca ati siyā upādāniyā ca iva no ca upādānā siyā na vattabbā aupādāniyā ca iva no ca upādānā ati
translated: as “clinging and also connected to clinging.” The mental-data aggregate may be connected to clinging but not clinging; or it may not be spoken of as “connected to clinging but not clinging.”

original: Saṅkhārakkhandho siyā upādānañceva upādāniyo ca, siyā upādāniyo ceva no ca upādānaṁ, siyā na vattabbo—“upādānañceva upādāniyo cā”tipi, “upādāniyo ceva no ca upādānan”tipi.
analyzed: saṅkhāra khandho siyā upādānam ca iva upādāniyo ca siyā upādāniyo ca iva no ca upādāna siyā na vattabbo upādānam ca iva upādāniyo ca atipi upādāniyo ca iva no ca upādānam tipi
translated: The formations aggregate may be clinging and also connected to clinging; or it may be connected to clinging but not clinging; or it may not be spoken of as “clinging and also connected to clinging” or as “connected to clinging but not clinging.”
The form aggregate is not to be spoken of

original: “upādānañceva upādānasampayutto cā”tipi, “upādānasampayutto ceva no ca upādānan”tipi.
analyzed: upādānam ca iva upādāna sampayuttaḥ ca atipi upādāna sampayuttaḥ ca iva no ca upādānam tipi
translated: as “clinging and also associated with clinging” or as “associated with clinging but not clinging.”
The three aggregates are not to be spoken of

original: “upādānā ceva upādānasampayuttā cā”ti, siyā upādānasampayuttā ceva no ca upādānā, siyā na vattabbā—“upādānasampayuttā ceva no ca upādānā”ti.
analyzed: upādānā ca iva upādāna sampayuttā ca ati siyā upādāna sampayuttā ca iva no ca upādānā siyā na vattabbā upādāna sampayuttā ca iva no ca upādānā ati
translated: as “clinging and also associated with clinging.” The mental-data aggregate may be associated with clinging but not clinging; or it may not be spoken of as “associated with clinging but not clinging.”

original: Saṅkhārakkhandho siyā upādānañceva upādānasampayutto ca, siyā upādānasampayutto ceva🔽no ca upādānaṁ, siyā na vattabbo—“upādānañceva upādānasampayutto cā”tipi, “upādānasampayutto
analyzed: saṅkhāra kkhandho siyā upādānam ca iva upādāna sampayutto ca siyā upādāna sampayutto ca iva  no ca upādāna siyā na vattabbaḥ upādānam ca iva upādāna sampayutto ca atipi upādāna sampayutto
translated: The formations aggregate may be a clinging and also related to a clinging,🔽or it may be related to a clinging

analyzed: ca iva naḥ ca upādāna ntipi
translated: but not a clinging, or it may not be classifiable as either a clinging and related to a clinging or related to a clinging but not a clinging.
The form aggregate is not related to a clinging but has clinging as its object.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā upādānavippayuttaupādāniyā, siyā upādānavippayuttaanupādāniyā, siyā na vattabbā—“upādānavippayuttaupādāniyā”tipi, “upādānavippayuttaanupādāniyā”tipi.
analyzed: cattāro khandhāḥ siyā upādāna vippayutta aupādāniyā siyā upādāna vippayutta anupādāniyā siyā na vattabbā a upādāna vippayutta aupādāniyā atipi upādāna vippayutta anupādāniyā atipi
translated: The four immaterial aggregates may be not related to a clinging but have clinging as their object, or they may be not related to a clinging and not have clinging as their object, or they may not be classifiable as either not related to a clinging but having clinging as their object or not related to a clinging and having clinging as their object.
... The classes of defilements
The four aggregates are not defilements.

original: Saṅkhārakkhandho siyā kileso, siyā no kileso.
analyzed: saṅkhāra kkhandho siyā kilesaḥ siyā no kilesaḥ
translated: The formations aggregate may be a defilement or not a defilement.
The form aggregate is subject to defilement.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā saṅkilesikā, siyā asaṅkilesikā.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā saṅkilesikā siyā asaṅkilesikā
translated: The four aggregates may be subject to defilement or not subject to defilement.
The form aggregate is undefiled.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā saṅkiliṭṭhā, siyā asaṅkiliṭṭhā.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā saṅkiliṭṭhā siyā asaṅkiliṭṭhā
translated: The four aggregates may be defiled or undefiled.
The form aggregate is unconnected with defilements.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā kilesasampayuttā, siyā kilesavippayuttā.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā kilesa sampayuttā siyā kilesa vippayuttā
translated: The four aggregates may be either associated with defilements or dissociated from defilements.
The form aggregate is not to be spoken of

original: “kileso ceva saṅkilesiko cā”ti, saṅkilesiko ceva no ca kileso.
analyzed: kilesaḥ ca iva saṅkilesikaḥ ca ati saṅkilesikaḥ ca iva no ca kilesaḥ
translated: as either a defilement or something defiled by it; it is only defiled by it.
The three remaining aggregates are not to be spoken of

original: “kilesā ceva saṅkilesikā cā”ti, siyā saṅkilesikā ceva no ca kilesā, siyā na vattabbā—“saṅkilesikā ceva no ca kilesā”ti.
analyzed: kilesā ca iva saṅkilesikā ca ati siyā saṅkilesikā ca iva no ca kilesā siyā na vattabbā asaṅkilesikā ca iva no ca kilesā ati
translated: as either defilements or things defiled by defilements; they may be things defiled by defilements but not defilements themselves, or they are not to be spoken of as such.🔽The formations aggregate is not to be spoken of

original: Saṅkhārakkhandho siyā kileso ceva saṅkilesiko ca, siyā saṅkilesiko ceva no ca kileso, siyā na vattabbo—“kileso ceva saṅkilesiko cā”tipi, “saṅkilesiko ceva no ca kileso”tipi.
analyzed: saṅkhāra khandho siyā kileso ca iva saṅkilesiko ca siyā saṅkilesiko ca iva no ca kileso siyā na vattabba ukileso ca iva saṅkilesiko ca atipi saṅkilesiko ca iva no ca kileso tipi
translated: as either a defilement or something defiled by it; it may be defiled by defilements but not a defilement itself, or it is not to be spoken of as such.
The form aggregate is not to be spoken of

original: “kileso ceva saṅkiliṭṭho cā”tipi, “saṅkiliṭṭho ceva no ca kileso”tipi.
analyzed: kileso ca iva saṅkiliṭṭho ca atipi saṅkiliṭṭhaḥ ca iva no ca kileso tipi
translated: as either a defilement or something defiled by it; it may be defiled by defilements but not a defilement itself, or it is not to be spoken of as such.

The three remaining aggregates are not to be spoken of🔽as either defilements or things defiled by defilements; they may be things defiled by defilements but not defilements themselves, or they are not to be spoken of as such.

original: “kileso ceva saṅkiliṭṭhā cā”ti, siyā saṅkiliṭṭhā ceva no ca kilesā, siyā na vattabbā—“saṅkiliṭṭhā ceva no ca kilesā”ti.
analyzed: kileso ca iva saṅkiliṭṭhā ca ati siyā saṅkiliṭṭhā ca iva no ca kilesā siyā na vattabbā asaṅkiliṭṭhā ca iva no ca kilesā ati
translated: “Both defilements and defiled” may be defiled but are not defilements, or they are neither.

original: Saṅkhārakkhandho siyā kileso ceva saṅkiliṭṭho ca, siyā saṅkiliṭṭho ceva no ca kileso, siyā na vattabbo—“kileso ceva saṅkiliṭṭho cā”tipi, “saṅkiliṭṭho ceva no ca kileso”tipi.
analyzed: saṅkhāra kkhandho siyā kileso ca iva saṅkiliṭṭho ca siyā saṅkiliṭṭho ca iva no ca kileso siyā na vattabbokilesaḥ ca iva saṅkiliṭṭho ca atipi saṅkiliṭṭho ca iva no ca kileso tipi
translated: The formations aggregate may be a defilement and also defiled, or it may be defiled but not a defilement, or it may not be either a defilement or defiled.
The form aggregate

original: “kileso ceva kilesasampayutto cā”tipi, “kilesasampayutto ceva no ca kileso”tipi.
analyzed: kileso ca iva kilesa sampayutto ca atipi kilesa sampayutto ca iva no ca kileso tipi
translated: is not to be spoken of as a defilement and also associated with defilements, or as associated with defilements but not a defilement.
The three remaining aggregates

original: “kilesā ceva kilesasampayuttā cā”ti, siyā kilesasampayuttā ceva no ca kilesā, siyā na vattabbā—“kilesasampayuttā ceva no ca kilesā”ti.
analyzed: kilesā ca iva kilesa sampayuttā ca ati siyā kilesa sampayuttā ca iva no ca kilesā siyā na vattabbā akilesa sampayuttā ca iva no ca kilesā ati
translated: are not to be spoken of as defilements and also associated with defilements, but they may be associated with defilements but are not defilements, or they are neither.

original: Saṅkhārakkhandho siyā kileso ceva kilesasampayutto ca, siyā kilesasampayutto ceva
analyzed: saṅkhāra kkhandho siyā kileso ca iva kilesa sampayutto ca siyā kilesa sampayutto ca iva
translated: The formations aggregate may be a defilement and also associated with defilements,

original: no ca kileso, siyā na vattabbo—“kileso ceva kilesasampayutto cā”tipi, “kilesasampayutto
analyzed: no ca kilesaḥ siyā na vattabba ukileso ca iva kilesa sampayutto ca ati pi kilesa sampayutto
translated: and not a defilement. It may be said of it that it is neither a defilement nor associated with a defilement.

analyzed: ca iva no ca kilesa utipi
translated: It may be said of it that it is associated with a defilement but not a defilement.

The form aggregate is not a defilement but is subject to defilement.🔽The four remaining aggregates may be not a defilement but subject to defilement, not a defilement nor subject to defilement, or it may not be said of them that they are not a defilement but subject to defilement.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā kilesavippayuttasaṅkilesikā, siyā kilesavippayuttaasaṅkilesikā, siyā na vattabbā—“kilesavippayuttasaṅkilesikā”tipi, “kilesavippayuttaasaṅkilesikā”tipi.🔽3.2.13. Piṭṭhiduka
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā kilesa vippayutta saṅkilesikā siyā kilesa vippayutta asaṅkilesikā siyā na vattabbā a kilesa vippayutta saṅkilesikā atipi kilesa vippayutta asaṅkilesikā atipi  piṭṭhiduka
translated: ... The back section
The form aggregate is not to be given up through vision.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā dassanena pahātabbā, siyā na dassanena pahātabbā.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā dassanena pahātabbā siyā na dassanena pahātabbā
translated: The four remaining aggregates may be to be given up through vision or not to be given up through vision.
The form aggregate is not to be given up through development.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā bhāvanāya pahātabbā, siyā na bhāvanāya pahātabbā.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā bhāvanāya pahātabbā siyā na bhāvanāya pahātabbā
translated: The four remaining aggregates may be to be given up through development or not to be given up through development.
The form aggregate is not caused to be given up through vision.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā dassanena pahātabbahetukā, siyā na dassanena pahātabbahetukā.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā dassanena pahātabba hetukā siyā na dassanena pahātabba hetukā
translated: The four remaining aggregates may be caused to be given up through vision or not caused to be given up through vision.
The form-constituent is not a cause to be given up through development.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā bhāvanāya pahātabbahetukā, siyā na bhāvanāya pahātabbahetukā.
analyzed: cattāro khandhāḥ siyā bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukā siyā na bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukā
translated: Four constituents are either a cause to be given up through development or not a cause to be given up through development.
The form-constituent is without applied thought.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā savitakkā, siyā avitakkā.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā sa vitakkā siyā a vitakkā
translated: Four constituents are either with applied thought or without applied thought.
The form-constituent is without sustained thought.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā savicārā, siyā avicārā.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā sa vicārā siyā avicārā
translated: Four constituents are either with sustained thought or without sustained thought.

original: Rūpakkhandho appītiko, cattāro khandhā siyā sappītikā, siyā appītikā.
analyzed: rūpa khandho appītikaḥ cattāro khandhā siyā sa pītikā siyā appītikā
translated: The form-constituent is without rapture. Four constituents are either with rapture or without rapture.
The form-constituent is not accompanied by rapture.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā pītisahagatā, siyā na pītisahagatā.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā pīti sahagatā siyā na pīti sahagatā
translated: Four constituents are either accompanied by rapture or not accompanied by rapture.
Two constituents are not accompanied by pleasure.

original: Tayo khandhā siyā sukhasahagatā, siyā na sukhasahagatā.
analyzed: tayo khandhā siyā sukha sahagatā siyā na sukha sahagatā
translated: Three constituents are either accompanied by pleasure or not accompanied by pleasure.
Two constituents are not accompanied by equanimity.

original: Tayo khandhā siyā upekkhāsahagatā, siyā na upekkhāsahagatā.
analyzed: tayo khandhā siyā upekkhā sahagatā siyā na upekkhā sahagatā
translated: Three constituents are either accompanied by equanimity or not accompanied by equanimity.
The form-constituent is of the sense-sphere.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā kāmāvacarā, siyā na kāmāvacarā.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā kāmāvacarā siyā na kāmāvacarā
translated: Four constituents are either of the sense-sphere or not of the sense-sphere.
The form-aggregate is not of the form-world.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā rūpāvacarā, siyā na rūpāvacarā.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā rūpāvacarā siyā na rūpāvacarā
translated: Four aggregates may be of the form-world or not of the form-world.
The form-aggregate is not of the formless-world.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā arūpāvacarā, siyā na arūpāvacarā.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā arūpāvacarā siyā na arūpāvacarā
translated: Four aggregates may be of the formless-world or not of the formless-world.
The form-aggregate is included.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā pariyāpannā, siyā apariyāpannā.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā pariyāpannā siyā apariyāpannā
translated: Four aggregates may be included or not included.
The form-aggregate is not leading-on.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā niyyānikā, siyā aniyyānikā.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā niyyānikā siyā a niyyānikā
translated: Four aggregates may be leading-on or not leading-on.
The form-aggregate is not determined.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā niyatā, siyā aniyatā.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā niyatā siyā aniyatā
translated: Four aggregates may be determined or not determined.
The form-aggregate is not higher.🔽Four aggregates may be higher or not higher.🔽The form-aggregate is not free from the cankers.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā sauttarā, siyā anuttarā.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā sauttarā siyā anuttarā
translated: Four aggregates may be free from the cankers or not free from the cankers.
The form-aggregate is not a dispute.

original: Cattāro khandhā siyā saraṇā, siyā araṇāti.
analyzed: cattāro khandhā siyā saraṇā siyā araṇā ati
translated: Four aggregates may be a dispute or not a dispute.
Questions and answers.
The analysis of the aggregates is finished.
